description:
Been coming here for a while now. Simple, no-frills Mexican joint located conveniently close in the Outer Sunset/Parkside area. 

Things to get:
I'm a fan of the El Bronco Burrito (pretty much their take on the La Taq burrito with the whole "no rice" concept. Meat selection is a bit limited, but the carne asada is always a solid choice. 

For about 6 bucks, you get a big bag of home-fried tortilla chips and guacamole. Great for a last-minute watch party for any sporting event that won't break the bank. 

Ambiance:
Don't expect much dine-in options here. They are very limited in seats, so  to-go is definitely the best way to go. 

Parking:
Good luck. Residential is slim, you might have to park a block or two away.
author: Tyler D.

description:
I am a San Franciscan, had good and lousy burritos.
This place is special to me because my friend's mom opened it in the early 80's.
Today I had someone pick me up a burrito since they were close by and I was simply disappointed.  Zero flavor, zero taste, too much beans and simply disappointing.
So if this is because I had high expections and they were not met, then it is what it is.
Sadly, it was a waste of calories
Odly, the people who brought me the burrito enjoyed theirs and said that it was just fine and that I am over reacting, I can be but man it had no flavor, perhaps its the method of preparing the food.  It is not what it was before and I feel there is no love in this burrito. 
OK thats enough
author: Michael N.

description:
Second time I came here to grab quick dinner. Both times I got disappointed.,I ordered super burrito wtt grilled chicken and chip and salsa on the side. Each time they gave my orders only burrito and chips. Not sure if the cashier didn't really understand me; on which case they should try to listen carefully instead of rushing things. No smile, no greetings. Service is meh. The cashier and the person taking order should really try to listen. I'm not about toe at chips without salsa. The burrito itself tasted ok. Nothing special here. I rather go to Gordo for more tastier burrito. I won't go back here even though it's close to my home. 

I would not recommend this place. Instead go to Gordo on 9th between Irving and Lincoln - they have the best super burrito for less than $10.
author: Jas L.

description:
One of my hidden gem burrito spots in San Francisco!! Nestled a few blocks down from 19th Avenue, El Burrito express is my go to spot when I'm craving a NorCal Burrito, aka a burrito with some French fries in it! 

Friendly reminder! For those who haven't been in a while, El Burrito express is still there. I myself got a bit confused when I saw a sign that said "EBX" outside, thinking it was another long time San Francisco restaurant taken over by some new age overpriced winery. Fear not, it's still there, just has a new look! 

Anyways, the burrito was great per usual! The carne Asada was delicious, and the burrito size is beyond enough for your average human, and I am not an average size.. I require a good amount of food to be satisfied, and this one always leaves me satisfied. Comes with chips and their tamatillo (green sauce) is very good as well. Enjoy!!
author: John James M.

description:
Was around the corner looking for a quick bite to eat when I found this place. The location is currently getting a fast lift out front, so it may be a little hard to find if you are driving by for the first time. It is a small place with only a few stools to sit on if you decide to dine in, most people seem to do take out, which I recommend as it gets a little crowded. 

Craving for a burrito and seeing other previous reviews and recommendations, I decided to try the El Norcal. This come with the fixings - carne asada, french fries, cheddar cheese, sour cream, guac and salsa. The burrito itself wasn't bad but definitely not my first choice. As I'm mission district faithful when it comes to taquerias. Being there aren't a ton of mexican spots in the Sunset district, this seemed to be a neighborhood favorite. 

If your in the area looking for some mexican food, I would recommend. Otherwise, I would go further to mission. Though, they had a pretty good variety on their menu, that I wouldn't mind trying more of in the future.
author: Lauren P.

description: Been coming here since I was little and definitely a good plae to go if you're in the neighborhood. Not a dine-in kind of place, but for a really good price, you get what you want + a bag of chips!
author: Carrie L.

description: I tried their breakfast burrito w/ chorizo for the first and last time last Thursday. Very unappetizing. The chorizo was so over-cooked it was like eating crispy burned flakes and it overwhelmed the eggs. NOT worth the $12.
author: Ed C.

description: First time trying Mexican food in the bay after living near the border for most of my life. Disappointed. It's overpriced; 1 small fish taco for $5.75+tax, and undercooked. Decent at best service with short answers when I asked what they recommended.
author: Danica N.

description:
Found myself in the Sunset during a shift right before my lunch break and was feeling mighty hungry. My partner found that we were near this little burrito joint. Definitely glad he managed to find it.

It's a small restaurant, fairly nondescript. There's some limited seating inside but there are large benches outside which are perfectly suitable for eating your burrito. 

Walking in I was immediately overcome with surprise and excitement over their extensive menu! They have virtually every kind of burrito you could ever want, plentiful options for the meat-eating, seafood loving, or vegetarian. Of course they have other standard Mexican fare aside from burritos, but really how can you not get one here? I struggled to choose just one, but opted for the Terrapin which had soyrizo along with black beans, avocado, veggies, etc. It was large, juicy, and delicious! The kitchen is open and you can see that they are constantly cooking up ingredients fresh. House made chips come with your order and you can request red or green salsa. All employees were super helpful and friendly, as I was sitting outside eating my burrito I was making a bit of a mess (recall the juiciness) an employee noticed and brought me a plate - great service!

Looking forward to visiting again so I can try more of their menu!
author: Megan A.

description:
I have been wanting a san diego style burrito, so I decided to give this place a try.

Looking at the menu that other people posted, I was excited to try their Norcal burrito. This came with fries, carne asada, sour cream, guacamole, and their special sauce. For $10 I think the price is decent comparing this to Gordos.. 

When I got my burrito, I was shocked at how big it was. Usually the burritos I get in the city are perfect for one meal but this one was more than just one meal (almost as big as my Mexican Coke bottle)!! That's crazy. This burrito is well worth $10, the fries, carne asada, sour cream and guac together was amazing! This satisfied the craving I was having. 


Next time I am coming back to try their shrimp version of this burrito.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Delicioso!

I absolutely love this place! I first discovered El Burrito when I first started dating my boyfriend. He used to work right across this place and their whole office got their food here. Since then I have been back almost every few times a month for a good year now. My boyfriend is Mexican and he says this is the closest to authentic Mexican food he's had around the area. And trust me, he is very critical of Mexican food. 

The food here is very affordable for the amount of food you get (and you get huge portions). Most standard tacos, burritos are under $10. Every order includes free chips because they make a lot of them everyday. It's quite a small place, so it does get really busy, and food is cooked to order, so there is quite a bit of wait. Make sure to avoid coming during lunch time, and from 6pm until they close at 9pm. There's also regular french fries, as well as sweet potato fries on the menu. As for drinks, they have traditional Mexican drinks, such as horchata and Mexican bottled sodas. Did I mention they have vegetarian/vegan options? You can order veggie fajitas, or a soyrizo burrito (vegan chorizo).

The service here is non-existent. They're usually too busy handling a lot orders, and making awesome food, so they're not going to wait on you hand and foot. They basically take your order, they cook it, and prepare it. And there's nothing wrong with that! It's all about the food! People need to lighten up! This isn't exactly Bobby Flay's restaurant. It's a small joint for your Mexican cravings. Stop acting bougie!

TIP: Ask for more chips and they'll give it to you for free! They make tons of fresh batches everyday, and they need to get rid of it somehow!
author: Oliver B.

description:
This place recently renovated so it has a great modern feel to what it was before! 
My 3 stars are more for the service and food quality that they have. Although it is a quick to-go place and I love coming here for the cravings, it would be more organized since you cant tell if someones in line, waiting, or waiting in general since the staff in front are taking phone orders. Food is ok, but at the end of the day it fits the bill for the hunger!
author: Julia T.

description: Great food great service local spot in and out. Mexican food great menu. The restaurant been here for over 30 yrs. very limited parking
author: Edgar L.

description: I hate to do this because I come here with my friends quite often.  But, today, I have to write this.  I ordered a carne asada  burrito to go and I started eating in my car.  About 5 blocks later, I realize the burrito smelled aweful, not sure what that stinch was(made me want to puke though).  So, I had to bring it back.  They didn't apologize and they made me feel like I'm the trouble maker.  They did give me my money back, but, with an attitude and they refuse to believe me.
author: Paul L.

description:
The Burrito here if you get the basic, meat, rice and beans is about $6 which is a good price.

They have the saucy stewed juicy moist chicken, which is why burritos in SF Nor Cal are often better than LA So Cal, who tends to go grilled and dry.

The place gets HOT inside because of the grill and small space

The service is friendly.

Being from outside of SF, if you don't know, now you know... if you want a bag for your food and didn't bring one, you can and will have to pay to buy one.  That's the one thing about the liberally green too eco conscious rules of San Francisco (who, at restaurants also charges a surcharge fee to pay for their employees health insurance, so you're paying for food, tax, insurance and are also expected to tip for service too!) that is hurting many restaurants relationships with their customers.

Parking is about karma and timing but overall isn't too hard or bad here.
author: Rick S.

description:
I usually dislike posts that "rant" about one bad experience, but due to a lack of decent burrito locations in the sunset, I've frequented this location a handful of times. I've had one good burrito experience here, and I keep chasing that high. Maybe it was a distant wet burrito dream.

My recent visit was definitely my last, and I advise you to go elsewhere, even Chipotle. I ordered two burritos, and both were made in such a careless and lazy manner that each burrito felt like this flaccid floppy tortilla log of goop. 

Also didn't help that one burrito was ordered with carne asada, add rice, no beans. 
Result: They forgot the meat, added beans, no rice.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
Fish burrito available. Check. Free chips with every burrito order. Check check. Homemade hot sauces. You get the point. Check check check. 

Honestly, this spot has always got long lines. My educated assumption was that it'd be legit. Especially for the price they're charging! The fish burrito came out to $13 after tax. Geezus. For that price, I mind as well go across town to a legit spot where I know I can get an amazing fish burrito. 

Anyways, it's nice that they give you free chips and salsa. But a lot of other spots do this as well. Sadly, my burrito lacked much flavor. The fajitas and fresh avocado were a nice touch, but the fish was barely seasoned. No char. No nothing. The rest of the burrito was black beans and rice. 

Unless I'm feeling SUPER lazy about going across town, I wouldn't come back here. You can obv get much better burritos elsewhere for a more decent price than this. 3 stars
author: Jennifer L.

description: I read reviews about this place even though i used to come here a lot with my cousin 2 decades ago when i was in college... Their price used to be super affordable... so after a long break, i yelped them and decided to give them a shot... Ordered El Norcal Burrito... I paid about $10 something plus chips and hot salsa... but omgosh The burrito is comparable to El Farollito's definitely one of the best burrito i have ever had... i think the flavor is better than what i used to have decades ago  Definitely will come back for more specialty burritos they have in the menu... Trust me if you check this place, be conservative on first try and just order the El Norcal Burrito! You thank me later!
author: Dedy G.

description: Good local Mexican food. Although they can be slow in service and they get busy at lunch. El gordo is also the next best.
author: Andrew M.

description: The qualities of the burritos here is definitely worth coming for; delicious and generous in size. I had the NorCal and the breakfast burrito over the past week and both rocked. The salsa was good and chips on the side was nice.
author: Jason S.

description:
Good burritos. I used to frequent this place a lot. Wait times are a bit long, about 15-20 minutes from the time you order until you can pick it up. The employees are nice and the horchata is delicious.

They take orders in advance through Eat24, so I tried that once, but a random person in line decided to yell at me for "not waiting in line like everybody else" when I tried to pick it up. I haven't been there since, I'm simply not interested in having that kind of experience again.
author: Richard K.

description: Best burrito in the neighborhood.  One of the best in the Bay Area.  I've been going here for 10 years and their quality is uniformly excellent.
author: Jordan K.

description:
The burritos here satisfy my burrito craving. This is a local joint for lunch and dinner. I see a lot of pick up orders around 6:30pm to 8pm so I generally avoid that time frame if possible.

Notable mentions - Norcal burrito, super steak burrito, enchilada plate, shrimp taco salad

If you want fries, they can serve you some fries on the side too!
author: Sam Y.

description:
Went here and checked out food they were making they have huge burritos, so I ordered one I ordered the vegetarian mix. For some reason it was 1/2 the size of a reg burrito. The size of a soda can.
Was not good for $10 $8.80 plus tax
I won't be back.
author: Rod D.

description:
This place is the bomb! I've been coming here for years and there's a reason why.

I love their Cali Burrito and even though EBX raised their prices a bit recently, it's still a great tasting and quality sized burrito for a pretty common San Francisco burrito price. This place is usually pretty busy so I never come here without calling in and picking up my food.

Yes, the store can be hectic at times and it's hard to tell who is and who isn't in line, but if you just ask the people standing then it's not a big deal. I don't see why people complain about that so much
author: Brian B.

description:
This place possibly has one of the BEST burritos I've ever had.  Their Norcal Burrito is the best one but don't make the same mistake I did of eating the whole thing in one sitting, it is huge! 

The only reason it doesn't get 5 starts is that the carne asada fries aren't all that great, I'm from Southern California so I'm used to a huge portion of fries with the works which they don't offer.

Otherwise the service is usually exceptional, it does get packed from time to time but that is to be expected from a place with amazing food.
author: Christine H.

description: Back in the day (say, the 1990s), this was the ONLY Mexican place in the Sunset (back when it was just the Sunset, and not 15 micro-neighborhoods). We used to swing by in high school after swim practices because they had huge, cheap burritos--it is well-described as a "no-frills burrito joint." Get your food to go; you may wait a while, but the burritos are tasty and big.
author: Matt C.

description:
BAJACAL!! Best burrito award. 

Their salsa is always fresh and so delicious on everything. These wonderful people work really hard and are extremely consistent. 

Brb going to swim in burrito heaven
author: Natalie W.

description:
Long ago, a friend of mine from San Diego told me the legend of the "California burrito," a Frankenstein-like abomination of nature that includes FRENCH FRIES instead of rice.  I assumed it was just a tall tale--how would that even work, from a scientific/architectural standpoint?

Then I moved to the Sunset and went to El Burrito Express, where they sell burritos that contain french fries.  

French fries.  On burritos.  And you don't even have to go to San Diego.
author: Jacob K.

description:
There is an older woman that works here and if she makes you a burrito it will be one of the best things that happens in your life. Anyone else makes it and it will be alright. Sometimes the cheese isn't melted or the burrito will be rolled wrong and you'll get a bite full of just guacamole, but worse things can happen.

Look for the lady in her 50s and time your order right!
author: Nicholas S.

description:
2.5 stars.  Many time I've passed by El Burrito Express on the L going down Taraval.  I've always noticed a line out the door, so I thought it must be legit.  Made it a point to stop by to pick up a burrito for late lunch on a Saturday.  Still, it was busy as ever even well after 1pm.  The shop is small and has really little seating, maybe 5 stools at the small window bar.  Given the fact, most people would opt for take out.  The menu is extensive with almost every mix and match combo for burritos, tacos and plates possible.  Everything is inexpensive and the portions are huge.  Staff is courteous and efficient.  

I ordered the El Bronco with carnitas, regular size.  The burrito was huge and I couldn't finish it in one sitting.  It came with chips and salsa as well.  All for $5.50.  So why the sub-par rating? I really hate to be the nay-sayer here, but the whole beans and carnitas were just way too salty.  I didn't enjoy the burrito as much as I wanted to.  Maybe I came on an off day or the heavy salt hand at EBE is just not my cup of tea.  My husband ordered the El Burrito with carne and it didn't seem nearly as salty.  In any event, I am willing to give EBE one more try.  Will see if it's any different than my first experience.  Overall, affordable and gigantic portions for a quick Mexican meal, which is difficult to find in the Sunset.  Can satisfy your craving if you don't have time to make it out to the Mission for the real deal taquerias.
author: Liv A.

description: El Burrito Express is always my go-to place when I am craving some authentic Mexican food. First off, their service is always top notch and they are quick. You can call in an order when you are two minutes away, and when you get there it will be ready for you. My personal favorite is the shredded chicken burrito with everything. The shredded chicken is always a great call.
author: Cathal C.

description:
The food here is alright. I've heard pretty good things about it before coming in and I had a real bad hankering for a burrito one night and this was the only taqueria (that I knew of) in the area. It's super tiny inside with a few counter seats available, but their salsa is good. 

I got their version of a California burrito, which is a super burrito with fries. After all, no diet is complete without a healthy serving of fries! It had plenty of good flavor, saucy, but not soggy, and I added some of their spicy salsa, which gave it a nice amount of heat. It's a decent option, especially for the Set, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to grab a burrito here. Although, if it's on the way to where I'm going to be, I'd definitely consider dropping by!
author: Aaron Y.

description: This place is super good!! I got the carne Asada fries with a Horchata, and it was amazing! My fiancé got the Asada torta and that was also super good! Nice ladies working, as well!
author: Justin D.

description:
I love this place. Keep in mind firstly they take cash only. 
Now for the good stuff, they make amazing food. They are generous with portions and everything is made to be delicious. My personal favorite is the El NorCal Burrito!
The place is run by some really nice ladies and they work fast. I've been here so many times I've lost count. I highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Daniel Q.

description: They had  coupon on their site and did not honor it.  The food was OK, but the ladies that gave me our food was very rude.  Going to be awhile before going back here.
author: Joel P.

description: This is my #1 Go-To-For-A-Legit-Burrito joint. Their meats are, not only good quality, but marinated well. I say good "quality" meat because I've never bitten into an EBX Burrito where I couldn't completely "chew" the meat because it was "fatty" and had to spit it out or whatever. Reasonably priced. You can actually get a regular burrito (meat, rice, beans) under $10.
author: Sharon J.

description:
I have never seen a bunch of whinny ****'** rate a restaurant so horribly. 
whin·ny
a gentle, high-pitched neigh.
(of a horse) make a gentle, high-pitched neigh.
"the pony whinnied and tossed his head happily"
Feedback. 
Ya the slope on the floor took some time to get use to but as far as these one and two whinny I get a good customer service, or the meat was dry? Y'all can go stick it where the sun don't shine. I went and loved the food, and I take nothing personal. 5 stars to make up to all your BS.
author: Michael A.

description: There's nothing quite like an EBX Expresso Burrito.  Perfection, wrapped in tortilla, smothered in delicious sauce and cheese.  Highly addictive.  You've been warned.
author: Aaron B.

description:
It was my turn to pick dinner on Tuesday, December 29th. I wasn't craving the usual cheap delivery options: chinese, indian, thai, etc. But I also didn't want to pay an arm and a leg to get something delivered. Saw El Burrito Express on Postmates with a $4.99 delivery fee, so decided to give them a shot. I placed our order around 8:05pm and it arrived a little more than 30 mins later. Prices below are what's listed on Postmates, but I believe their prices may be a little higher as my subtotal was $16.78 for all 3 items.

*El expresso ($7.65): carnitas, mexican rice and refried beans, guac, pico, special expresso sauce and cheese on top (no sour cream)
*Asada fries ($6.75): french fries, carne asada, expresso sauce, onion, cheese, guacamole, pico (no sour cream)
*Hard shell taco ($1.75): ground beef and chorizo, taco shell, lettuce, cheese and taco sauce

Their asada fries were good. Lots of melty cheese, guac and pico. I wanted more sauce though as it was kind of dry. The hard shell taco managed to stay crunchy given the trip to outer richmond. But the beef/chrizo didn't have much flavor. I had a bite of the roommate's burrito. I don't like beans, so I didn't care for the sauce as it tasted a little beany. They also gave us two small bags of chips and a salsa. I liked the salsa as it had a good spice. Wish they gave us two sides of salsa as it was really only enough for one bag of chips.

A couple years ago, the roommate and I went to their other location on Divisadero. I remember the food being better at that location. Plus, I got a free churro for checking in through Yelp! Since the 2nd location seems to be better, I'll probably just stick with El Burrito Express 2.
author: Elena N.

description: Best ground beef burritos in town! Love this place!
author: TC C.

description: Great Buritto's. different sizes too. very reasonable price. perfect for lunch time!!
author: Kanwal T.

description: I've never had a bad experience here (aside from showing up on a Sunday to find out it's closed). The food is delicious, which is obvious by how busy the place always is. One of my favorite take out restaurants!
author: Alex G.

description: Holy crap, I'm not a big Yelp person, but this place is so bad I found this 100% necessary. I ordered the nachos with carne asada via DoorDash and immediately after trying them I had to throw it away. The meat tasted so strongly of rotten fish that I could actually smell it from the trash can. Not only was it disgusting, but could you imagine if I were allergic to fish? DO NOT EAT HERE.
author: Gwendolyn C.

description: This place can be so packed in the evening that it is better to wait outside for the order.  There were a lot of phone orders so that may be the way to go.  Almost next to no seating inside except for bar type stools.  It is most likely the best Mexican food in this neighborhood.
author: Shelton F.

description: Just ordered through eat24 and they completely screwed up my order. The eat24 representative spoke with the restaurant who admitted to messing up but refused to offer a refund. Luckily eat24 provided a discount. In addition to the order being incorrect, the food was just gross. By the way, according to the employee "taquitos and tacos are the same thing."  I won't bother eating at this establishment ever again.
author: a e.

description: About a year ago was my first time at El burrito express and I loved their carnitas burrito, because it was filled with meat. About two months ago I went back and ordered the carnitas burrito since my first experience there was great, but to my surprise, there was hardly any meat. I wanted to give them another try, so I just went the other day, and ordered a carne asada super burrito; all I had in my burrito was a couple scraps of meat and 99% rice and beans.  If you want a real burrito, I would NOT recommend this place!!!
author: Darice L.

description: They always seem to get my order wrong. The guacamole is non-existent in any burritos. The carnitas are very dry. Black beans taste chalky. No salsa bar. The chips are homemade = the 1 star but they only give you some watered down pico de gallo.
author: Danielle H.

description: I moved out of the Sunset district but still go back here for their burritos.  They do take cards, not just cash.  There is usually a line but these women work fast.  Everything I've tried is flavorful though I do like the more traditional burritos best.  Everything is fresh, including the chips.  The homemade salsas that come with the burritos are really good, try the green! Great customer service.
author: Jeanette C.

description: I paid THIRTY DOLLARS (after tip) for a meal and they forgot half my meal!!! I ordered a TACO PLATE and got NO. TACOS. NONE.
author: Lindsey A.

description: This is the best burrito place in the Sunset/Parkside neighborhood. The expresso with red enchilada sauce, cheese, and sour cream on top is soooo good. The Nor Cal is my favorite because it has fries in it. Tortillas nicely grilled for maximum flavor and ideal texture. Many options for vegetarians. The shrimps were overcooked in the Cancun, but the rest of the burrito was delicious. The ladies work their ass off so they are not always in a good mood but if you speak Spanish they'll warm up to you.  The green salsa is yummy but they only give you one so if you want more I think they'll charge you unless they're in a good mood and they hook one up if you ask nicely.
author: Athena K.

description:
Even though there was no line, they acted like we did not even exist. While they appeared to be busy bagging up a large order for one person who was sitting down behind us, we did not even get so much as a "be with you shortly"...nothing. After 5 min or so of them ignoring us, we decided to go elsewhere. 

EDIT: Thank you for your response. We'll take you up on that when we get a chance. Upgraded to neutral rating for now.
author: Pablo J.

description:
1-Star until Yelp can discern the difference between product and service and/or business. 

Which in this case is the business side. I've been here a few times, live in the neighborhood for over 5. 

My main reason for this review is to advise customers of the sneaky overcharging! It's totally up to the customer to pay attention to what you are getting and what you are paying. 

However, to build into your business model to overcharge customers in attempts of stealing those small amounts, bit by bit to increase your revenue is disgusting, intolerable and I refuse to support your employees and the institution. 

I love food! To pay for it and to Eat it. Yum. Happy belly!

Charge more, get better ingredients, upgrade your facade and interior; whatever. Just don't CHEAT me, I will cut you like cake!

I ordered the same thing a couple weeks ago and walked away thinking, "hmm, I think she overcharged me". But seeing as how I noticed after paying and just leaving, I didn't want to go back in and fuss.

But today I made sure to pay attention. It's my hard earned money and I love to spend it but not have it taken. So I ordered the same burrito as I did last time with the same add's.....And I caught it! 

I also wasn't asked if I wanted a bag or not and was already charged the bag fee. So in total being overcharged $1. Plus I tipped, $1.25 so if I had gone to Taco Bell instead I would up $8. 

Like I said, charge more on your menu, upgrade the quality so I can give you my money. Don't steal it like a thief. 

Truth is, there is no good Mexican on this side of the hill. So if you are craving Mexican and not the just add H20 food I often buy from Taco Bell then go here!

If you are not limited by transportation then @ least go over the hill and buy legit, real Mexican goodness! 

You'll be soooooo much glad-ER you did!!
author: Jessica M.

description: They make the meat and sauces fresh and you can definitely taste it. The burritos and cheese tostadas are addicting.
author: Kamden R.

description: Their version of the California Burrito, "El NorCal" is spot on.  Big, fresh, tasty and satisfying.  Homemade chips and salsas. The menu is off the map a little too , authentic with an Americana touch
author: j. g.

description:
Ms. Mila,
I am been faithfully patronizing your Taraval St. location for 20+ years. I love your Espresso Burrito with pinto beans and shredded chicken. I have never strayed away from this item. I am unhappy that I have to pay tax on my free burrito that I earned by using the "buy 9 and get 10th one free". Through the years I have earned 3 free burritos and each time stated by the same employee who knows that I am a long time customer that I have to pay tax. So far, I have declined paying tax and as recent as December 2017, I stated to that same employee that it is not right to charge me tax. She stated that it's the owners policy. I stated to her that this policy is not on the card and that whenever I receive a free meal due to my birthday or a rewards card, I am NEVER CHARGED TAX. Additionally, she stated that I had to order a different burrito. Again, I stated that I have always received my free favorite burrito. I am giving 3 stars for enjoying my burrito. 5 stars will be given when I am stopped being asked to pay tax on my free burrito. I think it's an insult and tacky! I never pay tax for gifts. I would like to continue patronizing your establishment and earning my free burritos which I consider to be a gift and a treat.
author: Jenny S.

description: Update*** customer service kindof sucks. The burritos are good bcus it's the only spot area on Taraval. Ladies in there looks like they can give a rats ass. I'll be back for the burritos not the service.
author: Jasmin J.

description: Snuck up on this gem as I was jonesing for a burrito as my first meal of the day. Ended up with their Nor-Cal burrito, their version of a so-cal.  I would order this beauty of a burrito again. Another great thing is that they accept card! I'll see you guys on Tuesdays!!
author: Jonathan K.

description: I'm in love with the NorCal burrito. Don't wanna say much more, but for some reason all my reviews get filtered. So I'd rather not waste my time but it's the best NorCal style burrito in sf thus far
author: David P.

description: Whoa! Not sure why I waited so long to come get a vegan burrito at this place. If I can get plantains, fries, and avocado beans, and (brown, the vegan) rice , I'm stoked. The ladies working are quick and efficient. Seating is small but I live around the corner so it's perfect for takeout. Yum
author: Danica N.

description: I have been coming here for a while now because of there amazing vegetarian options! My go to is the el fresh mix and it's so good. Definitely will continue to keep going to this spot.
author: Kendall O.

description: Love the burritos! I have been getting the carne asada burrito and it's amazing. Mila, the owner, is one of the sweetest people ever! Definitely recommend this place
author: Paul B.

description:
For the Sunset, I think this is hands down the best and the cheapest burrito spot! I make the extra trek to El Burrito over La Playa Taqueria (they're too damn expensive for what you get).

Just a heads up, El Burrito no longer honors the free can of soda with purchase offer.
author: Brandon J.

description: I don't know why but the sauce on their wet burritos are always overly salty. It has gotten expensive here over the years. This place has business because it's like the only taqueria around lol. All the others are Chinese restaurants.
author: U L.

description: Came in and there was no acknowledgement while the coworkers talked to one another. I didn't want to be a bother so I left so they could finish their conversation.
author: Itika D.

description: Tacos are pretty yummy but the burritos,  not so much. It's just beans mostly with little meat. I just moved to the area and been there three times already but not sure I'll continue buying food here. It's too bad since I really love Mexican food. Maybe I'll try other options on the menu and provide an updated review eventually.
author: D L.

description: The NorCal is probably my favorite burrito in the city. The price is fair, 4 stars because the wait can be nuts sometimes and the hours aren't great
author: Ethan S.

description:
Numero uno: they did not overcharge me. I added up everything & checked the receipt, and it was muy bueno.
Numero dos: the pollo asado burrito had lots of guacamole and was large.
¿How large?
I had my first lunch at 12:55 and my second lunch at 3.
Is that a deal? Si!
author: Lisa T.

description: This review is for the bronco burrito only. A burrito with no rice is the way to go. Sometimes the meat is overcooked but always well seasoned
author: Violet T.

description:
We had take out on a Thursday night. The tiny place was filled with people waiting to place an order or waiting to pick up their food.

I think it must be the only burrito place for miles because it was just ok, not great, which I expected with the large crowd waiting.  I waited outside, watching the bugs flying inside next to the window.

It's a also confusing to figure out how to order.  The cashier will ask you a bunch of questions, but it's easy to forget something you want if she doesn't ask you about it.

I had the 1st burrito listed on the left side of the middle of the menu, the expresso burrito.  It was supposed to include guacamole but there was none in my burrito.  If you're in the area and want a $7 burrito this is probably your only option.  I would not go out of my way for this mediocre burrito missing guacamole.
author: Joanna S.

description: Love this place! We've been going here for years, and I sometimes can't get enough of that El Norcal. I don't know what it is. The fries? The carne asada? the espresso sauce? All of these flavors meld together in bite after bite of deliciousness. Sure, sometimes they run out of important stuff like guac, but the fresh avocado works just as well, maybe even better. The burrito's so big, there's always some left for another meal. The place can get pretty packed, especially for the dinner rush, so we usually call in our order (or now we Eat24 it)
author: Anne P.

description: Food is alright! BUT customer service is almost to the point that I won't be coming back. I work near El Burrito and EVERY time I've eaten there the ladies have been SO beyond rude and snotty! The last straw was today when I went to get some food. When i asked for chips ( Which comes with the food especially since i paid $11 bucks for my food ) one of the ladies ( the rudest one by far ) actually had the nerve to toss them on the counter even though i had my hand out!! REALLY?! I hope they understand the reason they have jobs is because of faithful customers like me. I will never go back here and unless you want to feel like being treated like you're below them think of another spot!! There's a spot on West portal just a few blocks away...SOOOO GOOD AND AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  Check em' out :-)
author: Summer M.

description:
BEWARE OF LAZY, IRRESPONSIBLE, IGNORANT AND INCOSIDERATE BUSINESS PRACTICES.

This is a message to EBX on Taraval.

UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!!!!! Delivery NEVER showed up because the restaurant decided to close while order was "in progress" from DoorDash. No one contacted us at all so we could at least order from somewhere else. NOT ONE PERSON THOUGHT THAT WAS NOT OK????  I have a hungry family that waited almost 2 hours to find out that they will not be getting what they expected? Now it is too late to order from anywhere comparable all because of your irresponsibility and ignorance. Plus we will have to wait another hour or two to be fed? It is frikkin' 10:00pm!!!

EBX USED to be our local favorite. NO MORE!!! We have spent so much money at this place and for them to do this??? I have turned so many people on to your business and will equally denounce it as much as possible now.

This is going on YELP, TRIPADVISOR, GOOGLE, AND WHATEVER OTHER REVIEW PLATFORM IS OUT THERE. I expect a manager or even the owner to take responsibility and contact me.
author: aaron c.

description: First time ordering online from them. Big mistake. My son got there 20 minutes after placing the order thinking a burrito and nachos wouldn't take that long to make. Wrong! He gets there and first they tell him they didn't receive an order. He shows them the confirmation number and then they tell him, "well it's not ready" ok fine, he can wait. 10 minutes pass and they still haven't made it. He sends me a text so I call the restaurant and ask about my order. They tell me it's been picked up. That's a lie because my son is still standing right there. He calls me to confirm that he IS still there so I tell him to ask again if it's ready. Still not. So then I call back AGAIN and they tell me it's been ready for a while but no one has picked it up. *record scratch* wait what?! My son has been standing there the whole time. He goes and asks again and the cashier pulls it from under the counter and tell him  it's ready. What the hell just happened?! Completely incompetent. And here's the kicker, the food was horrible. The carne asada burrito was super salty and by then super cold. The nachos were not soggy, surprisingly. Doesn't mean they were edible, they weren't. All in all, I will never order from them again, online or otherwise.
author: Norma T.

description:
Stopped by here primarily because of my curiousity over the giant el macho and a craving for a burrito. It's convenient to get to as the L train stops right in front of it. Not really a place you can come in with a giant group unless it's to-go. There is limited seating along the window however if it's not taken up.

What I ordered was the el macho burrito, carne asada Fries and horchata + free chips and salsa:

You can order the el macho burrito with two choices of meats, I chose carnitas and the spicy shredded chicken in mine. OMG it's massive! It can probably feed four people total, considering my bf and I was only able to finish half of it. It was an okay burrito not super wow not shitty either. Wish I'd ordered it with carne asada instead of the spicy shredded chicken.

Carne asada fries loaded with cheese, pico de gallo, guac, sour cream, carne asada mmm mmm. They were pretty good, I'd order them again.

Skip the horchata, it tasted watered down.

Overall it's an okay and cheap place. Like I said it's not bad nor is it wow. I'd say it's a good place for broke college students and anyone with a need to cure their munchies. I'll stop by again maybe if I'm around it.
author: Susanna N.

description:
The El macho burrito is the truth felt at home eating that. Carnitas and chicken this place knows hows to make s burrito plus their not stingy with the guacamole or sour cream.  It's hella big so I ate half and I got half for dinner. 
#asatisfiedfatboy
author: Step M.

description:
I had high hopes for this place, because I wanted to find some good, inexpensive Mexican food in the sunset neighborhood. 

One thing I'd like to add right off the bat is that this place isn't really worth ordering take out by phone. I've been here twice, I ordered takeout the first time, and then ordered food to go the second time. My tacos only took 2 minutes to prepare when I ordered them to go.

The shop is in a convenient area near an L train stop, and its also very small. This is okay because it's mainly a togo place with about 5 stools. The menu has a lot of tasty options to offer, including my personal favorite, a California burrito.

This time, I decided to switch it up and I ordered three chicken hard tacos. There were about 10 others eating/waiting for food, but the food was ready within two minutes! I went home, and had my delicious chicken tacos, which I enjoyed more than the California burrito. The tacos weren't the prettiest I've seen, but they tasted great! They also gave me a free extra order of chips of salsa  (probably a happy accident)

I would definitely recommend anyone in the sunset craving some Mexican food to check this place out, and order anything on the menu.
author: Jim D.

description:
My go to burrito joint. Close to home and affordable. The line here can be ridiculous at times but if you call your order in advance it's not too bad. 

My favorite thing here is the steak quesadilla (add sour cream and guacamole). It's fantastic and filling! 

Don't forget to check in and take advantage of the free soda!
author: Liz N.

description: Being one of the only burrito spots in the sunset they honestly hold it down. The food is alright and their quick with the orders. Really is a bang for your buck spot. Will keep going back if I'm in the area
author: Francois C.

description: Great food! I don't like salad in my burritos but that's just me I guess. Their HUGE burrito is literally like a baby. It's friggin huge. There is usually a line so ordering by phone is a good option. Eating in for me isn't a good one. It gets too busy and people are literally on your back trying to stand in line. Very inefficient. Tacos are delicious. They charge extra for a lot of things while their prices are a bit inflated already. Not horrible, but l think you can find better on Mission street. They can get away with that cause of their location. The people who work there are pretty surly aside the young white guy who works there who's really sweet.
author: Bella B.

description:
I get that it's busy during a dinner rush. But maybe when you have a line out the door quit answering the phone and stacking to-go orders ahead of the people who are actually standing in front of you. I could have actually gone to a sit down restaurant and been served just as fast. 

Food is hands down good but something needs to be done to speed up service. It's burritos not brain surgery.
author: Scott N.

description:
Best California Burrito north of Southern California.

Also, they catered my wedding (160ppl) and it was excellent and on time and very affordable.
author: Jacob M.

description: Pass by this place daily but first time ordering from this place. Not bad. Ordered the beef enchiladas ($2.15 for one) and the El Expresso ($9.20). 5 min wait time. Too bad it's Cash only.
author: La G.

description:
Food is good but the lady who takes the orders is not very friendly and inattentive....I waited for my food way longer than I should have simply because she never called it out.  It was just sadly sitting on the counter.  People after me got their orders so quick.  Maybe she cannot multitask, so if that is the case she should be doing something else to help.  Sadly, this is probably the only Mexican choice around the Sunset/Parkside neighborhoods so hopefully I get better service the next time I visit. 

Also, beware of extra charges for carne asana, chorizo, and al pastor meats.  $.75 more if you want those tastier meats.  When you order a super burrito she asks if you want sour cream and cheese but just a heads up, that is also extra charges.  So what exactly do I get for ordering a super burrito? Shouldn't that be included already? Hmm....
author: Maria G.

description:
Okay, so.. 

I would like to start by saying their food isn't bad. Everyone time we've gotten food from them it was tasty and had no complications. 



However.. 
Most times we go the service is mediocre at best. They aren't always the friendliest or helpful. 

Now the main reason I'm writing this review is because of an incident on Cinco De Mayo.
I mean, hey, I get it. It's a holiday for Hispanic people and they've probably worked extremely hard all day. That's completely fine and respectable, but their closing time is 9PM, and they should close and stop taking orders, at 9PM, unless otherwise specified. 

Who hasn't worked overtime on a stressful day to make a customer happy right?

We called in at 8:25 PM; 35 minutes to closing; which is enough time ( in my opinion ) for a midsize order to be completed on time before closing. 

They said they weren't taking any more phone orders and that we had to walk in to order...
Ok. No problem. 
We got there in 5 minutes only to be rejected at the door, and hear they aren't taking in any more people, literally right after they let in a group of 5 or so... who were RIGHT IN FRONT OF US. 

We then proceeded to call in and say you told us to do a walk in order. They say that they're sorry and will let us in. 
We go back and are AGAIN rejected at the door.
The workers inside just looked at us shaking their heads while we stood there in disbelief. 

A younger guy comes out with an apology saying he made a mistake, which is great and all, but we wasted 30 minutes trying to get some Mexican food while the place on Noreiga and 46th Ave was open and would've taken our order!

By the time the ordeal was over, the 46th and Noreiga Ave place has closed and we were left starving, and eating chipotle.

Thanks El Burrito Express. Great Job guys. You've earned my first really bad review.
author: T K.

description: Small little corner on taraval but AMAZING burritos when you're on the go. A few seats on the inside but usually eat it elsewhere, such as ocean beach because it's down the street, convenient because it's right off the muni so all you gotta do is hop on. My go to hole in the wall for a Mexican spot here in the sunset area.
author: Jeff L.

description:
-When you first walk in you're bound to see a long line where there are probably clueless customers who don't know what they're gonna order/if the person in front of them is waiting for their order or paying.

-When you order through the phone the person speaking either doesn't understand English well or can't hear you because it's so "loud" in the background. I had to help my mom order through the phone when she had a sore throat so I had to speak loudly at the person through the phone my order.

-The food is affordable compared to other Mexican restaurants. The food is warm when you get it cause they put it in foil. Make sure to check your order before you leave because they're bound to have given you someone else's or there's an ingredient missing.
author: Erica K.

description: The best for the immediate area, and really good for the city. I feel bad for vegetarians cos the meats are on point
author: E. W.

description: Only burrito spot I would ever have pico de gallo in my burrito! I usually don't add it in my burrito just because it creates a 'cold spot' but everything is warmed through and scrumptious from them!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Really really really bad Mexican food. It was soggy and cold. The service was horrible too. I've ordered takeout from there twice and both times they made me feel like an inconvenience. I would give them zero stars if it were possible
author: Jonah C.

description:
Ever since I was born (32 years ago), El Burrito Express was already there.

Over the years, I ordered take out from them numerous times (my home is three blocks away) and occasionally ate there.

This place is simply the BEST!
author: Jade C.

description: Very good just enough everything on super chicken burrito worth 11 bucks I only eat elfarito and pancho villa but the was hella good and good customer service
author: Toine G.

description:
Small place. they are not super busy. the only bad thing is it takes forever for them to make a burrito/anything so the small place starts to pile in as people wait on their to-go food. they have a counter along the window for dine-in, but it is elbow to elbow in there and makes for not comfortable dine-in eating. I turned a little and elbowed a guy in his back, I had to profoundly apologized to the guy. luckily it wasn't hard. 

i don't understand why it takes so long for the food. everything is made already. They just need to assemble it. I got the plate #3, one enchilada and one taco. I got beef. they forgot my taco, had to get back in line to tell them that the beef taco is missing. the plate includes rice, refried beans, and coleslaw. chips and salsa. the boyfriend got the burrito. when asked how was it, he just said it was ok. he didn't touch his chips. 

both taco and enchilada are filled with grounded beef. I had better. the chips are thick and hard and both the red and green salsa lacks flavor. the #3 plate was $8 something. pricey. the burritos are cheaper. $5 something. 

they should not leave their big recycling garbage bin in the eating area. you can smell the stench coming from it. they are well staffed. at least 5 people behind the food counter. 

I should also add, the cashier just automatically charged me for a bag, doesn't ask whether it is dine-in or to-go or whether I needed a bag. I saw it after the fact and don't want to argue over 10 cents. but that is besides the point. Lacks service and subpar tasting food.
author: Jules L.

description: It was good and I was glad they were relatively close by. I got the spicy chicken El burrito. I was a bit disappointed that they only put meat and guacamole in my burrito when it is supposed to come with more but it was still pretty good. The price was fair but would have been more reasonable if they had put the rest of my burrito filling in. They also made my food and left it sitting on the counter for 5 minutes before calling me up. Perhaps you have to ask for your food? Not sure, it was my first time. I may try them again.
author: Joey D.

description:
Asked for "Gigante taco" without meat.

Got a plastic container filled with undercooked sweet potato "fries," (microwaved slabs of potato) on two tortillas -nothing else?

Husband went back and asked if, ya know, maybe they could give us some SALSA or like BEANS - things that tacos generally sort of come with, things according to the menu are included in the taco.

They dumped a huge scoop of beans and pico on top and 40 mins after I called, after two trips to the taqueria, I received the same soggy, cold plate I'd had the first time around:

$9 for two cold tortillas, cold and "mojado" - jajajaja - NO ME JODAS GUEY ;) 
No. Just, no. 

Friend's "bronco burrito" came with only beans and cheese - nothing else, just beans.. And cheese... And beans.. And cheese. But by the sass of the woman working there, you'd think we were asking for her first born child when we asked for an extra salsa to go with the three meals we ordered. 

The food used to be bomb here. Now it just looks like the aftermath of a food bomb. If you want a bean and cheese only burrito, order anything on the menu here or pass by 711 and save $$$$$
author: Tina Y.

description: The best quick Mexican food in the West Portal/Sunset area. Can't go wrong with the El Bronco burrito. Call ahead and order over the phone and your food will be ready when you get there.
author: Sam A.

description: The Sunset probably isn't a go-to spot for burritos for most people, but El Burrito is the place to be if you get that craving out in the Avenues. Giant, fresh-tasting burritos, and a huge selection (although I actually find the new menu a little overwhelming--all I want is beans and cheese!), fast service, and good chips. Definitely better as a to-go place than for dining in, since it's so small, but that's the "express" part of it all. On days when I'm not quite up for a full burrito, the beef quesadilla is my smaller dish of choice, which is less heavy but a little greasier.
author: AJ P.

description:
Bronco grilled chicken no pico - Awesome!
Nachos - black beans, cheese, guacamole - Awesome!
Norcal burrito - sliced avocado, carne asada, refried beans, cheese No pico, no sauce - Bomb!!

Go here - read the menu before you get in line. This is a pet peeve of mine as I watch people on their phones while they wait and then they don't know what they want, and the rest of us wait longer. 

Family run business - great traditional food.
author: Christine V.

description: Wow what a huge disappointment and waste of money. I have a few words to describe their food... Insipid, bland and gross. If you just wanna stuff your face and don't care about flavor sure go ahead. To each their own, sure everyone has their own tastes but when someone doesn't know any better or hasn't had better it's easy to think something tastes great.
author: Ol Dirty B.

description: Went here the first time and was unimpressed with a typical beans rice and guac burrito my gf brought me. Then when trying it a second time I realized I just didn't order the right thing! I am a veggie and I finally order the El Terrapin and it easily became one of my fav burritos in SF. Really good veggie sub meat and overall nice staff and quick to fill an order. I ended up going the next four days before I moved away from SF to split one with my dog each day. (Shh, Don't tell my gf I gave our doggie veggie burritas)
author: Clinton C.

description: Love these guys and have been coming here for over 10 years! If you can't find something on this menu to love, then you're tastebuds are shot. I go upscale and get the super expresso (no foil wrapping, with sauce and lots of trimmings). Bonus: Yelp's online order process actually worked! Call ahead...no-hassle quick pickup...you'll be coming here in 10 years I assure you.
author: Joshua W.

description: the lady was really rude. ordered sour cream too and was charged $1.20 - didn't even get it on the side or in the tacos. super lame.
author: D E.

description: I really like their burritos that can be ordered salad style. Sometimes the order is a little off but it's always good and very tasty with an excellent filling to lettuce ratio. A take out spot as they have a three or four stool counter for eat in.
author: Gail N.

description:
RUDE WORKERS.
1. Didnt greet us, pay attention, or even look at us! (well one glanced then just looked away) 
2. We had to ask them if we could order and they still ignored us.. It was only 10am, I just wanted a quick breakfast burrito before class.. It wasnt even busy or anything!
3. They made the persons order BEHIND us first.
4. $11 f*cking dollars for a breakfast burrito that was just OK and that took 20 minutes to make!? 

Yeah forget this place, never coming back.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Everyone's ideal burrito is different than the next person's making rating burritos tough. With that said this has been my personal favorite in the city so far. Some people will laugh at that but hey, it's just my personal preference. I have an admitted burrito addiction and get them far more often than someone should. My go to place is always here. I've been so many times that I lost count a year ago. I've been so many times that I recognize all the nice ladies that work there and a few of them recognize me. My standard is a grilled chicken super burrito and when I really want to hate myself I go for a nor cal burrito. The breakfast burritos have always been great when I've tried them. I've only been in San Francisco for a few years so I wouldn't be surprised if I find a new favorite but at this time nothing competes with El Burrito for me.
author: Curtis P.

description:
When I left my place to meet up with friends at the Street Food Festival in the Mission, I knew parking was going to be tough.  But circling for OVER AN HOUR and still no space?  That's just mean.  And as if watching my gas tank slowly empty wasn't enough, smelling the food from the taquerias I was passing by was just excruciating.  Parking karma, how could you forsake me?!

After giving up and leaving for the Sunset, the only thing on my mind was getting a burrito.  Although I wanted something from Gordo's, I drove out to Burrito Express since I knew parking would be easy (what's a little more gas burned?).  While I normally get their regular burrito and go on my way, I decided to try the El Expresso Burrito (with carnitas) since I saw it was listed as "best in house".  

Although I know a lot of people that really like Burrito Express, I still think their food is just okay.  My burritos from them in the past have been neither great not bad, and this one was more of the same.  I liked their special expresso sauce that they poured on top, but I thought the carnitas needed a little help.  The flavor was decent, but the meat felt somewhat overcooked.

In the grand scheme of things, Burrito Express sits in the middle of the pack of taquerias for me.  Given the Sunset's slim pickings and the relatively easy parking though, Burrito Express is pretty solid choice for something convenient.  Especially considering I just found out they offer CARNE ASADA FRIES!  I'll most definitely be back for that.
author: Mike L.

description:
Bought take out today, two orders of chicken enchiladas. Went home and we opened it to start eating it. My wife discovered a raw shrimp in her salad. We immediately drove back to the establishment and presented the plate to them. 

First thing they said was, "I don't see any raw shrimp."

My wife pointed it out to them and they said they'd make another one. We declined and requested a refund for both orders. Just imagine discovering this inside a burrito when it's already too late and you've eaten half of it.

This is pretty much the last time we're ever coming back here. Any restaurateur knows you do not store any raw protein near anything already cooked or ready to eat. I hope we and no one else gets sick from this.
author: E W.

description: Used to be a good value. Sadly no longer. Really skimpy burrito with minimal meat - even for a "super" at $9.22 (including tax).  Plus ingredients are hit or miss.  At times you get decent rice, at times hard, undercooked.  Also random ingredients like celery are tossed in when not part of the burritos.  All this and a health score now bordering on unacceptable... yuck. Sadly no mas.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
I've been living on Taraval St. for almost 5 years and today was the first time for me to try El Burrito. Yeah, finally got a chance to try this place.

I've passed by this place so many times, and each time, it is completely crowded in there. I'm so glad that when I came today, the line was ok, it wasn't that bad. I got EL EXPRESSO Burrito with chicken and cream, and it was GOOOOOD, HUGE and CHEAP! Their chips are great and their salsa isn't that bad.

For me, it's the 2nd best burrito in San Francisco!
author: Euodia A.

description: My favorite burrito in SF. And the ladies who operate this place are sweeter than horchata.
author: Levi D.

description: Small and extremely busy spot on taraval. Really close to my house so when we want Mexican food for dinner we go here. My parents usually get burritos. I don't like burritos, so I always get the enchilada dinner plate or a steak quesadilla. Tonight I tried something new from here, carne asada fries. Tons of toppings but not enough fries. Still good though! Everything has always been a-okay and we will probably continue to grab a quick meal here when we want it.
author: Tiff C.

description:
*Furrows brow* How does El Burrito Express have 4 Stars?

Bland bland bland. Salt is a necessary part of food. It's a fact. Sorry to all you high-blood pressure-having sweeties, but without salt, food, nay, LIFE, is flavorless and bland. Just like the food at El Burrito Express.

When my now-roommates (and apparently only friends as they are included in most of my reviews) lived on 19th Ave we frequented all the spots up and down each street offering food and / or booze. Taraval, being one of said streets, held our attention for quite some time. To change up to Japanese / pizza / Chinese routine, and also craving burritos, we hit El Burrito Express often. But each time we ended up being like, wait, why are we eating this bland mess of all things Mexican? Why are all the hot sauces around empty? Oh, they have been poured in excess onto my bland burrito. Might there be a place we could go where Mexican food abundantly flourishes? Aaaand scene.

The one thing I liked and got at least twice was the Shrimp Burrito. Choose wisely, young Yelpers. Closed Sundays.
author: Crystal C.

description:
NORCAL NORCAL NORCAL! I assume you're not dieting if you're looking up burrito places so you need to try the NorCal burrito. It's the best thing since...anything. You don't need to go to San Diego for a Cali all you need is this burrito and it's the best Cali I've had. Fries, cheddar cheese, sour cream, guac, carne asada wrapped into a heavenly burrito. My mom loves the expresso burrito(wet) it's served plated with red sauce cheese and sour cream. Also the surf n turf is good too. I don't know why this isn't the most poppin burrito spot outside of the mission...


Big size: half can be saved for leftovers..but you'll probably wanna finish it
Reasonably priced ($9.52 for NorCal)
Can call in or order on eat24
Get a burrito stamp card! Free after 10

Convinced 4 of my friends to get the NorCal since yesterday and they all freaked out after the first bite (Where's my cut in the business??).You're welcome for my advertising el burrito express but more so thank you for creating this burrito for me
author: Courtney S.

description: TWICE - I ordered from them via doordash (this is a rant against doordash and the establishment). We ordered food that was not available. Guess what, we were charged for it but never reimbursed. Do me a favor and never order from doordash/El burrito. You'll thank me for this.
author: Shawn W.

description: I'm astounded that this place has recently felt the confidence to raise their prices. They constantly forget/add ingredients to burritos I order. Service is terrible. The woman who took my order is judgmental when I order a vegan burrito. There's no seating or restaurant life, the place is practically a drive through, therefore there's no reason they could have raised their prices.
author: Chloe R.

description:
I was craving Mexican food..and not no Chipotle...legit enough Mexican food.  Let's face it though, there aren't many places in Sunset.  Gordo's is too far, so I remembered that one time many years ago that I went to get a quesadilla at El Burrito Express..I know what your thinking, I wasn't that hungry plus burritos are messy and I was eating with a bunch of guys...get my drift?  Anyways, I told bf that we should get to go from EBX.

The place got busy after we placed our order and we were waiting for about 15 minutes...dang meters!  I ordered the Carnitas Burrito Bronco Style and he got their version of a California Burrito.  Loved how my burrito included cheese and avocado slices for cheap..like $5!  I substituted rice for beans as well.  They also include complimentary chips.  The carnitas could have been a teeny bit moister, and it tasted a little tea like or like chinese wushu (red pork) pork in the claypot..it was odd, but not horrible.  Next time I'll go for another type of meat.  His California Burrito, though it can't compare to Iguana's in SJ or any place in San Diego, was not bad for SF.  He wished the fries would have been crispy though.  They filled his up to the brim with lots of steak and fries and avocado.  

The chips were satisfying and love their salsa verde.  Not necessarily a destination place for Mexican food, but if you're in the area craving a good and cheap burrito, I'd recommend El Burrito Express.  Also, check in using Yelp and you get a free soda!  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
After a long day of trying to run errands, I decided to get some burritos to-go for dinner.

Line as pretty long so I regretted not phoning my order in. It gave me enough time to look at the menu though which is great for the indecisive soul like me. Here's what I got:

-El Cancun Burrito -  melted cheese, rice, pot beans, sliced avocado, tomato salsa, and sauteed prawns with our special veggie mix. (red bell peppers, mushrooms, zucchini, cabbage, potatoes, and onions). Actually very good and juicy. I really liked the mix of vegetables they used and the flavors it had. HOWEVER, I ordered a PRAWN AND VEGGIE burrito but ultimately got maybe 5 or 6 babies in my heavily veggified burrito. Juicy but not as juicy! Especially because the veggie version of this burrito is way cheaper!

-Mango salsa - 50 cents more but not very juicy. Lightly sweet. 

I got my boyfriend a carne asada burrito of some sort and a chicken enchilada. He said the burrito was okay and that the enchilada was amazing. He did state that the chicken was not very impressive (dry) but everything else about the enchilada made up for it. 

Overall mixed feelings! A lot of almosts!
author: Sofia R.

description:
I just moved into the city and have been quite lazy in terms of cooking. Good thing there is an abundance of options where I get off the MUNI to grab a bite before walking home :)
EBX hit the spot and was priced nicely for all the food that I got- Carne Asada quesadilla with guac and sour cream, a hard chicken taco, and chips/salsa for $9 and change.
This place was packed when I arrived so I suggest calling in to minimize wait time. If you do wait, grab a beer or a soda (with Yelp Check-In a soda can is free!).
author: Angela D.

description:
The price is pretty good and the food can be good at times. However my order was fudged not once but twice in a total of five trips to this place.

Both times I requested no cheese and no sour cream.

However this was ignored. 

The burritos are super packed or big but they are slightly smaller then say an average burrito. 

It is about $6 after taxes for a regular burrito nothing else.
author: Nathan A.

description: Used to be the best!!  The last two burritos had rocks in them and I tried the Taco Salad last night which had a large chunk of cauliflower!!!  Wonder how that got in there
author: Sue H.

description: They make a tasty burrito fresh to order.  They lost a star because lettuce was not listed as an ingredient for the El Macho burrito and I had to give away the first burrito because Im allergic to lettuce.  However, they regained that star for having a burrito almost large enough to satisfy my appetite.
author: Patrick A.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: street parking isn't too bad but can get crowded. No wait to order.

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: fast food service. Cramp. Trash bins indoors, yuck!

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: burritos are good. Carne Asada is good but carnitas is bad.

_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Get Carne Asada
author: Elliott N.

description: I moved to the City a year ago, right next to this place of business. It's a hit or miss. Your burrito can be either fresh, juicy, succulent, or it can be the wrong meat with wrong ingredients. After living in SF for a year, and at LEAST 4 visits a week, you would think me and the cashier are like mejores amigas, best friends for you Gringos, but no. She never even tries to acknowledge the fact she's seen me before; it's like I walk in as a fucking different person every fucking time. Stone cold. Overall it's a miss, and my heart hurts to give you such a low review. But as I lay here, lit as fuck, unable to do anything besides type, I give you this rating. My heart hurts, Burrito Express, I have no munchies.
author: Lalo M.

description: I have ordered burritos from El Burrito so many times and they have consistently messed up my order. I finally said something after the third time of getting my order wrong and after the chefs stopped bickering they finally decided to make me the burrito I had asked for. Once I got home I opened the burrito and they still made it wrong! If you watch carefully at the register they also automatically charge 10¢ for the bag and I saw her add $2.20 to my order. When I asked her about the $2.20 charge she dismissed me and deducted 10¢. I would never suggest this place to anyone living in the city especially since there are much cheaper and better serviced Mexican food eateries in the mission and almost anywhere else in San Francisco.
author: Kendra B.

description:
Discusting, food is not good, lack quality, the place is dirty and the service is not good either.

Do yourself a favor and go to Gordo's instead.
author: Adriana L.

description:
First off, this place is cheap but their food has made me and a coworker sick on separate occasions... and we only got bean and cheese burritos. 

Plus the large trash cans they keep in there make this place less than appetizing. 

So. At your own risk...
author: B D.

description: Shout out to the cashier, who double charged me for sour cream and a bag (even though I didn't ask for it). :/
author: Anastasia B.

description: I love this place. I wish they had more seating, but their tacos are amazing. I also wish they were open on Sunday.
author: matthew m.

description: The ladies at the counter are as sweet as can be!  I have no idea how they maintain their patience and pace, because this place is never empty!  Everyone in the neighborhood knows about this place, where you can get flavorful veggie or vegan burritos, fries in the burritos, and customize with an array of fresh and delicious ingredients, both traditional and unusual.  You can call in your order ahead of time if you don't want to wait.  The wait is worth it- this is one of the busiest restaurants in the Parkside because the food is consistently fresh and very tasty.
author: Lorraine V.

description:
Don't be fooled this place. They short change customers all the time and then play dumb.

Also, every time I ask them politely to put jack cheese in my burrito instead of cheddar (who does that anyway?) they look at me like I'm asking them to put ketchup on a salad. The only reason this place is so popular is because of the lack of edible Mexican food in The Sunset. Its not terrible but you'll likely be disappointed unless your a drunk Catholic School kid on the weekend.
author: Matt H.

description:
Well in a moment of weakness I returned after an absence of a few years.

Oops.

I haven't even finished the burrito yet (order 568 if you people who read the yelp reviews are actually paying attention).  For as much as this place charges, as much as they nickel and dime you you'd expect them to get the order right (they didn't).  Granted, I should have expected as much from the woman taking my order (the only one not wearing a uniform).  Whoever she was, she was way more interested in counting tips than actually helping customers and could barely be bothered to look up from counting her loot.

She managed to get the wrong beans (thank god it wasn't refried this time), charged me the bag fee without asking if I wanted a bag, and didn't even bother asking what kind of salsa I wanted (hint: not the oily red goop I got).

Pretty please retire or otherwise go out of business so the outerlands can finally get a decent taqueria!
author: Alex Z.

description: I've been getting burritos there all my life. As good as it gets.  Everything there is great.  It's nice to have sliced avocado option in a burrito.
author: Patrick R.

description: Ordered from Eat24. I ordered a salad, no beans, no rice, no cheese, with sour cream and guac on the side. They completely screwed up my order. I got a burrito with beans, rice and sour cream inside, cheese on top, no guac anywhere to be found. The food was also cold. On the upside, the salsa was excellent.
author: Heidi L.

description: They've changed!! We used to go here all the time because the burritos were stuffed with yummy ingredients, the staff was great and the prices were good. The burritos are literally half as full, they switched to a cheaper cheese and the prices went up! We won't be back...
author: S. A.

description:
Sign says: CASH ONLY TODAY and then one week later sign still says: CASH ONLY TODAY, conclusion: CASH ONLY EVERYDAY - I doubt they'd fix their credit card machine any time soon, if ever!

I usually come here to get a quick burrito, hold on, I shouldn't have said "quick" because it is in no way quick! Be sure to have some time on your hands because after you order you may be waiting for 15-20 minutes! Don't be hungry when you come and don't be in a hurry to leave after you order. Seriously, sometimes you can be the only one in the place and you still sit there and wait..and wait..and wait some more. 

Don't expect to always get the right order so be adventurous when you open up your burrito and take a bite make sure you aren't allergic to anything because you sometimes might find that it isn't exactly what you ordered (I don't know how they can mess up your order when there are only 2 people in the place). Be a gambling man when you come order and eat at El Burrito Express! 

Everything I have said up there is the truth! But sometimes you just gotta do what you gotta do and eat their burrito just because you don't want to drive all the way to the Mission for one!
author: Mona L.

description: I have eaten here dozens of times and mostly enjoy the wet burrito, It is usually very good. The parking can be tough and sometimes there is a line that moves not so fast. There is not a lot of area to eat in the restaurant so you may want to plane on getting your food to go. So they deserve a 4 star for my years of experience but when you park, wait in line to get to the front only to find out that they are out of cheese....Really couldn't you put a sign on the door so I didn't wait in line. My kid wanted a bean and cheese burrito and what's a wet burrito without cheese? You can do better and I will add starts if you deserve it in the future,
author: Chinook S.

description: Food is good only if your starving but not worth the long wait they they have for no reason. I ordered one small burrito and then comes a crowd of people in the restaurant and I get my food last even tho I ordered way first not even cool or worth it. But there food smells good but don't be fooled
author: Adam B.

description:
We go here all the time. Great, inexpensive food. Service can be a little slow, depending on what you order, but it should be obvious that this is a small, family-run joint. Be patient!

Stuff that's really good: 

+ Their carne asada is legit.
+ Related, get the Norcal Burrito if you like carne asada. My god. Probably my second-favorite Norcal in SF after Señor Sesig.
+ The complimentary chips and salsa -- if you like thick chips. I do! The salsa is homemade and varies from time-to-time in the spiciness department.
+ The plates, if you're into bang-for-the-buck. Around ten bucks, and you'll have enough for lunch the next day. The veggie slaw they include varies in recipe from day to day, for whatever reason. Typically, it's very fresh with a nice vinegar base. Some days, it's just lettuce. Rice and beans are consistently great, though.
+ El Macho, for the maximum dollar-to-burrito. Huuuuge. It's three portions, if I'm getting chips.
+ Homemade churros, when they have them!

Stuff that's meh:

- I've had the Pollo Asado and Carnitas in my burritos from time to time, both are okay. They're both better in plates. Pollo asado has occasionally been a little too dry.
author: George P.

description: Been going to this place my whole life. They make amazing Mexican food that is fast and fresh. I live in Dublin (in the East Bay) now and still drive all the way back to The City just to get my Burrito Express fix.
author: Sam J.

description:
Was in the area and passed by this burrito place on 3/23/15. Ordered two super burritos. While waiting for it, we added up the bill and it was off by $0.75. I informed the cashier that the bill doesn't add up when I picked up the burritos. The cashier looked at it, denied that there is anything wrong with the total. I insisted that the bill does not add up right and she called another lady to help her. The other lady looked at the receipt and said "it's off by $0.75 because one of the burrito order with chorizo needs additional $0.75 for the meat, the cashier didn't charge you for it but now she will". The cashier then took my receipt and went to the cash register and said she will add another $0.75 charge to it. I looked at the menu - and the meat (chorizo) we ordered is not listed for additional charge on the menu board so I left and didn't want to reason with the cashier anymore. 

The food was just okay and more expensive than normal burrito in the city. With the hidden fee, I would NOT go back.
author: Xtina L.

description:
This is a bit of an update from my 2 year old review based on their customer service. After I wrote the review, I was given instructions to redeem a voucher by the manager the next time I come into El Burrito Express.. Unfortunately, I have not been there since my last encounter but I do like the effort!

Hopefully the next time I end up there, they hook it up real good and I can update with a new star :)
author: Clarizeyale R.

description:
A little bit pricey than average but the burritos are good. Highly recommend El Expresso Chicken & Cream burrito, it is delicious. Comes with the chips and hot sauce. 
-1 star for customer service, they dont seem too friendly and sometimes you have to wait a long time even though there are not a lot of people. 
...but burritos are great :)
author: Max P.

description:
