i had the the california burrito with french fries instead of rice and substituted the steak for mexican seasoned ground beef. it was greasy, fatty, and oh so tasty! rumor has it the trend started in soCal to switch out the rice for fries but NorCal does a pretty mean version too. I regularly order an Azn version with Sisig from Senor Sisig food truck.  I guess meat and potatoes in any form is my base need and desire.
just spice it up with guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and a side of hand cut tortilla chips and i am satisfied!
Oh and by the way, this massive meal is too messy to eat and drive.  the ground beef drippings seep through the double foil wrap and leak out.
i know from experience...
JYW likes!
author: Jeff W.

description: So I'm taking off a star because they changed the recipe for their red salsa that was ridiculously delicious. I used to get 3 and use every last drop. I'm pissed. This new one sucks.
author: Melissa C.

description: i frickin love this place with all my heart. el norcal is life changing. literally moaned taking a bite of it.
author: Sasha G.

description:
I swear that this place will kill me.
 One of the benefits of living in California is the easy access to all the Mexican food. This place deserves to be one of those havens for good Mexican food.  I've started coming there every other other day (that's not a typo). I do recommend the Norcal burrito, with the french fries. It's bomb.
There's not much seating room, so get your order to go, and if it's busy you might be in for wait, escpially if you're ordering some sort of platter or nachos. 
Despite everything, it is good food and close but not open on Sundays. Damn
author: Joel G.

description:
Tonight was my second visit ever but the El Terrapin (soyrizo burrito) was so awesome I just had to leave a review. This place is great for vegans! They explicitly state on the menu that the brown rice and three types of beans are all vegan, which saves you from wondering. You're not stuck with boring ol' beans, because they have a tofu option and a soyrizo option. 

On my first visit I tried the tofu burrito, which was good but not amazing, probably 4 stars. The tofu cubes were moist (nothing worse than chewy, dry tofu) without having that "wet, plain tofu" flavor that sometimes happens. Would have benefitted from more seasoning or maybe a sauce on the tofu, especially since the brown rice is unseasoned (the Mexican rice option is not vegan)

Tonight's visit - soyrizo burrito (El Terrapin). I went with tofu on the first visit because I was worried that the soyrizo would be too greasy, but let me assure you that the oil in this soyrizo is your friend. The spicy soyrizo grease (bear with me) coats the brown rice and gives the burrito the sort of richness that cheese would otherwise provide. It's not like the gross greasiness of bad Chinese food; it melds, it harmonizes, it feels... indulgent. The spiciness is enough to make you feel warm inside without overpowering the other flavors. The whole thing comes together just so well, and has a heartiness that is hard to find in other vegan burritos. Best of all, the El Terrapin is vegan as is, so you don't have to feel like a pain asking for things to be omitted. They did (unexpectedly) ask which of the veggie mixes I wanted and I went with (and recommend) the "vegetarian special" which is a nice traditional bell pepper/onion/tomato/lettuce mix.

Wait time is not great, but you can call ahead or seemingly order online.
author: Dee R.

description:
Love the norcal burrito. its a balanced blend of carne asada, fries, onions, guac, sour cream, cheese and express sauce. the onions give it a lil crunch, the gauc makes it gooey, and the sour cream gives it a tang. mixed with the juicy and savory carne, you have a winner.  dont buy into the super burrito concept at other places, you only get tons of extra rice and beans with a tad more meat.
 
Best nachos in town. Fresh thick crispy (not hard) chips. Loads of cheese covering the chips. Juicy carne asada on top of the cheese. Bean paste instead of whole beans. then its topped off with 1/3 guacamole, 1/3 pico de gallo and 1/3 sour cream.  You can barely see the chips by the time they top off with all the toppings. Why i like it, its not soggy, the cheese melted on top provides protection form the other wet ingredients. You know the nachos is a winner when theres more toppings than chips! Man i love this gooey, cheesy, meaty and crispy mess! for some reason its not greasy either, dunno why, but  I like.

The service here is fairly quick compared to their other location. Sunset location is smaller but its also cleaner. 

I will definitely come back when i get cravings for nachos.
author: Jason C.

description:
I can't believe I've lived in SF all these years and never tried EBX!

We had the surf & turf and expresso burrito with carne asada!

While I did like the expresso burrito a lot, it was the surf & turf that blew me away! There were steak and shrimp in every bite! Gimme more!! 

I love it that they give chips and salsa with every order but the salsa was super spicy!

I docked one star bc it took us almost 45 minutes to get our food!
author: Tiffany U.

description: Could be sacrilegious but this is my favorite Mexican place in SF, next to El Farrolito. Maybe it's because I'm a quesadilla fan and theirs are hearty, greasy, and cheesy. It's comfort food at its ooziest and convenient for take-out. To many more paper sacks of El Burrito Express!
author: Tina K.

description: Granted, I'm spoiled by having so much great Mexican food in this city, but no good options exist in the sunset. As a 7 year resident on taraval st, I've been to el burrito more than a handful of times. And I've never been satisfied. The burritos are too salty, and they don't taste great. This is unfortunate, because el burrito serves only burritos with very few other options. You can always tell a good burrito if it's still good the next day, after refrigerating. Tonight, the burrito lost its edibility merely 45 minutes after first opening. Not recommended.
author: Jackson W.

description: I starting coming here when I was in high school which was in 1980's!  My favorite was their Bronco Beef Burrito and still is!  The sliced avocado and marinated beef is distinct and have not found a place that gets close to it!  Don't come for the service but the food!
author: Keith W.

description:
GREAT BURRITO SPOT
MY FAVORITE TORTAS&NORCAL's


Dont mind stoping buy for there great service and great food shout/out to rocio MY MOTHER lol!
author: Rorro. Y.

description: Solid. I prefer the one on divis loc myself but I hit up the loc off 19th street on the way home from sfo.
author: Armando S.

description: Postmates delivery. .. ordered 2 expresso burritos and an horchata (that never made it).  Didn't realize it was a wet burrito with some type of tomato sauce that reminded me of chef boyardee. Yuck.  Meat quality looked & tasted disgusting  , al pastor meat was grey looking. ..  a burrito off a food truck would be much better than this place. Never again.  On a good note, I give the shrimp tacos two stars.
author: Carmina C.

description: Good burritos. Some taste like chipotle. Some taste authentic. The NorCal tastes very yummy. I'd recommend that. Small place. Get it to go, it will be a lot quicker. Lots of vegetarian options.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I like this place but I've had better. It take so long to get a burrito and it feels really crowded and unorganized. They don't really accommodate eating preferences and it's hard to communicate with all the noise. The chips are stale and hella greasy. 

This is my experience the few times I've been.
author: Jacob D.

description: The burritos are still good but I was informed by the cashier that they no longer will honor the free soda with Check In.  Oh well,  everyone take note.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Sitting in this place, minding my own business eating some $1.50 hard tacos, I saw a clean-cut man walk to a public garbage can and throw away one brown leather shoe. I laughed and laughed.  We made eye contact, and he also laughed. Fun.

The tacos were simple, flavorful and they don't skimp on the cheese. I went for the hard shells because they were half price, and sometimes I'm nostalgic for the Old El Paso yellow tortilla crunch. This is a great source of shame for me, but it is what it is. The tortillas were obviously much better, but yes, they had the pathetic salty crunch I was chasing. 

The burritos around me had French fries in them and also had a serious cheese layer happening. Bless these people and their hole-in-the-wall Mexican express restaurant. 

PEPPER POINTS: For free salsa choices.
author: Evelyn A.

description: I normally don't like burritos but I make an exception for this place. Everything taste fresh and flavorful. And the price for it is very sensible. But not crazy about the free deep fried taco skins.
author: Ken T.

description:
EXPENSIVE....but, flavors/authenticity worthy if ur not penny pinching. Nice variety of plates(meats/seafood/), breakfasts, tacos, classic platters & ofcourse- their namesake. 
Although an A's FAN- My fav is "EL GIGANTE": black beans, sweet'tatos, pollo asada, cheese & sour cream; simple yet effective. The name is for baseball team, NOT portion size.
The full crew behind counter always are burn&turning w/assembly line efficiency (whether it's empty or a line out door.).
author: Peter C.

description: I don't go to a burrito place to make friends. I go there to get tasty burritos. Great vegetarian/vegan options too!
author: Ryan M.

description:
It's nice to see so many people employed.

I tried this spot back in middle school years right after Karate Lessons.
The taste is out of this world Delicious!!

20years later, I am pleased to see its still there.went there to be reminded of how greatness taste like.

Was delighted to see they upgraded the Brito to a wet burro style.
Got my bang for my buck.

Yeah there are extra .75 cent charges and stuff don't add up exactly.

You might be over a buck at most.
But it's a really cramped work space with lots of demand.

People need to get paid.
My hat is off for keeping the biz going and delivering grand bang for your buck Burito.

My FAVORITE Guadalajara on mission still has great taste but size went down.

Glad the size here is still grande.

It is the Best Burito Place in the Sunset.

The Pastor was delcious.

Best wishes to continued success my Burito shop next to Lincoln High.
Never had Guava Jarito before. Glad tall have that flavor!

Added a tip even though it's take out because tall really are hustling and cranking hard.
I love the fact that you guys really cook down that refried beans to an oozing hot sauce. That's signature gourmet care.
author: Hung L.

description: The food is not bad. But when you ask for .. example no cheese .. good chance you will get it. Just need to double check. They charge you extra for everything ..like steak etc. Its pretty pricy compare to others. My burrtio with no cheese or with .. out the door is 10$
author: Bob L.

description:
I love coming here for the burrito and tacos. The fresh Juices are also very good. 

My favorite burrito is the el burrito expresso which is a huge burrito filled with meat, rice, beans cheese and salsa. It's topped with enchilada sauce and cream. This is a burrito to share, unless your really hungry. Overall you get a lot for what you pay. 

I usually come here for lunch, it's not too far from work and I there is always street parking, just make sure you have coins for the meter.
author: Veronica V.

description: The quality of El Burrito Express definitely started to decline. I couldn't wait to have El Burrito Express after I went to the dentist down the street. I remembered when I was a kid, El Burrito Express would have the biggest burritos I have ever seen in my life. They were PACKED with guac, rice, cheese, and meat that I could barely finish it. I would always have to get the baby burritos because it was just too much food. Unfortunately, the burritos nowadays have gone down dramatically in size and they do not overstuff the burritos like they once have. It is sad to say, but there are better options than El Burrito Express now that still overstuff their burritos.
author: Jordan W.

description:
Staff members here are friendly and service is efficient. One of the best burritos I've had and it is really nice to have this taqueria in the Sunset District.

It is busy during lunch hour since a lot of people buy their burritos here. This place isn't very suitable for very large groups which is one downer. Other than that, I had a nice first time experience here so I will come back next time I am in the area.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Socal style California burritos (and carne asada fries) were hard to find until now. I had driven by this place countless times and never even considered they might serve the stuff as I searched throughout the city. My college buddy wanted to grab some lunch in the area and suggested we give it a try since it was something new and I happily obliged.

I ordered the "Norcal" burrito, which was more or less the same as the California burrito with a few extra salsas and sauces in it. It tasted pretty good actually and was full of the stuff that I missed from Socal. My buddy's Colorado beef burrito on the other hand wasn't so good.

Overall I thought the food here was decent, but not the best burrito I've ever had. Their burritos are served with chips which were nice and crunchy, and not too oily. There isn't much seating in the restaurant and the food lacks a little TLC which would help a lot. Mostly middle of the road for me.

Food: 6/10

Service: 5/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description:
About to pay for my food. Out of the 10 times my order was wrong twice. Lol or I got someone else's food? 

Good good, fair price. Very busy, call ahead and check your food before you go.
author: Matthew C.

description:
I've been coming to this Taqueria joint for over 10 years and I always get the same thing.  Cancun Burrito with no beans and extra rice please!  Its basically a large flour tortilla stuffed with rice, cheese, shrimp, red bell peppers, cabbage, zucchini, salsa and sliced avocados.  It's so delicious!!  It's a little pricier than other burritos at almost $8 but so worth it!   The chips however are just meh-too thick and just not that good. 

Tips:  Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free soda!  The lines are usually pretty long so call in 10 min ahead and you can go straight to the register to pay and pick up!
author: Cathy M.

description:
Been coming here for decades and it doesn't really need one more review to sell it, but this is our "go to" place when we're too tired to cook at the end of a long work day.  My bride always gets the chile verde burrito and it's reliable, with a goodly amount of pork and guacamole.  I have tried nearly everything on the menu at least once -- including some of the dorkiest things, like the Norcal burrito that includes French fries -- and rarely have reason to complain.  I tend to avoid the chicken dishes as they can be bland, but anything with beef or pork here is quite tasty, including carnitas, chile verde, carne asada, and chili colorado.  The Express added chorizo as a meat choice awhile ago and it's fine too, but you'll have to wait for it to be cooked to order.  Mexican sodas are available, but not aguas frescas. 

Prices have gone up quite substantially in the last few years and carne asada now takes a premium.  However, there's a generous Frequent Fresser program that grants you a free burrito after you've bought nine and that cushions the blow a bit.

Parking historically has been, is, and always will be a bitch in this neighborhood.  Try not to go alone as one of you might have to jump out and order the food while the other circles the block.
author: Mike R.

description: It's been years since I've had their delicious burritos, but I had to bring my hubby to have one. Omg it was just as amazing as I remembered!! Same workers, same flavorful meat and new additions to the menu. Wish the prices were the same, but that's understandable. Very satisfied with their macho burrito. The NorCal burrito was good except for the French fries in it, but that's just my preference.
author: Heather T.

description:
Tried this place several times to no avail.
I suppose I fantasized about actually being able to get good Mexican in Parkside. Not so unfortunately. It was a disappointment on every level. Not good food, and I'm not that hard to please.
author: Pat T.

description:
I've going here for years, the quality of ingredients is great. The prices are on the lower side too! It's at a great location, with meter parking but I always call my orders in so I'm in and out in 3min. If you don't call in orders you sometimes get a line and during school days bunches of students are there during lunch time. 

My personal favorite item are the taco salads, you get an enormous amount of food for just about 8 dollars. If you have a big appetite I recommend that, or go splits with a friend.
author: Drake G.

description:
The one thing I truly miss about Socal is the Mexican food. It is impossible to find legit burritos in San Francisco, but El Burrito is actually pretty good.

Disclaimer: I am a vegetarian, so I honestly can't vouch for the meat here. I've tried almost all of the veggie burritos here and my favorite is the El Fresh Mix burrito. The burritos are a good size, a tad expensive, but always served warm. The vegetables are fresh and the cheese is always melted. I honestly think my favorite thing about El Burrito is their hot sauce. I always get 2 reds and 1 green. It's super spicy (which I love) so beware if you don't like spicy food.

The service is whatever. I don't really interact much with the employees other than when I'm ordering/paying for the food. They're not exactly "friendly" but they're not rude either.

This is the only Mexican food in the city that I crave.
author: Mika S.

description: This is my second time coming here. It is a good local joint. Tiny place mainly with a few seats by the window but everything else is the kitchen/counter. This place is usually busy. I drive past it a lot and I always see a line. Lesson learned: call in your order before going in to pick up. We've had the carnitas which is delicious and the carne asada burrito. I usually get the Bronco burrito that does not come with rice, but rather mainly beans and avocado. They have a great green chile sauce that I can't get enough of. Burritos come with chips and sauce automatically which is a nice touch for a decently priced burrito.
author: Gaby E.

description: Food keeps me coming back but the service is horrible. Every time I have visited the women running the register are super difficult/have an attitude. We ordered an El macho ( burrito but 2x the size) and got nachos but the lady complained about giving us a few extra sauces.  Service doesn't need to be amazing at a spot like this but they really need to relax.
author: Alex C.

description: Nothing like paying for a shrimp burrito.. Looking at your shrimp burrito (shrimp written on the foil) lovingly all the way home.. An opening it up to find a plain beef burrito. 6 dollars in price difference.. UGH.
author: Mandy R.

description:
I went here recently and got the El Cancun, which definitely surprised me in a good way! It's one of their seafood burritos and had shrimp in it. The combination of ingredients was perfect. I'd say this is one of the best taquerias on this side of town. The line was pretty long when we went, but the burrito was really good, so I'd say it was worth it. 

They seem a little pricer than other taquerias, but maybe that's because of its location. Would definitely come back though!
author: Sze-Wing L.

description: Love this place! It never fails. We used to live down the street when I was pregnant and thy have huge burritos for a huge pregnant like appetite. However, the baby has been born and I still have a large appetite. This place is worth the drive from Daly City. Can't wait to come back again !
author: Andy S.

description: I'm usually not a fan of burritos, but this place makes some amazing burritos, literally if I had to get a burrito I would only get it from here. Came with a friend and I forgot what I ordered, but I think it had ground beef, french fries, guacamole, etc. Yes, I did say french fries. Not only do they make your traditional burritos, the same old rice, meat, beans, salsa, but they have some "fusion-like" burritos! So that's what really got me hooked on this place. They also serve nachos, tacos, and other stuff you'd expect. Orders come with tortilla chips and salsa, super worth when you're hungry and want something fast.
author: William E.

description:
I went here earlier today for lunch, the food was good even though I ordered the wrong item.

I haven't eaten this style of food for a long time, so I cant compare it to any other restaurants, but the service was good, the food was inexpensive, the portion was big, and I'd go back again if I were in the area.
author: Rick S.

description:
Most people get burritos here. So I'll talk about the tacos. I thought they were a little pricey, but it turns out they are pretty big for tacos and pretty overstuffed. Hard to pick up. Turns out they are not only big but pretty good quality tacos too. They also add pot beans to the tacos. Good meat. Carne asada is additional 75 cents. So $3.85 for a fairly large stuffed carne asada taco. $3.15 for the carnitas or chicken taco. 

The Gigante taco with the sweet potato fries were a pleasant surprise. Take out only, kind of
author: Augusto M.

description:
I ordered super meat burrito and I got meatless burrito, much less meat portion than regular burrito. 

Zen master will ask you "what does it mean to you, juniors?"

1. Meat was left over from previous day and they didn't wanna embarrass themselves serving a lot of salty shitty carnita to Asians who are known to have superior tastes. 

2. The cashier and the line wrapper had a communication problem and "super meat" was heard as "small meat". 

3. Mexicanos nowadays are very concerned with healthy eating that they learned from Asian culture and they are willing to substitute Asian customers' meat with over cooked salty beans that makes burrito look like peanut butter stick. 

4. They fuckin dislike chinitos. sssssshhhhhh


Master, I think it is a combination of 1 and 4. But I'll keep quiet about it.



Edit: My ratings are 1 for customer service, and 1 for Food. Nearby Chipotle would be 2.5 and they are better in every aspect of business. Better chips. Better salsa. Better cooking facility. Better ingredients. Better parking. Better meats. Better grains. Better buck for quality. Better containers and utensils.  Better employees. Better service with less wait. Better in everything except for authentic Mexican accents. I like to patronage small local business run by authentic ethnic group, but my rational thinking gives W to Chipotle. El Burrito Express has no more reason to exist and I will never repeat.
author: yota L.

description:
Without a doubt, my go to place for a Burrito in San Francisco. The best in the Sunset District. Thankfully I only live a few blocks from this place. I like the Nor-cal Burrito with french fries, guac, and Carne-Asada. You can't go wrong with the El Expresso which they give you in a box. 

Usually very packed inside, which means that Business is always very good. They are very community friendly, and sometimes give deals for a drink on their social media. There is a TV inside where the local sports games are showing. Lastly, although parking is a bit difficult to find, you can catch the L-Taraval right outside heading downtown!
author: Terence Y.

description: I really wanted to like this place, but the burrito is soup wrapped in a tortilla, terrible
author: Jake R.

description: Check your receipt everybody, people who work there try to over charge you for anything! Salt 75 cent CAN YOU BELIEVE THAt!!!
author: Jose B.

description:
The line is usually out the door, it's a tiny place, and it isn't fancy...which all equals amazing!

Awesome food. Haven't found anything bad yet. Only downside: every time I go they are out of chills rellenos. And sometimes other items on the menu.

Would encourage more people to go, but then the line would be longer and they'd be out of more things. But seriously, you are missing out if you don't go.
author: Jeremy T.

description: Hole in the wall, check your receipt before leaving make sure it matches your order ;)
author: Yuriy V.

description: I love this place.  I've only ever had one item, the norcal burrito.  It literally never fails.  Call in ahead, get a juice squeeze when you get your burrito, ask for the red salsa if you like it spicey, and enjoy.  Total gut bomb, but totally worth it.
author: Ian J.

description:
I must  admit ...once I found chipotle I stopped eating at all Mexican restaurants. I loved chipotle...until I saw my chicken coming out of medium : pink in the middle. And then it's the nationwide outbreak of ecoli . 

So now I need a new place for my Mexican fix. The burritos here are amazing. Fresh, delicious, and 2 minute drive from my house!
The red sauce is hot! I have only trod beef burritos..so far. Lots of customers were Mexican so it must be authentic.

It's 3 am now and I just remembered I am eating leftovers from lunch and I have to say it's even better at 3am!
author: lynns l.

description:
The best burrito spot by work. Prices are reasonable, flavors are on-point, quick service, and the ladies working are friendly. The L-Taraval MUNI line has a stop right in front of the store. Yay, convenience. 

The reason for the 2 star deduction is that this is the second time I've gotten food poisoning here. I was hoping it was just a one time thing or maybe it was something else I ate. However, the burrito I got here for lunch today was the only thing I ate throughout the day and I've only had water aside from the burrito. I can only conclude that it was a result of consuming the burrito. 

I've had plenty of other positive experiences here and that's why I do think they deserve at least 3 stars. But as I'm typing this, I'm actually quite queasy. So I'm not sure if I'll be back soon, but maybe in a few months. Hopefully I don't get sick the next time I stop by. I still think this place is great, just currently feeling the opposite of that.
author: Rebecca T.

description: Not the most polite staff, but the ingredients are fresh, the burritos are big, and the prices are reasonable. I'd definitely go here again.
author: Ashleigh N.

description: Arguably, the worst tacos in San Francisco... My advice? Cross the street to Taco Bell. Bland and Dry. Not very hot. They left me with a sick feeling until I was able to erase the memory with Taqueria Vallarta.
author: Liz D.

description: I have no idea the hype around this place. I've lived here forever. Gone here a handful of times and am always in regret that I didn't just drive to mission for something better. The flavors are so underwhelming and it takes forever. There's always such a long wait even though there aren't that many people there. It doesn't make sense. The rice is always dry. The meats aren't that good. I guess if you have no desire to eat Taco Bell and no desire to drive to a real burrito then this is the next best thing but that's pretty bad.
author: Paula P.

description: I've lived up the street from El Burrito Express for the past year, but had yet to make it in yet. That was a mistake. As a very picky eater with a few dietary restrictions, eating Mexican food can be hard. But the employees here were so understanding and helpful, compared to the usual eye roll that I usually get. I will definitely be coming back not only because of their customer service, but because of the wonderful vegan burrito that they concocted for me. It was loaded with more veggies than I could have dreamed of and even had soy-chorizo! I had a few friends with me, and they got a Carne Asda burrito, breakfast burrito, a "classic" burrito with chicken, and  a classic vegetarian burrito. All of which came with chips. We all walked back to my house, and not a sound could be heard besides chewing and synonymous moans of deliciousness.
author: Danielle P.

description: Best Mexican food I've had in the sunset. I don't eat Mexican food in the Bay Area often since I grew up spoiled on the best of the best in San Diego but this place gets the job done. Consistently delicious and fast service. Definitely won't let you down.
author: Yiorgo L.

description:
The best burrito ever in the whole wide world. Ever. EVER. EBX will probably cater my wedding some day as it is my favorite food in all of creation. The best things about it are:

-Tortillas are a little bit crispy instead of soft/soggy
-Orange cheddar cheese is delicious
-Rice and beans are flavorful enough so even if you don't get any meat it is still YUMZ

EBX burritos are what dreams are made of.
author: S E.

description: This is for the recent visits we made in regards to service.  I will definitely agree with other reviewers about the unfriendliness.  For us it's just one young woman who seems to have a problem.  Whatever it is she seems to be not pleased working there so I don't understand why she is there to begin with (don't like people then don't do public service jobs!).  When she decides to acknowledge one to take one's order she glares at the person in a very unfriendly manner.  This is really unfortunate as it can very well discourage customers from patronizing them in future due to the unprofessional/unfriendly attitude.  Otherwise, the other ladies are quite accommodating and civil.
author: Luisa T.

description:
Definitely a hole in the wall place. Expect a wait, it's a very small place with just a counter that you can eat on, definitely more for take out. I'm from socal and so far I haven't been able to find mexican food in SF that can compare, yes I've been to el farolito and even la tacqueria Cancun. 

For the food:
El Burrito ($5), which is just a classic burrito, pick your own meat. Comes with rice, beans and cheese. I got carne asada (extra $0.75). It was just okay for me, I would give it 3 stars. Maybe because its on the cheaper side, they didn't give too much meat. You have the option to choose extra meat for another $2.00. The carne asada was good in itself, I think the rest of the ingredients were lacking flavor and that's why the burrito wasn't great overall.

Carne asada fries: I would give it 4 stars. The flavor was great, I would've given it 4.5 stars if the portion was bigger. It comes in a medium size paper plate, most places in socal fill up an reg size to go box. They ran out of guacamole,  which they told me when I ordered, they gave me sliced avacado instead, I didn't mind that so much.

The food comes with free chips and salsa! You get a small sandwhich size bag of chips (I got 2 with my order) and two small things of salsa, one red and one green. I prefered the green salsa. I liked the chips, they look and taste like the authentic ones, not store bought. 

Overall, I would've given 3 1/2 stars if I could. I think for the price the food is pretty good. I would definitely come back for the carne asada fries. 

Tips:
1. Phone in your order so you dont have to wait so long.  
2. Get it for take out
3. Check your receipt after paying (mine was correct but many ppl have had problems)
author: Thuy N.

description:
Years ago, before Yelp came into existence, I would've given EB Express a 5 star. But as my taste buds evolved and my awareness of customer service sharpened.... This place gets a 3. The service ( or the personality ) of the staff sucks. The blank stares of boredom and lifelessness were presented to take our orders and cash. 

If your hunger allows you to overlook that to score a big burrito, then you're in good shape. 

My most recent visit made up for the past time when the burrito was too salty to finish. This time, it served me a small slice of my past of when I ate this in high school and would've blindly given it a 5. 

But, high school was so long ago...

Service: absolutely zero. I'm lucky i got change back
Food: 3. and they forgot  the hot sauce
So, this is solely based on food.
author: James L.

description:
Great place overall. I am happy they are in the area. I am never dissatisfied with the food or the service.

I usually get El Expresso, because I can get two meals out of it; Surf and turf looks great though I've yet to try it.

I also like that I can see them cooking everything - a true testament to an honest appreciation for food and people.
author: Auza A.

description: I try to eat here every time I'm in the area. I wouldn't say it's my favorite Mexican place or anything, but they do make some of my favorite burritos. I love the Americano, with French fries inside! Granted, there's practically no room inside to stand, order, wait, or eat, but like I said, I really like their burritos.
author: Alan J.

description: Bomb food always. Long lines though. Expect to wait a solid 25 mins to get your burrito at any time. Also pray you don't get the white guy because he thinks he's special and is pretty much a dick to everyone. He's the reason I go to Lou's up the street
author: Christopher M.

description: I've been craving a burrito for a while. It took forever to get our burritos. Looked at our receipt and the total is incorrect so not only did we get overcharged but my friend also tipped them ! Came home and midway through my burrito I found a really long hair. What's going on with this place ?
author: Evelyn D.

description:
Only decent burrito in the vicinity. Terrible layout, ancient POS equipment, hit-and-miss service staff. Great cooks/wrappers.

Oh boy, this place might be the best candidate for a total GUT and REBUILD in the entire Sunset. There is a single entry and exit point in the restaurant and it's on a 2-foot long, 25 degree slope. These two factors are no big deal unless you're disabled, but the counter is laid out so the only way to place an order, pay, or receive an order is to stand sideways in the doorway with one leg up like a pirate. A few years ago this place revamped their menu, website, and marketing strategy. Even offered delivery. Delivery stopped shortly thereafter for some reason. 
This is literally the only burrito place in the immediate area. Most taquerias in SF have at least one competitor within a few blocks. I think it's time to put some of that monopoly money into a remodel. 2 stars only because the folks that actually make the food are awesome and the burritos are decent. One other thing: They nickel and dime you for any and all extras, but the prices for entrees are possibly the lowest outside the Mission. It's kind of unbelievable. I see a lot of people standing in line all day at EBX - albeit awkwardly, as the layout of the place prevents a normal line from forming. Seems to me if the prices were a little higher and representative of the area, the POS system and counter could be upgraded in no time. This would at least prevent the problem of overcharging customers due to faulty equipment and make EBX a better experience for everyone.

Christopher M nailed the bit about a certain staff member...
author: Patrick H.

description:
I moved here from Woodland (yes, yes, I know...it's the crotch of California) but they had amazing authentic Mexican food. 
With that said, this place does fairly well flavor wise for San Francisco but I can have it or leave it because I think this is more of a place for the teen crowd that has the appetite that favors quantity over quality. But when I mention quality, I don't mean their ingredients...it's just not great. I think it may be overrated but they do well with what they have. 
Their prices are a little hefty but they make up for it with the portion sizes. They are friendly but the wait can be a little daunting if you're hungry. I would still go back and would probably make this the go-to place for Mexican food if I wanted but if I could find something better I would skip it.
Enjoy it though.
author: S Y.

description: Below average burritos. Not a lot of flavor. Reminds me of the burritos they served at college dining halls.
author: Karl K.

description: Although the food seems better these days, it is really a place more of convenience than taste.  Everything pretty much tastes the same. When you take a bite you dont get that awesome ("this is hella good") feeling like a place in the Mission.
author: Mina S.

description:
This place has really gone down hill. It is the only Mexican food in the area which is why it probably still gets business. Seems like management isnt doing too good of a job here. They should take pointers from the other Burrito Express on Divisidero. 
I realize they are always busy but the service is so slow. Seems like they have plenty of employees making food. They just arent that efficient I guess. 20 minutes for 2 burritos is ridiculous. They are never friendly and make you feel like they are doing you a favor by taking your order. 
Food is edible but nothing special. Weird combinations of ingredients though. What kind of tacos have beans in them? Just not authentic if that's what your used to. And dont let them fool you by their advertisement of free delivery. They only deliver when they want, which in my experience is never.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Walked in to get a quick bite right before a workout.

Carne Asada Fries
- fries were a soggy, greasy, old looking mess
- dish was 50% cheese, 30% Fries, 10% Sour Cream 5% Guac, 5% Meat with some Pico de Gallo sprinkled on, totally ridiculous proportions
- basically a gross pile of food that was made in 15 minutes when it should have been ready in 5 

the floor was a mess and the tables were dirty, which i did not mind.  it was the fact that the seats were dirty and greasy which bothered me.  

the compost bin was lined with a black plastic garbage bag.  that is ridiculous to me.  i guess it's just for show.

i probably will only come back for a burrito if i'm desparate next time
author: Tina A.

description:
Yuuuuuuum. The carnitas in my burrito was crunchy and savory.Seriously enjoyable. 
I probably won't ever go here again though just because its in a very strange part of the city, but yum yum yum!
author: Issy D.

description: Tofu Fajitas as tasty but the price $11.75 is kind of ridiculous.
author: Yang Q.

description: Just really good burritos. Filling and tasty. Throw in some chips and green sauce and you're eating for less than $10. Call in your order and you're in and out. Thank you please.
author: Thousand Words P.

description: Everything here is so good, I always get the breakfast burrito. the workers are nice and it never takes too long. Everything also looks pretty clean from the front and its super vegetarian friendly!
author: Caroline A.

description:
This place is quite the find. I actually only went there when the place I had intended to go was close. Glad I had that chance encounter.

This was the best vegetarian burrito I have possibly ever had, or at very the least in a very long time.

We both agreed on that point.

We both ordered the El terrapin with cheese. It was delicious! Super flavorful.

Note than when you order this they will then ask for what group of veggies you want. Each of the
Vegetarian burritos has a different selection of veggies. So state the burrito name to choose the veggie selection.

They provided complimentary chips and salsa. I opted to try the green and red. They were both a bit spicy, but tolerable. And both were very flavorful.

This little hole in the wall restaurant provides great flavor and quick service. The menu looks very extensive, and offers more than just a simple burrito. I definitely recommend checking this place out.

I suggest planning to take it to go as the environment is more conducive to that and the seating is lacking.
author: Zoe D.

description:
After being a customer for many years, and after getting a busy signal for 30 minutes, this happened tonight over the phone at 8:40p-

Me: Can I place an order for pick up? 
EBE: No, we are closing.
Me:  Your hours say you close at 9pm.
EBE:  Yes, we are closing. 
Me: But you're not closing until 9. 
EBE: Yes, we are closing.
Me: It won't take 20 minutes to make the nachos I want to order, and I'm 5 minutes away.
EBE: I'm sorry, we are closing. 
Me: I'm now less than 5 minutes away. Are you serious???
EBE: I am sorry, we are closing. 

Not as sorry as you will be when I never, ever return.  Someone needs to grab this location by the lapels and shake some damn sense into it. It's ridiculous.
author: Jenn J.

description:
I have eaten a lot of burritos, some good and some bad, but this place is very meh.  

The burritos are rather dry so you have to remember to ask them to put a few cups of salsa into them, or get the wet style burrito.  Even then the ingredients do not taste very good.   

I end up going here when I am in the area and feel super lazy to go elsewhere, otherwise its not really worthwhile. 

Not really sure what all the hype is about.  Also, their atm machine breaks down regularly (or so they claim) so bring cash.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I've been going to El Burrito since I was a little boy. They've always been quality and never disappoint. If you love dry burritos, get their carnitas Super Bronco burrito (I call it the John Elway). Their wet burritos are also mouth-watering. I recommend the chicken/sour cream El Expresso burrito. My friend ordered the El Macho burrito today, their foot long special, and it's enough to feed a small nation. 

You can find their menu on www.ebxsf.com. If you're in a rush, call ahead of time and avoid the line. 

My tummy gives El Burrito Express...5 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description:
My roommates and I all ordered burritos for delivery at 5:10, and delivery starts at 5 PM. The person who answered the phone was pretty short and to the point and said the delivery would be there in 30-45 minutes, but they arrived in 20. I didn't give them 5 stars only because we buzzed the delivery boy in and we had to wait another 5 minutes only to open the door to see him standing at the bottom of the staircase refusing to walk up them... 
I ordered the fresh mix burrito (vegetarian) which was really good. They put broccoli and cauliflower amongst other vegetables which made it different from most Mexican places that offer vegetarian food. We ordered four burritos total and they only gave us one tiny bag of chips and two containers of salsa, so maybe ask for extra.
author: Emma G.

description: This was definitely my fav spot during high school..when in the area and I'm hungry for a burrito I always stop in. Can't get enough of the expresso chicken burrito..so yummy!! Not usually a wet burrito person but my dad turned me onto it when I would visit him at work.
author: Austin C.

description:
No better burrito on that side of San Francisco. Their nor cal burrito as well as the expresso burrito (wet burrito) are both worth the taste. It may be far removed from the Mission but they definitely put together some quality taqueria cuisine for the Sunset. Their mango pork tacos are also something to try. 

One piece of advice is to call in your order, the line gets long and there isn't much standing room in the shop itself.
author: David M.

description:
I've grown up coming and eating here, and then since moving back from college in Davis, my sister and I decide to come here because she was craving Mexican food. wow, were we disappointed. sorry, el burrito but my standards have changed. for the better.

1) I'm sorry but what kind of Mexican restaurant does not offer lengua (beef tongue) and other kinds of savory meats?! SO SAD.

2) I ordered asada fries and my sister ordered the NorCal burrito, as well as an horchata. the horchata lacked and was very watered down. upon taking our food out to go, my asada fries were actually foiled on a paper plate instead of in a legit to-go box ----- ahhhh that makes me so frustrated at how inefficient and messy that is. for $6 I expect my asada fries to be better cared for (and in bigger proportions ugh). not to mention this took a minute for them to cook this up - people after us ordered more and received their orders faster.

3) it was okay food. I really expected better though... I guess that's what you get for coming to a Mexican place in the fucking sunset.
author: Victoria N.

description: I've used them to cater multiple work events, they are amazing!  The food is probably the best Mexican food I've had in SF, and the price is even better.  I work for a non profit, so affordability is always a must, and it just happens to be amazing food that everyone loves.  The green salsa, better than my Mexican mom's.  I'm surprised they don't have a better rating on Yelp, they have been great every single time I've used them.  And I'm about to place an order right now, which is how I ended up here :)
author: Sintia M.

description:
Not too shabby Mexican place on Taraval.  Usually order the carne asada burrito here, but wouldn't mind ordering the nachos next time around.

Docked One Star, because there are times when they can be super slow getting your order particularly when everyone's coming home from work.
author: Joshua P.

description:
I am done with this place! Sorry to say never ever am I going back. Their lack of service, attention, and mediocre food is not worth your time or money.  I've been going to El Burrito Express from time to time over the past 15 years.  And on more occasions than not, they have messed up my order. Why did I keep coming back? I live in the area and I wanted to support my community.

The straw(s) that broke the camel's back:
Messing up my order (again)
Automatically charging 10 cent for a bag without letting customer's know and getting upset at me when I didn't want one
Letting "friends" cut in line and take their orders 1st when there is a line out the door

This place should not be called El Burrito "Express" as it takes forever to get your food even if you place your order over the phone.  Take your time and money to the other establishments in the Sunset area. I'd recommend Gordo on 9th, La Playa on Noriega, or Chipotle on Sloat Blvd.
author: kevin l.

description: The burritos here are out of this world. I've been going here for about 4 years and they always seem to make some bomb burritos. I actually think it would be cool if they had a dragon burrito. Dragon burrito, consisting of very hot peppers including but not limited to habanero peppers, jalapenos, bell peppers, banana peppers, then numerous other flaming hot peppers. with the way in which they make up their burritos I think it would be a nice addition. Unlike some of the other burrito places I've been to in this area I do not finish my burrito feeling like I have diarrhea. this is a major plus for me. However, their prices can seem a bit high at times. I do like the fact that they now accept credit card payments. The space of the restaurant is quite small so if you're going there with a large group I would definitely want her to go. parking can be a bit difficult but I would suggest taking public transportation to get there or going there with a friend.
author: Robert F.

description: DON"T DO IT! Poor quality everything. The steak is always burnt to a crisp and wtf is up with the layer of half-melted shredded cheddar cheese that just turns into clumps? This place was only good for their churros which they stopped selling like 15 years ago. I will never understand why it gets so packed everyday during dinner time while these poor customers are forced to sit outside by their nasty garbage cans waiting a half hour for a meal that will probably make them sit on the toilet for the rest of the night.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
I hate this place.

The food is fine, but not great. But the real reason why I avoid this place is that the service is atrocious. On any given night, the line is out the door due to the small, run-down location. That's understandable for a busy taqueria with little competition in the neighborhood, but not when there are anywhere from 3-6 employees conversing behind the counter, decidedly *not* making burritos. It's one thing to wait for your food from a bustling place where you can tell that the employees are doing what they can to get you your order, it's an entirely different thing when the entire restaurant is filled with hungry customers and the employes are laughing and talking behind the counter. 

I live right around the corner from El Burrito Express, but have decided that when I really want a burrito I'll head over to the Mission.
author: Rachel T.

description:
I discovered this place while attending high school nearby and have been coming back for 17 years. Their expresso burrito is the burrito by which I rate my other burrito experiences, and so far it remains a the top of my list. The heart of this burrito is the grilled skirt steak they use and the smoky flavor that comes with it. It is very flavorful. Their asada fries, feturing the same steak, are pretty tasty as well.

They have two locations Taraval and Divisadero. The Taraval location is quite small less than 10 stools available for seating. The Divisadero location has more seating available with about 6-9 tables.
author: Jose U.

description: Extremely disappointed with this place.  Moved here to the sunset about a year ago, hit this spot on my first day loved the food hated the service.  After about a year later I find myself hating this place more and more.  Not to forget that are starting to charge extra for everything. Everything is over priced now.  I'm boycotting this spot for ever,  don't be fooled other Mexican spots around the sunset.
author: Kevin H.

description:
So I went to another restaurant, La Corneta over in Glen Park.  I must have bad luck with the 'buttons' of the avocados, since I bit into one from their burrito.  Guess it does happen sometimes...

Upping this to 3 stars and I like EBX's Pot beans.  Will try EBX again and hopefully give it 4 - 5 stars.
author: EJ K.

description: Very average.  Sooooo many better options in SF for a good burrito.  Save your $$$ and eat some where that knows how to make a burrito
author: Jeff S.

description:
The burritos here are decent and I would probably give this place a rating a little closer to a 3.5.  The burritos are somewhat similar to the burritos you get down in so cal.  If you're in this part of the city looking for a good burrito this is the place to go to.  I personally think they are a lot better than: Gordos, La Playa Taqueria, El Beach Burrito.

Plus, another positive is they DELIVER on most days!!! I don't know of any other burrito place that delivers.

If you do have a hankering for a so cal type of burrito I would recommend just ordering the NorCal burrito w/o Sour Cream and Guac.
author: Mike S.

description:
Its a shame that I didn't review El Burrito Express earlier, because the home runs they were hitting last year have turned into seeing-eye singles (This'll be a baseball themed review, I'm excited for spring training).

The Super Bronco Burrito still provides an well-sized meal for under seven dollars, the "Pot Beans" are still outstanding, tortillas are helaciously grilled to a near-charred perfection, and the radiant heat exuded from the burrito's foil-wrap is enough to warm my hands on a cold Outer-Sunset evening, but yet, these star players are getting rapidly overshadowed by the stoogery of the rest of their teammates (seriously excited about spring training)

What form do these bumbling inadequacies take? On the top of the lineup is poor burstage abatement, rupturing the burrito half-way through. This may have been caused by the next fool in the batting order, well-sauced, although tough and salty Chile Verde pork, which was inconsistently spread throughout. Veggies were under-represented as well, with avocado showing up for its role late in the game. Its attendance though was better then spice, because my requests for "extra-spicy with Jalapenos" were apparently ignored. 

What does this leave us with? The 2006 Giants: carried by a couple of strong players (am I the only one who remembers Jason Schmidt?), but otherwise strictly mediocre, and riding on a legacy of unrealized greatness. Just like the 2006 team, these guys have the potential for a World Series appearance, but too-often find themselves a distant 3d in the Burrito League West. Seriously, I'm way too excited for the baseball season to start.
author: Casey U.

description:
Looks like shady receipt continues! I ordered the El Expresso burrito with steak and got charge $7.55 and then they charge extra $0.75 for the asada. And no, I didn't even hint of asking for extra steak.

Looks like they either charge you extra or the total doesn't add up.

I'll rather go to another Burrito place even Taco Bell.

Burrito was okay for the most part. Wait was 10 minutes.
author: Jac J.

description: I moved in down the street a couple years back and this has been my main burrito spot. Sometimes they get your order wrong if you're picky, but when they get it right it is the best damn burrito you'll ever eat.
author: Dev B.

description: The best burrito around, but terrible service. Often the mostly Latino staff is busy talking amongst one another while taking the order or giving the food. As a result, they have gotten the order wrong a couple of times. I get the feeling that I did something that offended that lady or something. For the sake of the owners, I hope I am the only one who feels like this, or else they are losing business.
author: Nikhil P.

description: found a piece of ceramic counter top plastic shit in my burrito...so gross and dirty wont return only go here if u want food poisoning
author: Lara C.

description:
Stopped by one day cuz I figured I should try a new burrito place and I've always been skeptic about a Mexican joint in the Sunset.  I've heard a couple of good things about this place so why not?  My rule is that I only give burrito places one chance to impress me.  The verdict here: Won't be stopping in unless I'm totally desperate for burritos and I have no way to transport myself to another part of town.

Ordered the Expresso Burrito with grilled steak.  Looked appealing in its to-go box but noticed it was poorly wrapped as I started cutting into it.  They say there is guacamole.  Was it that green gloopy liquid (that tasted like nothing) I saw hidden underneath the sauce?   Must've been it.  Some pieces of the steak were too chewy for my taste and I would appreciate if they ask what beans I would like.  The burrito isn't as packed to the brim with filling/ingredients as the burritos I've had elsewhere.  The rice, beans, meat, and the whole shebang just kind of sprinkled out whereas it would be pouring out like a mad flood of deliciousness at other places.  Overall, the burrito just did not hit the spot.  Sad to say.

Service has much to be desired for.  I know this isn't even a restaurant but the lady taking orders could have refrained from resting her head on her hands while she was taking orders like she was really annoyed.  (Or maybe she was just having a rough day or something.  I'll give her the benefit of the doubt.)  But seriously, the wait for the food took a while.  There weren't too many people when I went so I don't understand what took so long.  

Only upside are the prices and the TV they have for the handful of people who decide to eat there or who are waiting for their orders.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
I must say the burritos here are the best in the sunset hands down, but the service consistently leaves a the opposite kind of taste in my mouth. 
Last week I returned with my girlfriend; the woman behind the counter charged the wrong amount to her debit card and instead of just charging the extra $5 on a separate transaction to complete the amount, she insisted on trying to refund and then charge the full amount again. Needless to say two days later when everything cleared, her card had been double charged. 
Went here for my second visit a couple months ago, picked up my burrito and walked out. Realizing only moments later I forgot to ask for salsa I went back inside only to wait for the next 5 minutes while the ladies behind the counter chatted next to the line, not even allowing eye contact for me to get their attention. 

Wish they could get it together because their food is great.
author: Eric M.

description: Gotta try the hard shell crunchy beef tacos with hot sauce! My fave for years. This place has counter seating for about 6 people. It is small so most people order to go. They also serve my favorite steak burritos anywhere! Tip: ask for the green sauce to dip your chips in!
author: Ray S.

description: Mediocre burritos. Happened numerous times where I got hung up on or they just didn't want to answer the phone. Unfortunately this is the only burritos spot near my house.
author: Matt M.

description:
Service: not friendly. Didn't offer me salsa- I think it's complementary but it was crowded so I didn't feel like asking for it (it's behind the counter). Really small portion of chips anyway.

Got el expresso catnitas.  The portion certainly is big. But taste is so so. Also I got to-go, and the burrito got kind of stuck to the paper container.

Prolly won't go again. But if you just want a big portioned meal, and aren't picky, I guess it meets your purpose.
author: Kimberly J.

description: I enjoyed the tacos and especially the chips and guac. Two thumbs up.
author: Sunil R.

description:
They close at 9. I called SEVERAL TIMES at 7pm..one call went to voicemail.. Another, a lady picked up but wasn't talking to me AND THEN hung up on me...third time I called the signal was bad and got disconnected or she hung up... And last, the fourth time I called, the same lady (I assume) picked up and finally told me that there are no deliveries.. Thanks. 
Very misleading..
author: Windy L.

description: Only go there if you live nearby and want something fast in the middle of the day
author: Sky M.

description:
What is with all the hype? The guy at the register is nice. I'm gonna keep it short. 

There are so many burrito options and crazy names, I really can't tell the difference between the Bronco burrito, burrito, mustang super, espresso, asdfdhsfjkl. So I ordered 3 burritos and one order of nachos. The carnitas is very tasty but there wasn't enough of it. The cheese on the nachos is absolutely horrendous. DON'T GET CHEESE. Dad got sick from their chicken burrito. He was vomiting the entire week and there was also a huge piece of plastic (from the tortillas bag?) in his burrito. Perhaps he accidentally ate the plastic and thus vomited. Perhaps..... 

STAY AWAY! I questioned the cleanliness of this place.... Especially when there was a woman mopping the floor with all the bleach and chemical smells in the kitchen while the women in the assembly line were making the food... Why oh why didn't I run away then?! WHY?! No more of this place. I guess I'll have to be brave and go to the Mission for La Palma burritos since there are no other decent Mexican places in Parkside/Sunset/Richmond. Oh man. *Holds breathe and drives through the Mission at night hoping no one will stab me or my burrito.
author: Jay L.

description: Worst burrito I have ever had and I am Mexican and I have liked or loved every burrito I have ever had. Plus, they put fake yellow cheese on it because it didn't melt so it had to be soy cheese. It didn't taste good. They didn't add what I paid extra for. I ordered 4 burritos and they were not good. One was not as  gross as the rest.
author: Bianca S.

description:
Purists may raise an eyebrow at the prospect of a good burrito to be found in the foggy Outer Sunset, but as a resident of the area, I can definitely appreciate El Burrito Express for its far more convenient location. While it's definitely no El Farolito or Taqueria Cancun, it's still a hefty burrito that satisfies the craving (which I have often).

Try their spin on the California burrito, which I think they call the NorCal burrito - carne asada, cheese, guacamole, salsa, and french fries! It would be insulting to say that it mirrors any that are served in San Diego, but it would also be a lie if I didn't admit that it's still, on its own, a super deliciously cracktastic version that will induce the foodiest of food comas if you attempt to eat any more than half of it.
author: Betty W.

description:
They suck.  They suck bad.  Go two doors down, the food is better there.

I went there in like June 2012 to get a free burrito because I had saved all these receipts with frequent buyer stamps on them.  When I tried to claim it, the lady told me they don't honor the stamps on receipts anymore.  Only stamps on their cards.  If I had known, I would have gotten my free burrito months earlier.  But I forgave them.

Then in August 2012, I brought in three cards with a total of 10 stamps (1 more than needed for a free burrito).  The lady told me I needed all the stamps on one card.  There isn't even enough space on a card for 9 stamps!  I paid for my burrito again.  After this, I swore I would not return for at least year to protest.  

Today, some of my coworkers bought burritos.  They had to pay an extra 75 cent additional charge for beef in burritos but that price change is not on their menus.  Some please sue them.  

What is the matter with this place?  First they screw frequent buyers and now they sneak in an extra 75 here and there hoping you don't notice.  What's next?  A fee for breathing their air or walking on their dirty floor or sitting on their dirty chairs or eating on their dirty tables?  I used to love this place but I hate it now.
author: STEVE L.

description:
I love El Burrito Express's carne asada! They are charred, chunky, tender, and flavorful.

The Grande Nachos are filling, enough for two to share or one hungry, tiny gal. I love how their tortilla chips are house fried instead of store bought. 

The Chicken Tamale was huge but extremely bland and hard. It was forgettable and something I wouldn't order again. 

Tip(s):
- There is a $10.00 minimum for cards
- Parking can be tough on Taraval but I have lucked out and found metered parking right in front.
author: Juliette R.

description: This is a neighborhood taqueria that hasn't changed in 20 years.  Its about 10 years since I last had their steak express and I am happy to report no change.   Why mess with a good thing?  The food has a home cooked appeal to it.  The restaurant is tiny there is absolutely no place to sit with the exception of 4 tiny stools.  The steak e xpresso is my go to here. It is fantastic,  sloppy, hearty and enormous.  Probably the only meal you'll need for the day
author: Fitzgerald M.

description: Someone should open another mex food spot on taravel. EBX is okay. Service kinda sucks and they seem to know they are the only Mex food spot in the area because they are really SLOW despite the Express name. Also don't understand their hours seem to be close on Sundays and closed kinda early on their regular days? I like a nice burrito on Sunday afternoons... Kinda waiting for someone to open a better less attitude Mexican food spot in the area. Two stars is for their delivery, only redeeming quality I've noticed.
author: JB R.

description:
"Express" my ass! The customer service here is horrible. You will be waiting at the cash register for a good 5 minutes until they take your order..you will be waiting another 5 minutes just to pay...then a good 10 minutes to get your food. These people are rude and super slow at everything they do. They stand behind the counter talking to eachother rather than taking orders or making your food :/
The food on the other hand isn't bad. My favorite thing from ebx is the shit load of chips and guac you get for $5!!! :) & the jarritos! that is all....
author: Erika V.

description: The shredded chicken burrito was yum! Wish the Horchata had more flavor, it was very milky! But that's ok, the chips were delicious, the hot sauce just right, too. I will be back
author: Arizona R.

description:
Ugh! I'm so pissed right now (maybe I shouldn't be writing in the shitty mood I'm in) but really, it's their own fault. 

First of all, their burritos are just okay. The carnitas was terribly salty, and the only reason it wasn't too overwhelming was because they hardly put any in the fucking burrito to begin with. Intentional? Possibly. 

Secondly, what the hell is the point of pre-ordering on the phone for pick up if when I get there it isn't made and I have to wait like everyone else?!! The guy after me in fucking line got his burrito first! What the hell?!! 

"Express" my ass. These workers are slow as shit too. I've never had to wait so long for a burrito in my life! Everything is pre-made!! Just put it in a fucking tortilla and roll the fucker. How hard can it be?!!

I think that they are lucky that they're the only burrito place in the local area and they're right by a train stop. I don't think they'd get much business otherwise. 

To hell with this place. If I'm ever in the mood for a burrito and I'm stuck around this neighborhood, I'm going to starve myself until I get somewhere decent.
author: Darkie L.

description:
El Burrito Express had always had good food, but their service has always been iffy.  This evening, it was much worse than usual.  We phoned our order in and the woman who answered felt rushed and did not take our name or give us a number.  When I arrived to pick up my order, the surly cashier, a woman in her early 20's with blond streaks in her black hair, asked me what I wanted. I told her that we phoned in an order and she asked me what I ordered.  When I explained my order, she cut me off and asked for the order number.  When I told her that no number was given, she smugly said we always give out our order number.  There was no other customers in the restaurant and  about 5 employees standing around behind the counter shooting the breeze.

Our cashier, pushed the bag of food toward me and I waited there while she conversed with her pals and ignored me.  Finally, I asked about the price and she looked a little peeved.  She flopped the change back  into my hand and said nothing.  Apparently, Burrito Express has way too much business and can afford to be uncivil to its customers. 

There is a prominent tip jar  on display next to the register.  Now why would anybody in there right mind want to tip this lousy service?  Our cashier was probably having a bad evening - maybe she failed her high school exit exam for the 3rd time!

When we got home, there were no packets of hot sauce.  Our burritos were good, but the tortilla was very tough.  Regardless of what the Burrito Eater recommends, I think we'll try to find another place for our burrito fix.
author: Robert J.

description: A bit on the expensive side, but the food is good and authentic and the guacamole is fresh made daily. Worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood and looking for a quick bite. 3 stars because of expense and the small amount of space.
author: Alex C.

description: Slice of Mexico. Heaven in the heart of the sunset.  Take a flight or ride to Mexico and remember the quality and quantity.
author: Laura P.

description:
The burritos are good. The beef is a notch above regular carne asada, in that it has some texture of the skirt steak variety. This is also one of the few places that features a california burrito (albiet, at $8-9).  

The thing that irks me is that they've twiced messed up my receipt by overcharging me. The first time I thought it was some odd mistake, took it for a one off and threw away the receipt.  

The second time, I used the $5 burrito coupon on their website and the receipt was again wrong. I didn't notice it until after I got home, but it makes zero sense. 

Check it out here:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uCeCkdHHeaJnU4hGAe2sJQ?select=4-LoxxhuejNU4eErHejZOQ#4-LoxxhuejNU4eErHejZOQ

The burrito was not labeled as $5, but 4.55. The tax at .39 is right, but I ended up paying $5.69. That ends up being 13.8% tax on my $5 burrito. I'm not sure what's going on, but this is the second time and leaves an odd taste in my mouth. Probably won't be back.

Edit: Just looked at all the pictures and saw that there's 2 other receipts posted, which means they do this a lot. 1 star for continual sheisty-ness
author: Bryan M.

description:
Simple, Authentic, Local & Honest Burrito. 

For $5 to $6 bucks, it's a great burrito. This is my locals favorite and have been coming here forever !
author: Tim D.

description: EXTREMELY poor service. I've been to this place several times so it feels like this is the norm, rather than the exception.  The workers have been rude, short or disinterested (with few exceptions) every time I've been here over the past few years.  I am not someone who needs to be catered to or 'served' when I go out to grab something to eat. I prefer, though, not to be treated as if I'm somehow the cause for someone's misery simply because I'm ordering a burrito. Depending on what you order the food is okay to good. If you keep it simple ( carne asada quesadilla) then it'll probably be good. I'm not a huge fan of the more saucy-ish style of some of the things that they offer, but that is probably just my taste. If you do go be prepared to WAIT and do your best to ignore the rude, annoying service.  You're probably better off at a diner or dumpling house somewhere on Taravel.
author: Jack D.

description:
El Burrito Express has been stepping up their game - the burritos have been higher quality, and the delivery? Super fast, and great for the car less masses,

The Macho Burrito is my ish -- almost $10, which is high, but I can get 2 to 3 meals from this bad boy. Or eat it all at once and feel lots of regret. 

Make sure you get the frequent burrito card - 9 purchases and #10 is free.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
While driving in Parkside looking for the nearby police station in order to file a police report (my girlfriend just got defrauded $50,000 from a seldom used BoA bank account), I smelled grilled meat in the air. After looking around, I found the source of the delicious smell: El Burrito Express.

Conclusions:
-Chile Relleno burrito was surprisingly good! Nom Noms! (^_^)
-Bonus points for the freshly fried tortilla chips and the delicious spicy red chile salsa.
-Very affordable.
-Most authentic Mexican food in SF I have had so far. No black beans or spinach tortillas found in this culinary establishment from what I saw.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
25 years ago, I was a high school student and frequented El Burrito Express.  I remembered the food being good, but not great.  Its really small and they were always really slow and disorganized.   But it worked.

Fast forward to 2012...I was in the old neighborhood and was surprised to see its still there.  I stopped in at 1030 in the morning for a breakfast burrito.  I was the only customer in the store.  They were, however, working on a large catering order.  There were six (6) people working behind the counter.  It was obvious the catering order was more important than me, the walk up customer, and my breakfast burrito.  I thought for sure someone would stop, take the 2 minutes to make the burrito, and set me free.

I was in the store for over 24 minutes waiting for my burrito!!!  How do I know it was 24 minutes?  Because the coin meter in front of the store charges 25 cents for 8 minutes and I put in 3 quarters...I had planned on eating there.  I was so upset that they completely blew me off, I demanded a refund and left.  The meter was expired!!

No apoplogies, no eye contact, and all the workers stopped working for about 2 minutes to argue with one another...while I was standing there.

They lost this customer forever.  There are way more taquerias around with better food.  After 25 years, still as slow and disorganized as ever and customer service is questionable.
author: John B.

description:
Shockingly good taco from a place with the looks (small dive) and location (Chinese neighborhood) that I would never ordinarily trust for good, much less great, Mexican food. (Cal-Mex) However I was desperate for something to eat in a hurry, so I tried it, and I was really surprised that it matched the Mission's best.

Pricing is a mystery to me. Soft tacos with meat are supposed to be about $3.5 but mine was $5 - the added avocado slices (fresh, not over-ripe, yay!) I understand, but I think the carne asada was an up-charge too. However they were really grilling the flank steak up fresh on the grill (looks like big slabs of flank steak, anyway), and it was well worth it, esp. with the free classicly oily but crunchy tortilla chips.

Practically no seating except a long counter mostly hogged by customers waiting for their take-out, but I found a seat and enjoyed my dine-in.

Tiny, but authentic. Well authentically Mission-style!
author: MDubb W.

description:
El Expresso Burrito!! When I am in the mood for mexican this is my go-to burrito! Not only is it amazing, but it is enormous. Unlike many other places they load the amount of meat that comes in it (carnitas is my favorite).  I prefer to get just the expresso sauce and cheese on top, although it comes with other stuff as well, and it is delicious. A couple sides of the hot red salsa and some chips and I am good to go! Their other food is great as well, but I find it hard for me to order anything else..If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
It can be busy at times (which is a good sign to me!) so I recommend calling in what you want and then picking up to save some time.
author: Derek M.

description:
Holy sheezits. I don't think I've ever been THAT uncomfortable in an eating establishment in my life. And wished THAT hard that I had remembered more from my high school spanish classes. This is not about food. I guess there was some dispute and the workers (markedly a lady in a bandana) were going off in spanish about something, while the place was getting really filled. Someone should have stepped in, but there was just more of that lady squabbling and the rest just staring at her. 

The place is disorganized and TINY, everyone gets confused as to who has ordered, who hasn't (I guess you can't do much about that). 

I ordered an avocado tostada ($2.75 but it says $7.50 on the menu...?!?! so it was small but I thought it was gonna be large) and the wait for it was ridiculous. Like... 15 minutes or something. For a small tostada!! The carnitas was too salty. It was NOT good. Regular pieces of torn lettuce, some american shredded cheese and pinto beans. Really, I could have made this at home myself. 

I think the burritos are ok, good as u can get in the Parkside. But I'll just head to Chipotle. =/ Thanks for the free soda, Yelp.
author: Christine Y.

description: had to go in & see if they changed, again each time new problem, since when did they hot grill their tortillas before wrapping a "super"? why is the question, was tortilla old & hard where they had to grill it, i don't mind the grill, but, when you burn it, that's too much. secondly, are you that lazy to spread out the sour cream & guac? they just scoop & plunk in one spot. i realize your'e busy, but c'mon do a better & correct job. Gordos here I come!
author: david c.

description:
I took Whorechata J.'s advice (because who wouldn't take advice from someone with a name like that?!) and ordered the NorCal burrito with tofu.

Oh. Oh my. I loved it. Melty, yummy, made-to-order goodness. Be warned that you may have to wait a lil extra if you order fries, since they make 'em fresh -- but let it be known, I will wait as long as it takes for any form of deep-fried potatoes to come to me. Because I asked them to hold the cheese, they let me throw in beans.. fo' free! Wonderful. The lady at the register even recited what would be in my burrito (especially helpful because they don't list their NorCal burrito on the menu). I didn't realize how totally accommodating and customizable this place is too -- you can order your burrito crisped or with different types of wrap (whole wheat, spinach, tomato). Gotta try next time.

This place didn't get my 5 stars because (1) I'm a sucker for green salsa, and theirs, while good, ain't mindblowing, (2) chips are just aight, and (2) obviously wouldn't go here for the ambiance. But the food? Goooodddd
author: Julie D.

description:
We have lived out here in the outer sunset for over 7 years now, and have ordered from El Burrito Express several times. While not fantastic, the burritos are good solid sustinance. 

As of late they have had banners and posters in the window offering delivery. We called tonight for delivery and they said that it would take one to one and a half hours. Ok Its Saturday night, thats ok. Then they said maybe more than that we don't know the driver is still out. 

Ummm, even if they said "So Sorry, we dont have this delivey systm together yet" I would have understood. Thats not real delivery guys, please get your shiz together, or don't offer a service that you cannot provide.
author: Amanda L.

description:
We've been meaning to try this place since we moved to the Parkside almost a month ago. The whole family had a late day and no one felt like cooking (a rarity) so...
OMG-
THE BEST BURRITOS and MEXICAN FOOD IN THE CITY-
No joke
They make a "Macho" burrito that is a foot long-
you choose two kinds of meat and the works on TWO giant tortillas
dinner and lunch for tomorrow=$11.00!!
I am lying on my stomach to supress the pain of too much goodness.
author: Antoinette S.

description: Yesterday I was in the area and craving a burrito, so I stopped by to grab one for me and two for my kids. I would have given 4 stars because of the food, but had to give 3 since one woman had really bad energy. Maybe she was having a bad day but when I ask to have a drink opened there is no reason to give me bad body language. Food was good, but such a small place customers that are ordering have to move around for those picking up orders since it all happens in the same tiny space. Food is good, but I probably wouldn't go back since there are many other good quality Mexican food places in SF.
author: Maria L.

description:
Wow. I was really hoping my bad experiences at this place was a fluke. No, it wasn't. The food is pretty awful but maybe I'm ordering the wrong items (which is why I'm giving it two stars and not one). Let's see, I've had a few burritos...meh. I've ordered hard shells tacos...not thing to rave about. Definitely scared to waste my money there again.

I don't mind paying money for good food, especially in a run down place (because those are sometimes the places that really delight) but it's a little disappointing when your food absolutely sucks and you don't even feel like finishing it. This place has a great and inviting menu but it truly disappoints. Someone needs to come in and do some Q&A with the food. On top of that, the place is way to pricey for the lack of quality when it comes to their food.

Next time I want to eat at a taqueria, I'm venturing out to Chino's in the Outer Richmond. Been going there for over twenty years and the food has always been consistent.
author: J C.

description: The service could be better and faster.  I don't expect them to smile and ask me how my day was.
