I would like it if when my burrito is finished they could bag it and give it to me quickly.  It sat there for 3 to 4 mins while the lady at the front took a phone order.  End result was a soggy and unappetizing burrito.  And no salsa or napkins in the bag?  Maybe they just forgot
author: Johnny W.

description:
I got a Breakfast Burrito and was the BEST of the BESTS-- for which i had to wait a very long time even though the place wasnt that crowded or anything (it was around 5pm), also they charged me an extra 10c for plastic bag which they did not ask me upfront if i want it or not! (i dont like getting charged without my knowledge!)


//
author: Kim K.

description:
I used to go here years ago back when I was in high school because it was convenient for our off campus lunch. It was pretty awesome back then so I figured since I haven't had them in a while (7+ years ago) and in the spirit of cinco de mayo I would have some Mexican food.

I tried calling today (Monday, May 5, 2014) for a delivery order because surprisingly they say free delivery order from their sunset location. I only live down the street but I am in the middle of studying for a big test coming up and don't want to leave my house (yes laziness at its finest).  The guy answered the phone and was hesitant about even taking the delivery order, but continued to ask me what I wanted so I told him the cabo taco and a torta, they were out of tortas so I had to choose something else. SO I mentioned that  I want a burrito and start to say what I want in it.... So I say spanish rice (there is a long pause between us because I was waiting for confirmation that he got that I wanted that type of ice, as it is loud over on his end of the phone line) and then he goes which burrito (with attitude) and I respond with well I am trying to tell you what I want in it, he continues with "you know what can you just call me back when you know what you want". I reply with well I told you what I wanted and you don't have what I want so now I have to order something else, he sighs and then I just respond with you know what if you are going to act like that then I won't order.

Unfortunately I hung up on him, but I can't stand when people act like they hate their job over the phone, his voice dragged on and was very hesitant to take my order when I asked for delivery. If you are busy and understaffed and can't deliver just say that, don't give customers attitude over the phone. You just lost customers El burrito express. I hope you guys teach your employees how to handle phone calls and make sure they pretend like they even give a damn about their freakin job.

Sorry I try not to write too many bad reviews about places but this kid gave me attitude on the wrong day!
author: Mandi S.

description:
pretty busy usually; customer service is so-so. 

I like their breakfast quesadilla - inside are eggs and chorizo. But it is very, very oily. I also usually opt for Tomato Salsa

People usually go for a Super Burrito.
author: Derek M.

description:
I figured this was the only burrito spot in the area.

The carnitas burrito was alright, but chalk this place up as one more burrito place that needs to put al pastor on the menu.

Like most burrito joints in SF, these are as big as your head. Only go if you're super hungry.
author: Brendan C.

description: A great economical place to get take-out if you are looking for a quick bite on a Friday after work. This place is a favorite of the local Sunset/Parkside crowd. A good deal if you buy ala carte. Never had a bad meal there. There is a wait though, so be patient. Calling in might be a good idea.
author: Debi L.

description:
Most of you know that the outer sunset is extremely foggy, right?!  Well, I'm starting to believe that all this fog is LITERALLY fogging the minds of those who consume food from El Burrito Express.  Or they're all just drunk.  I live on the same block, and as a close-by resident I was stoked to have a burrito place with such high reviews within walking distance.

I know what you're thinking, "What makes you a burrito/Mexican food expert?"

To answer, I did grow up in Southern California, and lived in San Diego.  I know, I know, that does not make me an expert, but it surely allows me to recognize quality.

Neither of their salsas, red or green, are spectacular in any way.  They steam their tortillas and then wrap them in foil.  This means that when you go to eat the burrito the tortilla is wet and chewy.  This seems to be the San Francisco way- Doesn't anyone grill their tortillas??  I have been here 3 times, and every one of them I have regretted.

SoCal Mexican food, you are missed.
author: Angela G.

description:
Burritos are bland if you don't add all the sauce on top, much better places around the city to get burritos

Dont know why people like this place, they add water to the refried beans so they dont harden, thats nasty who knows if thats from yesterday. People only go here because no other mexican place around. Expresso burrito only editable if you get the sauce on top w/o it its bland and dry YUCK
author: Len A.

description:
It took me years to find them, but I can honestly say, that the best veggie burritos come from this place! It saddens me deeply that I only figured out about this place my last week in California (after 19 years!)... and to be honest, Chicago hasn't proven itself to me in the burrito department yet.

The veggie burritos are awesome here -- and I HIGHLY recommend to get it "wet"! 

Small place, mostly to go orders, but fairly quick to make them, and very efficient. They're a bit surly, but they've been working on their feet all day long taking in stupid requests from picky eaters like you... so give them a break, give them a tip, and say thank you -- you'll be surprised by the smile you get in return, and maybe even some extra salsa!

Honestly, this place does it right! (As long as you're not the pretentious/fine dining type).
author: Vicky B.

description:
$7.28 Burrito, sour cream and cheese. 

I come here in the evenings for the best local burrito. I stick to either the pork or steak but both are marvelous with just enough sour cream and cheese. The chicken is good too but not my favorite although everything here is quality. The chips are not great and really unnecessary because the burrito is so dang huge. The red salsa might be better than the green which is surprising but both are great and a bit on the mild side.   

Don't plan on eating here because its really not that nice, actually its a dive but the food is great and the prices excellent.
author: Justin S.

description:
I LOVE BURRITOS! 

And I especially love burrito places that are easily accessible. Since this place is located near my boyfriend's house, we regularly walk over here to get our burrito fix.

I have become addicted to their chile relleno and norcal burritos. The burritos here are all priced under $10 and are HUGE. If you're near Taraval, stop by here and you won't be disappointed. Plus they throw in a bag of chips. However, if they offer their salsa say no- I found it to be too salty and in no way appetizing.

Also don't forget to bring cash, as this place is cash only like many others around the neighborhood.
author: Surge C.

description:
4 stars for the food, 2 for the service.

Love, love, love the asada fries and NorCal burrito. Yum!

What's ridiculous is they charge 50 cents a shrimp if you want to add that in your burrito. WTH!?!? But other than that the burritos are good. Nachos are great.

My favorite: beef flour quesadilla with sour cream. Omg. 

It takes a while to get your order, so I usually call in first, but I still end up waiting 15 minutes when I get after the 15 minutes I wait to leave my house. If you have time and need a burrito fix in outer sunset this is the place to go!
author: Claire Angelina C.

description: Burritos are grub but i think they need to check those registers. Maybe it's my fault for not looking at the receipt but then again who the hell does when you buy one burrito? Got my burrito, paid for it, got home, grubbed then i happen to look at the receipt and saw something funky. How the hell do you get a total of $8.18 from (Expresso Burrito) $6.85 + (Tax) .58? I posted a pic of the receipt in the photos. Tip for yall, check the receipt before bouncin...
author: Daniel R.

description:
Because I'm soooo indecisive, it takes me forever to pick something off the menu!  Everything here is THAT good.  I mean, you wouldn't think there could be that many options with burritos, but you'd be wrong.  EBX is the proof.

I've never been disappointed with anything here.  The service, the food, nothing.  Ok, well, it would be nice if you could use a card, but alas it's cash only.  And there's usually a bit of a line, but they're quick (watch the ladies slapping together the burritos--it's an art!).  Besides that though... they deliver... burritos!  Not chinese, not pizza--BURRITOS, Mexican food delivery y'all!   Yay!
author: Olivia D.

description:
I've been here a handful of times and have not been disappointed! It was a Saturday night and Bunny and I were trying to figure out what to have for dinner. We weren't sure if we wanted to go to a sit down restaurant or get food to go.  After thinking for some time, we decided on El Burrito Express!

Finding parking was a challenge. The place is located on the corner and easy to get to if taking the muni. However if you're driving, that is a different story. We went up and down the streets looking for a space. There was a time when it looked as if we could fit, but then the rear of the car stuck out so we'd have to move. After driving for about 15 minutes, finally we were able to park!

The size is a bit small and there a step upon entering. If not paying attention, you may trip. Most don't done at El Burrito Express, but you will see people standing around or sitting on the bar stools waiting for their orders. I had decided on the Chili Colorado burrito while Bunny ordered the Northern Cali Burrito. When doing the Yelp check-in, you get a free soda can with a purchase.  We had actually planned on redeeming one from last time, so now when we come back next time, we can use this free offer.

You go up to the counter to order and when your order is ready, they will call out your number. There is a flat screen T.V for enjoyment while waiting on your food. The wait wasn't too long and with a purchase, there is chips and salsa. I enjoyed the Chili Colorado, but it was a bit spicy. The rice and beans made it filling. The chips were crispy and fresh! Bunny's burrito looked good.

We will come back to pick up lunch or dinner when in the mood for a filling burrito!
author: Doris W.

description: Super yummy. If you are picky about your burritos, they will still impress you.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Great food, great prices. Always packed, so you know it has to be amazing. (Also, the only real Mexican option in the neighborhood)
author: Aaron P.

description:
First off, their food is good. I'm a regular.

If you need to fulfill your Mexican fix, you're in the hood, then this IS your spot.

It is a small storefront and I always like to eat my food hot. So it can be snug with regards to the seating.

The customer service is great. Sometimes the wait can be a little long as they deliver and have a lot of people calling in for pick-up.

Steak and shrimp ALL-DAY, if you can stomach $11+ for this burrito it is AmaZing.

Buy 9 get 1 free, ask at the counter.
author: Brendan C.

description: Filthy, slow and not cheap. Needs a good cleaning inside the restaurant. I don't think they have cleaned the place since it opened 20+ years ago. Maybe they don't care since a bulk of business comes from the nearby high school.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
Everyone is always raving about Ocean Taqueria but El Burrito Express is THE BEST in the sunset and surrounding districts! Talk about burritos worth every dollar, this is the place to go. I always get burritos here TO GO. Order quick, they make it quick, and out the door you go. The place is a hole in the wall so most people take it out... hence the name - El Burrito EXPRESS.

My carnitas burrito was so packed. Hot carnitas, black beans, sour cream, guacamole, rice, tomato salsa, basically everything wrapped tightly into a warm flour tortilla. I didn't talk to anyone at the dinner table the whole time I was scarfing it down. I just kept pouring the red hot sauce on the burrito after every bite and consumed it until nothing was left but the foil it was wrapped in. Forget Gordo's and all those other mexican places around because I firmly believe El Burrito Express does a pretty fine job of satisfying any craving you have.

BTW the chips taste fresh as can be. They've got a great crunch and they come in little sandwich baggies.
author: Samantha L.

description: I was there las night and I ate a quesadilla with steak on spinach wrap it was delicious, I can't wait to be back. Thanks to all the workers.
author: Leonor P.

description:
A good option in a part of the city where burrito options are scarce. Their spot on Divis is way better tho. But anyway, I like this place, but I've been double checking the math on my receipts after reading some complaints.. so far so good.

Breakfast burritos all day, btw.
author: Mike T.

description: Their food is sooooooo good!!! However their service is sooooooooooo bad! They are flat out rude sometimes.  Otherwise they would get 5 stars
author: Jason W.

description: Great food, great prices, friendly staff. Just super slow service...Ancient POS system is a big culprit.
author: Tanner M.

description:
The food is edible. The service is horrendous. The people who work here are rude and dismissive for no reason at all. 

I've come to this place twice. The first time, it was quite busy, so I let their rudeness slide since I reasoned they must have been stressed. The second time, the place was empty besides one other person. Despite this, the lady at the counter was rude, interrupted to ask me if I wanted ingredients on my burrito that I had already told her I wanted, and again cut me off to speak on the phone to another customer (with whom she was also rude to). 

I think I'll be getting my food elsewhere, as there are other restaurants within walking distance. Don't waste your time and money. They must stay in business through their catering, as that seems to be popular.
author: Simon C.

description:
El Burrito couldn't be in a better position: they serve some damn good food and are right smack in the middle of the biggest Burritoless District ever know to SF. I live three blocks away, and thus, I am in a good position, too.

We're a pair, El Burrito and I. Their burritos are savory and filling, and each type of burrito can be made vegetarian! Not to mention they have a whole section specifically for veggie burritos. This does not mean they lack in their carne asada or carnitas department, either; my boyfriend craves this place as much as I do. I am a sucker for the bronco and expresso burritos, the avocado tacos, and their chips and salsa verde. 

One thing I would change is their hours: if they were open past 9pm they would get so much more business from the drunks in this neighborhood (myself included).
author: Amanda C.

description: Really good! Their ingredients are so fresh. I had the bronco burrito and it was amazing. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Jack V.

description: Nice, friendly, great food. Exactly what I have been looking for since I moved into the area.
author: Devon B.

description: Great Carne Asada tacos!  Loved their soyrizo too so bomb!
author: Jay H.

description: My favorite place to get the surf and turf burrito! The wait is very long though and even if you try calling in your order, they may not answer. So expect to wait! But the burritos are delicious!
author: Chester Q.

description:
Best burritos on the block! No really though. 

Burritos are huge and tasty! Everyone that works there seems pretty nice. Very good prices! You def get the most outta your money. CA$H ONLY though!
author: Cat M.

description:
I used to hate Mexican food haha! but today, i decided to try something different so i stepped into this restaurant  and looked for some new stuff! i ordered a grill chicken burrito, wow it surprised me! why? because it tasted so freaking good, it only cost $4.9! i can't finish the whole burrito in 15 minutes because it was so BIG! i had to save it for later! haha 
People in this restaurant speak Spanish and Spanglish(lol), i didn't really understand what they were talking about even tho they were speaking English to me lol!
author: Max H.

description:
I always smell delicious odors wafting from this place every morning while waiting for the muni. It's within walking distance of my aunts place so I finally decided to give it a try one afternoon. It's definitely a takeout type place, very small and only around 4 stools for seating.

Got one of their burritos in salad form to go. If you don't want to have a sauceless, forkless meal like I did, remember to get it yourself because they didn't do that for me. Includes a side of crispy thick chips and a free can of soda if you check in. A decent meal for 6 bucks.
author: Julia S.

description:
My office had El Burrito Express catered through ZeroCater. My office LOVED it. They're make-your-own-taco bar went over so well and everyone got excited when I ordered it again. We haven't tried their burrito box or fiesta trays, but the taco bar was brilliant. 
The owner delivered the food herself and answered all the questions I had about ingredients (she's gluten free too! Instant pals!). Furthermore, she was on time, which is vitally important when catering for an office of starving people. 

Overall, great food and service.
author: Natalie P.

description: They have the bomb.com burritos, which are super fresh and made right on the spot. Usually there is always a line but it goes super quick.
author: Rene L.

description:
My friend Dave C. took me here on a fatty run we were doing (which included hitting up Purple Kow and Marco Polo). This place is definitely one of the better burrito places in the Parkside district.

So far I've tried the carnitas tacos and the carnitas bronco burrito. I especially like the carnitas - it's very fresh, full of flavour and juicy. The taco was much bigger than I anticipated. I definitely loved the bronco burrito - beans, cheese, avocado and fresh pico de gallo. The bronco is my preferred one simply because it has whole beans (not refried) and it doesn't have rice which really allows you to savour the meat.

Cheap, convenient, quick service and delicious. All you really need.
author: Angela K.

description:
Since my dad is an avid burrito consumer, he is always on the hunt to discover *the best burrito" He used to drag us down to the mission and church all the time. (If you are a salsa lover, the one on church has a bar dedicated to it.) Both places are 3.5 to 3.75 star worthy.

In any case, a friend recommended El Burrito Express and now he refuses to go anywhere else. Why? 

"They just cannot compare." 

He just loves their bronco burritos! 

I personally love love love their signature burrito. Not only is the buritto generously stuffed and a meal large enough for two, it's topped with tomato enchilada sauce and extra shredded cheese!!! I mean, come on, who doesn't enjoy extra cheese? I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

To round out your meals, each burrito is served with complimentary chips and a choice of two types of salsa.
 
Sue's Quick tips : 

1. Stamp card: Buy 9? Get the 10th free!
2. Check in on yelp? Complimentary can of soda. Just saw this one! 

It may look like a crack in the wall, but it's definitively one you shouldn't miss!
author: Sue T.

description:
I currently live in Southern California, which offers some of the finest Mexican cuisine in this country. And yet when I crave a burrito, nothing never hits the spot quite the way my hometown burrito joint did every Friday when I'd get out of school early and take the L Taraval back to my house with my friends to watch movies until their parents picked them up. 

This place is in the middle of the Sunset District, not exactly known for its taquerias, but it holds its ground. My usual was the chicken expresso burrito with sour cream and avocadoes. The chips are plentiful and crunchy. El burrito express just cannot be beat!! (and "#2," I have to say, is just not the same.)
author: Christina P.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, and I can attest to the popularity of this place.   Us locals just call it the burrito place.  I give them 5 stars for cleanliness.  They scrub the place down regularly from top to bottom. 
  
Great burritos and very authentic. And a sandwich bag full of tortilla chips with hot sauce (red or green upon request) with each order.

My favorite burrito is the carne asada (with hot sauce added), and if you want something light, get the fish soft taco.  They sautee the red snapper and then prepare the taco.

You can call your order in advance and pick up; but part of the experience is ordering at the counter; then waiting for it.  Anticipation.
author: Shirley N.

description: Well, here I am again. I've been back 3 or 4 times since my last review and things were really looking good. I was actually excited because I really want this place to be a favorite of mine and had 3 good experiences in a row, until last time. It was horrible. I can't even remember why. I just know that I'm back to being disappointed and will not go back. It really shouldn't be so hard to dish out fast mexican food. (made for americans, yeah I know), but some places just can't keep the consistency up. This is one of them. I hate to have to drive all the way to the Mission, but I guess I'll have to.
author: Rich M.

description: I've had just about every burrito in the Mission and this place beats them all. I get the bronco burrito and it's just how I like it. No sour cream or lettuce or any of that other nonsense.  This place is great.
author: Phil B.

description: This is my favorite burrito spot in the sunset, beating out La Playa on Noriega and Beach Burrito. I like that they have 3 different vegetarian burritos with actual vegetables inside (not just beans and cheese). The ladies inside are always nice. Bring cash because their credit card machine breaks semi-often
author: Dan H.

description:
My friend Victoria ranted and raved about this place for like two years. I can't say that she was wrong for doing that either. This spot is pretty popular, reliable, and tasty. There isn't too much space to sit down to eat so plan on taking your order elsewhere to eat. We went to Quickly to eat our burritos.

Oh their deals for their anniversary were also amazing. Sadly they are now over. Check this place out!
author: Elbert C.

description:
Nor Cal Burrito with Tofu. 

I literally dream about this. The cheese is melted on the tortilla first, so it surrounds all of the delicious filling like a warm, cheesy blanket of heavenly deliciousness. Then they put in french fries, guacamole, salsa (2 kinds!), expresso sauce, and the marinated succulent tofu from heaven. DROOL. 

Yes, I can eat the whole thing in one sitting. Yes, I am a fat ass. Just because I am a vegetarian doesn't mean I have to be healthy. 

Seriously though, if you buy me one of these I will probably love you forever, or at least give you a hand job.
author: Jillian M.

description:
Asada Fries Burrito one bite and...

Hey...
Hey...
Hey...
What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?

Hey...Don't ya know I got dat
Burrito with me fat fries and a steak stack
Lil brown sack
Where I holding all the salsa at

What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?
I know all about dat

Loaded tortilla on the Yo where the cheese at
Fresh off the L to the Ex where the please at

What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?
What ya know about dat?
Hey...I know all about dat...
author: R J.

description: I'm allergic to beans so I order accordingly. So imagine my surprise to find beans buried under the rice on my enchilada plate despite clearly saying I had an allergy when ordering. It's too bad anaphylactic shock is such a drag as I'd love to sue the crap out of these guys.  When I called to tell them they had made a mistake there was no effort to make things right. Just a lot of murmuring and yelling in Spanish. We're never ordering from here again. It's a sad day when Chipotle sounds more appetizing than these jerks.
author: ipvcake i.

description:
Sometimes I forget I'm not in the Mission District when I order my food here! The food is so authentic and fresh. It's also on the L Taraval line. 

I usually order the Grilled Steak Bronco Burrito and typically the husband orders the cheese enchilada meal. For the price, well worth it.
author: Linda L.

description:
I used to frequent this place a lot during high school but after coming back from school in southern California (during that time I ate a lot of authentic Mexican food), I walked past el burrito and reminisced about old times.

I ordered the California burrito (with fries inside) and walked home to eat it. I took my first bite and it just did not taste that good at all. I dont know what it was but it just did not taste as good as my Mexican food from SoCal. I took a few more bites and still did not taste any better. I even let my sister try a bite and she didn't even like it.

This place used to be the bomb but as of right now, something is lacking. It may have been that the french fries weren't crispy and made everything all mushy. Also the meat and beans didn't really add much flavor.
author: Wilson T.

description:
I have a few favorites that I like to switch up from.  The Expresso Burrito (Chicken or Beef with the wet red sauce the pour over the top.  You gotta eat it wil a fork and knife.
The Bronco Steak burritos is always a winner.  They actually use a pretty good grade of steak.  not the $1 taco meat from the taco trucks.

This location offers delivery through the Sunset which is a huge plus....  It takes a hour so put your order in early expect to wait.
author: King L.

description: Solid, no frills Mexican food. The menu is a bit daunting, especially for those who are easily confused, but El Burrito Express provides locals with a much needed respite from the mostly ick-tastic chinese hole-in-the wall restaurants dotting the Sunset.
author: Nobody M.

description: This place is not the best it's Okay.  I tried going back a few times thinking what I ordered wasn't right but I just never seem to be fully satisfied with the taste.  I'd prefer to just go to another place in the neighborhood over this one.  I almost ordered seeing they had delivery then noticed the minimum was $70.  If your a mediocre place and you want to make money change your minimums to $20 or something.  I always end up going elsewhere.  This is just a pick up place no room for dining.
author: Nirea S.

description:
I used to go to school a few blocks away from here but I've never taken advantage of this place. Either that, or I'm just too damn lazy to walk down here during lunch period. However, whenever I have a craving for a tasty, authentic burrito, this is my first choice.

I always go for the grilled chicken bronco burrito. It's under $5 and it comes with free tortilla chips and salsa. (Don't forget to ask for it though!) My mouth is literally watering when I unwrapped the foil paper. The smell overwhelms me as I take the first bite. Juicy grilled chicken smothered in ooey cheese, chunky salsa, and sour cream with just the right amount of rice, black beans, and sliced avocados, all wrapped up in a soft, warm tortilla.

What more can I say? This place is for me.
author: Annie S.

description:
LOVE LOVE their Vegetarian Options! I love their Tofu Burritos and also substitute vegetarian Meat Burritos! they have so many options its so great!!!!

Their burritos are Humongous it fits 2 meals for a girl like me. Their customer service is ok could be better.


I always get the Wet Burrito with the Red Sauce and Cheese on top, SOO GOOOOOD!!!!! regular burrito is great too!! But i just love the extra cheese and Sauces!!

Downside is it is so small you can't really sit and eat you have to grab and go, the place also has a lot of smells inside so good thing they have their door open at times. IT would be great to see them expand a bit more because the food is pretty delicious!
author: Sophia W.

description: The NorCal Burrito is super good! This place is a piece of the Mission out on Taraval. Legit taqueria that can go head-to-head with just about any other in The City.
author: Greg H.

description:
I always noticed that the place gets rather packed, especially during the afternoons on weekdays. Mind you, that this place is very small - like a hole in the wall - so it gets crowded when there is three or four customers inside the establishment. There is a table where customers can eat, but the atmosphere doesn't encourage customers to linger and enjoy their food. 

I decided to lunch at this place since I was nearby. I ordered the El Norcal which consists of fries, carne asada, onions, tomatoes, sour cream, guac, expresso sauce, pico (I am a junk food addict :) ). The fries were cooked to perfection. The fries soaked up the expresso sauce, giving it an interesting and nice taste. But the carne asada was rather tough. Aside from the food, the customer service wasn't that great. I would eat here again, but I wouldn't travel far in order to eat at El Burrito Express.
author: Lisa L.

description: Came here a few times, and it's great. The burritos are yummy and very big. I also tried their nachos and was very satisfied with them. They were quick in making the food but the wait was not so fun since the place is quite small. It is the perfect place if you are craving a large, greasy, tasty burrito!
author: Dodi G.

description:
El Burrito Express provides a bang-for-the-buck meal that is low on wow factor but high on consistency.

The El Expresso wet burrito comes in a plentiful portion that always raises a mid-meal question of whether to save half or to ignore sensibility and finish stuffed.  Although the fillings are generous, the permeation of sour cream and sauce throughout the burrito leaves each successive bite with decreasing flavor vibrancy.  Halfway through, any distinguishing between the fillings is hopeless, as the meal has become a giant pile of burrito-flavored mush.

El Burrito is a convenient location to satisfy a burrito craving that is akin to getting a Chinese takeout fix at Panda Express, but it will never be a first choice.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I haven't had much from here but I fell in love with their grilled steak in any kind of burrito. 

They have a wet burrito, it was pretty yummy too even though that wasn't what i ordered? But the sauce on top was really good, I'd get it again. 

I wish they have a bit of a friendlier staff? I'm always afraid to ask anything or have special requests.
author: Erica L.

description:
I have had their food on numerous occasions through delivery in the sunset. It's the only mexican place that I know of the delivers in the area. I would get their burritos which were pretty good in about 20-30 minutes (after their deliver time of 5pm) By this service I would give them a 4/5 or even 4.5 stars. 

I came in today in person for the first time and wish I didn't. It was near their opening time (10:15) and the cashier was disgusting rude. I came in with a game plan of what to order because I wanted to eat it later. When I tried ordering she told me a list of things they didn't have. When I asked how long she rudely said that she doesn't know and they just opened. She then rolled her eyes. So I ordered only one thing instead of two and almost didn't want to because of their attitude. The staff were not welcoming at all and barely acknowledged me even when I left with my burrito and told them to have a nice day. 

I definitely won't go there in person anymore and may not even order delivery because of the lack of customer care and service.
author: Tiara B.

description:
One of my weekly favorites is to get the Taco Salad with the fresh mix veggies.  The fresh mix is broccoli yellow squash, cauliflower, and zucchini sautéed fresh for your order.  Their carnitas, carne asana and chile verde are fantastic.  My favorite burrito is the Bronco fresh slices of avocado, cheese, frijoles de la olla, gosh what else besides choice of protein.  Super nachos are great, they fry their own chips.  

A good to go place with a few seats for eating in, but not a great dining atmosphere.
author: Carey C.

description: The chicken burrito I had was very dry and my wife got the beef and said it was a little tuff. Not sure what happened to this place but it was much better before.
author: J K.

description: The best burritos on the west side.  If you cannot make it to the Mission or South San Francisco, El Burrito Express will rock you.  I like their grilled chicken regular without cheese.
author: David K.

description:
Got the carne asada fries.

There are about 7 bar like stools for dine in with a self serve water pitcher. There was a green and blue bin but both contained trash. 

Anyways the fries took about 15 mins to prepare and it was loaded with cheese. Small pieces of beef accompanied the soar cream, salsa, and guacamole. The fries were kinda soggy and oily. The quality of the carne asada fries is no where near the ones you get in san diego. The portions were also kinda small for the $5 price. Either way its a cheap place to get average at best mexican food. I will avoid for now unless desperate
author: Robert Y.

description:
3.5 Stars

I've been working in The City (San Fransisco) this week and next week to come. Instead of taking lunch today, it's much easier, because we're doing an interior paint job in the West Portal District, even with all the cover clothing worn, paint always seems to find it's way on you. But today being Friday my helper and myself went to this place.

I can't say I've mastered the streets and location of places in The City finding places to go can be challenging. I Yelped foods in the area and this place came up in the Sunset District. We decided to go try it since it's close to us. Also It's been reviewed 366 times with a 4 Star average, so have bad can it be? 

I'm working right off Taraval St. and this place is on the corner of Taraval and 26 Ave. And YES I did manage to get lost going there don't ask me how but I manage to! Could had been I was to lazy to put it in my GPS.

We ordered 2 Express Burro's 1 Carnita's and 1 Chile Verde, these things were BIG! They were packed with meat and what ever else they put in to them and messy! For the price you can't complaint roughly $7.50 with tax, handling and putting it in a bag for you. Came with a small bag of tortilla chips they make on site. You do need to ask for Hot Sauce and napkins some thing they did not provide.

The Good: Menu items are made fresh, size for price is plentiful and you're in and out fast. We got there at 11:20 and were gone by 11:30, we missed the lunch crowd, we were 2nd in line and 4 people came in right after us, the line was already outside.

The Bad: The place is small, I don't think I saw a table but there was 2-4 bar stools. Need to ask for condiments like napkins and hot sauce. There's only room for 5-7 people inside.

The Bad: The burro's are messy and made with too thin tortillas.

I've eaten at a lot of Burro places, I've eaten in worse places, this place is alright, it wasn't the best I've eaten.

I think a 3.5 Stars is right in line with this place. I will return, to try other things on the menu.
author: Ben S.

description: Please add my voice to the ever-growing list of individuals who enjoy the food at this restaurant but can't stand the absolutely terrible service.  to whoever runs this place...are you a eventually going to pay attention to what people are saying and make some changes?
author: Matt O.

description:
Yay for burritos!

I'm usually a carnitas burrito kind of girl, but El Burrito Express has a really good Chicken Expresso Burrito( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/rXnhq1mESqlgp8rIT-BS9Q/l ).  If you like it saucy, this is definitely one to try.  Who doesn't love a nice, fat, juicy burrito stuffed with meat and overflowing with sauce???  And they throw on extra cheese and sour cream on top...uuughhh...fatten me up, please!!!!!  

Most people get their burrito to go, but there is a counter if you want to eat and run.  There are so many items to choose from on the menu( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/oXxTtccc5t6hOudVmrNFRQ/l ), and almost everything is under $7.00!!!  Only $6.50 for a nice, fat, juicy burrito....I'll be back for more!!!
author: Patra I.

description:
Been coming here for about a year, sometimes I just crave mexican food and this is the only option.

However, they often charge you more than what the menu says, so watch the total, if it doesn't add up don't be surprised.  

The food is mediocre at best.  They often get your order wrong and as everyone else said the service is terrible, they are always ill tempered and treat you badly

TL;DL DONT GO HERE, unless you are really really craving shitty mexican
author: Thomas S.

description:
Went again recently. Not as good as the last time I so fondly remembered it. The vera cruz fish tasted fishier than I would have liked. ): 
Nachos still on point. No meat just gooey beans and avocado slices. Still good. I will try again soon to fully decide weather this place is worth the 4 stars.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Okay, so it took a while for me to give this place a chance. But boy am I glad I did. I saw quite a few negative ratings/comments and steered clear. I've now eaten there 5 or 6 times in the past month alone.

I love the carne asada "el burrito". The tortillas are fresh tasting, chips are awesome, guacamole is average, but the salsa is flavorful and spicy (at least the red). Staff is helpful and friendly. This place isn't buzzy because of the lines - it is legit. Have only tried the burritos so far but I'm quite happy with them and might never venture out to the tacos or combination dinners.
author: Jayson H.

description:
Oh man, this place could get 3 or 4 stars. But since A-OK is three stars, I think that's where this is going to be. A solid 3 stars!

First off, get prepared to wait. Even when I ordered two tiny rice and bean burritos it took forever.

The first time I came I accidentally ordered this giant burrito, I think the Macho Burrito [needs citation]. It was huge, they said over a foot long, it looked well over that.

It was good, but the cheese wasn't even melted and the steak (even on the first bite) was luke warm. I'm going to keep going though, because it's hard to find Mexican in Sunset.
author: Chris I.

description:
I really want to like this place.  Really I do.  It's like 2 blocks from my house, so it would make life so convenient if I liked it.  Unfortunately, I don't really care for it at all.  I only come here when the boyfriend really wants a Mexican fix and we're too lazy to the Mission...but then I try really really hard to either dissuade him from eating Mexican or persuade him to go to the Mission.

I'm neither impressed or unimpressed by the food here.  It's just average, but I mean, SF is filled with delicious Mexican food that it's just a waste.  The horchata, however, is disgusting.  We ordered it and it tasted like dirty water with some cinnamon in it.  It was nasty.  Do not order the horchata...stick with the tamarind jaritos, you'll thank me later for warning you.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
Reminiscing of the California Burrito I've had regularly in So. Cal, I was pleasantly surprised to know that they serve it right here. From San Diego to SF, there's no way the CA Burrito is escaping from me. 

The Nor Cal Burrito, as they renamed it, is really good. I mean REALLY good. The ingredients are fresh and each bite is juicy, cheesy, and full of amazing flavors. I get it with grilled chicken instead of beef since beef can get a bit dry. The size of the burrito is also HUGE that only a big burly man (or woman) can finish. It is freaking amazing.
author: Denise W.

description: It's good, no, no, it's really good. The avocado tostada is over priced though. Go buy yourself a tortilla shell and throw and avocado in it, same thing.
author: Caleb O.

description:
parking is okay sometimes busy.

I used to get burritos here when i was little.  forgot about the place for 15-20 years.  I read about it in here and decided to go here again since i wasn't too far away.

this place is as good as i remember.  i LOVED IT!  Burrito's that taste this good, juicy, meat, avocado, onions, tomato.  Its all good.

The meat was juicy and tender.  the refried beans made me think, 'why do we get whole beans' its just THAT GOOD.

different sizes so be sure you know what you want.  the bronco or the bigger bronco...lol.

oh why the 5 stars?  well, the bronco is like a baby burrito from other places.  but its the same price as them.  4.55 or so.  Its still worth it.  I guess i have to order again and then rank it higher.  The super bronco has a larger tortilla.
author: Bing D.

description:
I live in the Mission so to get a good burrito I don't have to go far.  El Burrito Express is all the way in the foggy, cold sunset (parkside), and is worth the trip!  They have an expansive menu and feature some very unique burritos.  They even feature a Giants burrito with black beans and sweet potato fries inside- so good (I had it tonight!).  The food may take a little longer than other taquerias but that's because they are making it fresh and they grill the burrito on the outside so it is warm and a little crunchy.  

If you got the gas, the time and your winter coat, head over and check this place out!
author: Tara R.

description:
This place is AWESOME!
Every single time I go, I order the same thing: the chicken/sour cream expresso burrito. It is seriously SO filling and can last for two meals. 
The only downside is that they are cash only. I guess that's a good thing because I'd spend all my money there. Parking can be a little tricky, it's meter or neighborhood.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
This place is pretty good. THe burritos are definitely the tastiest you'll find in this part of town. I'm partial to the super burrito with pollo asado. THe service leaves a lot to be desired, the ladies that work the register are decidedly unfriendly and will never crack a smile, say thank you, etc. Lastly, this place can't hold a candle to the kind of mexican fare you'll find in the mission, or excelsior for that matter. So if you just need your burrito fix quickly, this is the place to come. If you have time, and want the best, head over to mission st.

Oh. Cash Only, if it's busy (eg dining hours) you'll be waiting outside.
author: Russ N.

description: it has the illusion of finally being a comparable burrito joint to that of the caliber of "good" that is in southern California. Unfortunately it's a mess. They do indeed have riceless burrito's, but as soon as the corrected my carne asada for steak i knew I was in for a ride. Gross.
author: Vinny T.

description: My friends husband ate there and got such bad food poisoning that he had to go to the hospital!
author: Carla B.

description: Look at my photo of my Super Mojado Chicken Burrito and you will drool! I also got a beef super burrito for my dad and it all came out to $7! I got 50% off my meal through this Android Phone application you can download: www.scoutmob.com (good until 4-17-11). What a deal!
author: Karen T.

description:
03.04.14

I haven't been here in person in a while since my dad usually calls in and does a pick up now and then. But I've been eating their burritos for many years 

But I wanted just one burrito to go this time just to bring half to work the next day. 

My experience was awful very slow since they only had one person inside waiting for their food and one person ordering and then me. when it was my turn the lady took my order and also picked up the phone so rude. Then I ended up waiting and waiting for my one burrito for like 15 minutes - uncalled for as it was not busy. I think they did the phone orders first 

Burrito is still decent but... 
It's just not the same anymore
author: Jay R.

description:
Why have I not written a review for this place?  

I've lived in different parts of the Bay Area, and have familiarized myself with a good share of taquerias.  El Burrito Express is currently my burrito place of choice when I'm in the mood for a burrito in the Sunset.  This little hole in the wall is by far not close to being the best I've had, but its good.  It gives a fresh taste to the area, since the Sunset district in San Francisco is dominated by many Asian restaurants.  I can say with confidence it's one of the best burritos you can get in this neighborhood.

The location isn't a sit down experience rather an order and go type of place.  There is a row of stationary stools for you to sit if you do decide to eat there.  Along the row of stools there's one flat screen television.  Watch your first step when you enter because there's a little slope and if you're clumsy and run into things a lot like me.   

I usually get the carne asada super burrito.  On occasions, I'll get their wet burrito, "expresso", or a taco salad.  I have tried the nachos once.  They offer a nice variety of choices as well as having a couple vegetarian burritos as well.  A must if you're going to operate a restaurant in San Francisco.  The Cancun (shrimp) and Veracruz (fish) burritos look appetizing, but I haven't gotten myself to try it yet.  Something I don't see much that they have on the menu is chili relleno and chili colorado as an option in your burrito.  Whatever burrito you get I'm sure you'll be satisfied.  

At $5.75 for a super burrito, I think that's a really good deal.  Just think you'll be basically paying the same thing at Chipotle. I like Chipotle, but if given a choice.  I'd definitely take this instead.  Not to mention, they are a really good size.  For the budget watchers out there, I'd stick with the burritos, because they're the best deal.  Their nachos are good also, but I'd rather spend that $8.00 for another meal.  Their name is "El Burrito Express"; why not get what they're good at?  (...I'm talking about a burrito)
author: Arnold T.

description:
Who makes a "Super" burrito with no sour cream, no cheese and no veggies?!  El Burrito Express.  Most wasted meal and waste of money.  I actually had to call and ask what they put in there.  I guess the rice makes it "super!"  Wow, very bummed.

The 2nd star is only because the location is convenient.  Will only return out of hunger desperation.  Apparently, a lot of Sunseters are desperate too to rate this place so highly.
author: Phoebe F.

description:
I discovered this burrito by accident & loved it since!!

It's a burrito w/ everything and topped off w/ cheese & enchilada sauce.

Wet Burrito w/ Enchilada Sauce
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/EVKSh9tbyy_w8I4xHPLFxQ/l

(Monday, February 16, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
this is a family-owned and run establishment in the middle of the sunset. it's got a down-home feel and the food is pretty good.

my boyfriend is a sunset irish native, and this is his to-go place for a burrito. for a huge $5 shredded chicken burrito, you're definitely getting more bang for your buck. guacamole on the side is only 60 extra cents, and a canned soda is 89 cents. i'd come here any day over places like chipotle where guacamole is $2. holy guacamole!

although the taraval location is small, it's still awesome. and although the sunset is slowly but surely being overrun by grody SFSU hipsters thinking they're cool and sticking it to the man for frequenting mom and pop food joints and whatnot, el burrito express will always be awesome
author: Nik H.

description: Maybe I had a bad menu option, but I would not recommend EBX burritos to anyone, just go to Chipotle on Sloat (no I don't own any CMG). Somewhat bland and underwhelming. If you are famished and can't go anywhere else for food, the fare here might taste all right.
author: Lana L.

description:
El Burrito Express' regular burrito is a decent size burrito that's a bit dry. It's a pretty good burrito for the size. I don't have stuffed after eating it so that's definitely a plus.

The burrito contents are re-fried beans, a couple of pieces of avocado, little bit of lettuce, rice, and chicken. The re-fried beans are creamy and it pretty dry. The chicken is marinated with some kind of sauce, which is tasty. The rice is rice... it's soft. One thing interesting missing from this burrito is salsa.

Their thick chips are different from other restaurants, but it's definitely good.
author: Steven B.

description:
Customer service can be a little slow when I came here the other day. I have to agree with some other yelpers that the workers do tend to chat amongst themselves more than they should be helping customers with orders. It took them a while before they took my order but they were friendly and smiling. 
I ordered the El Veggie Mix since I didn't like my burrito with so many other vegetables -that was the simplest vegetarian choice for me. My order was ready in less than 10 minutes and it came with chips and salsa. One good thing I forgot was to get a free soda with a check-in! Ugh, it would have made my meal much more enjoyable. Because it wasn't very enjoyable. I thought the burrito was very plain and for ~$8 I could get a better tasting veggie burrito at chipotle. I really don't need the chips and salsa because they didn't make up for the disappointment of the burrito. By the way, the salsa was bad. It's like a thick hot sauce -very spicy. I thought salsa was supposed to be light and delicious. Anyways, my craving was not satisfied. Next time I'm craving a burrito I'll just stick with Chipotle or something.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Great burritos on the cheap! 

Biggest downside is no sit down seating really only a few seats by the window! 

Bronco cheese is my favorite
author: Sangeeta L.

description:
Why must I be spoiled with the knowledge of good taquerias?
If only I had been ignorant to the existence of places like La Corneta, I would have easily enjoyed this place that much more.
But alas the damage is done and my review is as follows:

After passing the only taqueria on Taravel half a million times, I finally tried it out and got the Super Bronco Burrito with carnitas.
For about $6, you get a lot of food.
I also love the convenience of only having to drive five minutes,
but sadly, it falls well short of the taste and quality of La Corneta.
Don't get me wrong.  It was a filling burrito.  It was just lacking.

The thing is I will be back because of the afore mentioned proximity.
But with each bite, I will dream of better burritos.
Maybe next time I'll try the nachos and hope for a better experience.
author: Dan B.

description:
This is my Burrito Place. Why I ever diverge and go other places I will never know. 

I have been eating at this location since 1982. 

They know me so much that sometimes they start ringing in my order before I have said anything. hahahaha  

I order the same thing Regular Chicken Burritto w/ Queso, Sour Crema, Hot Sauce and no Onion or Tomato...  Everything else inside.

They serve Cervezas...and they have a very diverse menu. Cash Only is the only thing that suck. I love the "frequent eaters" cards.

Check out this successful woman owned businesses.

Infodiva reppin Taraval Street. 94116
author: Infodiva B.

description:
So I came here because the Gods of Scoutmob had a 50 percent off coupon thing going on today. Figured I'd give it a shot. Full disclosure:  I'm from San Diego, and therefore very snobbish about my burritos. I don't like beans or rice in there, pretty much ever.

The thing I've noticed about the Bay Area burrito scene is that there aren't many burritos that come standard without rice or beans, so when I ask for a burrito without either I end up getting this mushy mess that can't deal with all the yummy burrito juices. No bueno.

At El Burrito Express, they have the NorCal burrito, a beautiful creation that tries (with the most success I've seen since I moved here in 2006) to emulate the California Burritos of my mother land. It's super, SUPER filing.

Minus one star for two reasons: One, the green salsa was pretty bland and watery which was a bit of a let down since the flavor is usually the only reason to get green salsa. Two, there was so much cheese in my burrito that it was overwhelming. My boyfriend got the Chili Colorado Beef Expresso Burrito and had the same complaint.

Overall super good and reasonably priced.
author: Theresa S.

description:
Stopped by El Burrito Express after my Dentist appt yesterday & wowsers, what a tasty burrito!

Got the Cheese Expresso Burrito cause I likes me a wet, doughy, saucy burrito & El Burrito served it up right

It was GINORMOUS & filled w/ yummy Seasoned Rice, Refried Beans (which are Veggie cause, yeah, I asked!) Cheese, Guac & Salsa; covered w/ sauce & *more* cheese - yay!

The sauce was a bit on the too-salty side but I'll easily forgive given the overall yumminess & I will definitely get again - salt or no salt

All for under $6 - woohoo!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
The food is fairly decent for American\Mexican food. Only place in the outer sunset for taqueria style.

A few gripes:

1. They advertise they deliver, but are not consistent with their delivery hours. Sometimes 5-9, sometimes 5-8, sometimes 'No' (which is the answer I got when I asked why).
2. The 'to go' plates are wrapped with aluminum in the plate, not outside the plate. This makes the food taste somewhat metallic unless you scoop the food onto another plate.

Other than that it is a convenient burrito shop off the L.
author: Ray J.

description: Where's the express?! Every time I order here I always come away pissed about the looooong wait, the smaller portions and the rising prices. It's a 20 minute wait when you order there and if you call in to pick up they don't make it until you get there so don't bother. The food is alright. You can get better if you venture out. This place is only popular because there are no other Mexican options in the area so don't be fooled by the number of reviews. Please someone needs to work on their efficiency with in person and takeout orders!!! After 20 years of coming here I have to say goodbye at last. The prices keep going up, the portions are smaller and smaller and the wait gets longer and longer. El burrito it has been a long bad relationship that I'm finally ending!
author: PM o.

description:
It's been a few years since I've been to El Burrito Express.  I've been wanting to stop by for a while now, but I seem to always be around the area on a Sunday, when they're closed.

So, I finally made a trip here today and I wasn't disappointed.  I got the grilled steak expresso burrito.  For $6 you get a pretty mean looking hombre.  The burrito is fat, covered in tomatos, cheese, and a lot of sauce.  Dude, did that sucker hit the spot!  It's been five hours and I'm still full!  I might have to pass on pizza for dinner... pizza!!!

The place is really small.  I recommend take out since they only have a handful of seats.  I have to make do with the burrito served on a paper plate wrapped in foil.  But hey, I wasn't here for fine dining.  I wanted food and i gots it.  Yuh, Yeah!!
author: Sam T.

description: EBX is a decent place to get your Mexican food fix. They accepted credit cards in the past, but no longer do and never told us why. They have some indoor seating, but it is on one side of the joint and they are all close to each other; 6 people max can sit down and eat. Service time is average at most. Workers are pretty nice when it is not busy. Overall, a nice, simple place to get your Mexican food if you want non-Taco Bell food (which is a few blocks up the street if you do want Taco Bell.)
author: Noel A.

description:
Their burritoes are gross.

The default beans they give you is refried smashed beans.  The quality of the rice, cheese, guacamole, and tortilla taste like they came out of the school cafeteria.  I couldn't taste of see the pico de gallo in the burrito.  All the ingredients do not taste fresh.  

In my opinion this place is not in the same league as Gordos.  Where are the good mexican joints in the Sunset????
author: Ben S.

description:
Back when I told my friends that I was moving out to 25th near Taraval, several of them independently excitedly told me that I had to go to EBX. I was skeptical, it's the Sunset after all, but they were absolutely right.

Fresh ingredients, friendly service (at the counter, or over Twitter-I love their tweets!) and a clear love of what they do. I've had the tortas now and then, but the bread runs out early, and honestly, it's all about the burritos.

They are all excellent, but one day I was feeling adventurous and decided to stop sneering at the clearly non-canonical NorCal burrito and give it a shot. It is AMAZING. I order it about two thirds of the time now.

The only drawbacks are that it's cash only (the Walgreens up the street has gotten a lot of business from me based on this fact) and closed on Sundays (I may have cried once or twice, after deciding on a burrito and then realizing it was Sunday). Also, it's really more of a to-go place, so don't plan on eating in unless it is a very slow day.

Oh, and the addition of delivery made this place even better!
author: Espana S.

description:
My new neighborhood taqueria sure beats the one in my old neighborhood (Nob Hill) and that makes me very happy. I got a super bronco burrito (which comes with sliced avocado instead of guacamole, score!) and added sour cream to that so it would resemble a more typical taqueria super burrito. Total was under $7 and was pretty good. The chips are awesome and the salsa is decent.

I wish they had more of an eating area and that they'd have bottles of Tapatio around, but in terms of quality they got it where it counts.

So why only 3 stars? They're closed on Sundays and close at 9:00 on the other days. I know it's the Sunset, but that's weak. What's the point of good burritos if their availability is so limited?
author: Joseph N.

description:
So dense and diverse is San Francisco that at times it almost seems like a micro-continent unto itself, 700 miles across instead of just 7.  Which is why I find myself being surprised to find a taqueria in the "Great Fog-lands of the West".  Never mind that the Mission is only 4 miles away.

Of course, there are at least 2 other good taquerias out here: Miraloma and Ocean.  And while El Burrito Express can't top them in the taste department, it more than holds its own in portions and value.  For less than $6 you can get their signature Expresso Burrito (a "wet" burrito), which was enough for my wife and I to share.  I just wish there was a bit less meat and more of the other fillings.  There's only a little counter for seating, and everyone seemed to be getting their food to go.  But if you're getting a wet burrito, I highly recommend you eat it here, because they won't wrap it in foil and it will cool down a lot by the time you get home.  Anyway, you know you want to go get a cocktail at Dragon Lounge afterwards.
author: Wes M.

description:
I was cautious to try Mexican food this far from the Mission, but a craving necessitated it and off I went. 

It's tiny and smells wonderful (reminds me of San Diego) and I was SHOCKED to see Carne Asada Fries on the menu, as that is something you are hard pressed to find in this city. That's what I ordered, and while it was different than what I'm used to, it was really delicious. 

About $5 gets you a small plate of mostly fries and cheese, but with steak, sour cream, guac and salsa thrown on top. Perfect for one person, don't try to split it.

I'm impressed. However, I have many burritos to eat before my final judgment can be made.
author: Alyssa G.

description: All I have to say is....EL MACHO BURRITO! Oh my god! That thing is HUGE! and its only like $10 and change! you just CANT beat that AT ALL! I would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a damn good burrito. And specially if you're on a budget. 1 burrito can last you up to 2 days!
author: Anthony R.

description:
A great burrito alternative in the susnet.

Especially for people who lives in the Sunset are WAY TOO lazy to drive to the Mission. Lines do tend to get busy during lunch hour but the wait isn't too bad. Don't fret about the lines, the food usually gets out pretty fast and the wait isn't bad. There are also usually like 6 people working at a time so be patient. 

One draw back, El Burrito Express is closed on Sundays. :(
author: Carol Y.

description:
I LOVE THE GUACAMOLE. I used to walk here after school and get a pint of guacamole to take home.

The burritos are freaking huge. I love the expresso burritos!! They're super cheap and delicious. I love how everything comes with a bag of chips. Their chips are really good.

THEY DELIVER NOW?!??! WHAT?!?!!? They will be receiving a call from me very soon.
author: Erica A.

description:
My first venture here was on a whim, since I live in the area and i've got to say that I hands down can't have enough of El Burrito! I have since visited other places around San Francisco and haven't been too impressed. I even had them cater my grad party. 

Word of advice from a hardened EBX fanatic: Go for burritos, not because I don't like the other foods they offer, but it's definitely the biggest bang on your buck.

TIP: Expect a line when you get here. Worth The Wait!
author: Brian T.

description: They run a catering service and come to my work every other week.  We all love the food.  The food is very fresh and tasty.  I wish we had the great selection as their menu, but for catering I can't complain.  They bring in fresh meat, and enchiladas, and mango salso.  We all rush down to eat when they come.  SF, you are lucky! Keep up the great work Mama... awesome food.
author: anna r.

description: I really, really, wish this place's food was better because I would totally give them so much business.  I walked in and it definitely looked like a legitimate mission burrito place but the flavors failed.  Maybe it is what I ordered (which was vegetarian), but the spices and flavors were just bland.  When eating Mexican food, I love to have fresh cilantro, fresh beans, and crisp veggies.  Too bad.  I would love to have had this be my neighborhood taqueria.
author: Daisy A.

description:
They deliver!

That alone is enough for 5 stars in my opinion. Not as reliable or easy as a pizza place, sure, but screw that. They a Mexican place that delivers; not only that, it's darn good food.
author: Shane M.

description:
This is a good place if u want to get a hungry size burrito, however you're going to have a blast trying to look for parking, and waiting for time to come to an end before getting served... That's only because two out of four days, it can be  total Zoo in there...
So I guess there is a certain cook there on select days of the week, so....
Hmmm...., think I might have to hit that spot up real quick..
author: Alfonzo T.

description:
So, I've loved El Burrito Express' shredded chicken burritos since I was a kid. This place is great if you're looking for a cheap Mexican place in the Sunset. 

I would've given them more stars but I just tried their delivery service for the first time. And I've got to say it was definitely not the best experience. First, I was put on hold (this meant the phone was just put down & I sat & listened to all the noise going on in the restaurant on the other end of the line) for about  3 solid minutes. The woman on the other end took my order & was obviously trying to juggle taking orders, calling out orders, taking my order & ringing people up. So her clipped tone was totally excusable/understandable. But then the delivery guy got on the phone to take my address. Another review said that he was really rude. I wanted to give this guy the benefit of the doubt. Maybe this other person had caught him on a bad day. But no, either this delivery guy has chronic bad days or he just always has a rude condescending tone of voice. At the end of the call he let out this huge sigh as if to say without saying he didn't want to take on the unbearable task of delivering my food & grumbled he'd be there in an hour or so. I don't expect you to be excited about delivering my food but being rude & letting on how much you apparently hate your job doesn't usually bode well in the tips department.

EBX you're food is great but figure out a better system for taking delivery calls. And school your delivery guy on phone etiquette.
author: Gena G.

description:
You ever have those days where you wake up all cranky and tired and all you want is some quick comfort food and watch tv all day?

Well when you work 30hrs a week and you're a full time student, you will experience this whenever you have a day off.. This is where the boyfriend comes in! :) He goes and picks up some food from el burrito express, I either get the chicken POLLLLLOO burrito, or the famous nor cal burrito with fries. The chicken burrito is in the tomato marinade, which I'm not a big fan of, but the norcal burger really is poppping with flavors from the different salsas used. You won't regret it. 

Ask for chips and salsa as you're paying. Ask for extra red salsa if you're like me and you love a spicy burrito! When they are making the burrito, you can even ask them to add extra salsa in the burrito. 

Yes the staff may be a little intimidating depending on who is working.. but its cheap! All worth it. about 7-8 dollars, Do the check in offer!! FREEE SODA. CASH ONLY.
author: Wendy X.

description:
Punch my burrito card!!!

Between Express 1 and 2... I'd have to say 2 owns my heart.  This one is truly "express".  There's a small area with bar stools that probably seats about 5 awkwardly, so I would vote to just grab and go!

Predictable, cheap, and tasty!  Favorite burrito joint in the outer sunset!

The menu seems extensive, but really it's just versions of the same things.. but...

GET:  (if you're feeling extra bad) El Norcal Burrito (asada with fries!) or El Expresso Burrito (burrito mojado... wet burrito... mmm)

ASK: for the infamous burrito card...
author: Christine K.

description: Just ate a "NorCal Burrito" for my first time: beef, cheese, french fries, sour cream, onions, guacamole, pico & expresso sauce..... Oh yeah and did I mention FRENCH FRIES.. YUM! Must try before you die. Lol.
author: Monica R.

description:
This place could be so much better. But they only really do well because of their location. Whoever is rating this place with 5 stars either doesn't have taste buds or has never been to a good mexican place in the city. 

The meat served here tastes like a pile of cat food that has been toasted under heat lamp. You get to experience a few pieces of dry, crunchy meat within your order. Think of it as an overcooked, unstirred easter egg of crunchiness.

Skip this place if you can help it. But hey, if you do come here, you can blame it on being too drunk. We've all been there.
author: Hank K.

description: At lunch today I ordered the "el surf and turf" burrito. Ingredients: carne asada, shrimp, rice, refried beans, guacamole, pico de gallo and cheese. I asked for no guacamole but it seemed like this burrito was almost entirely comprised of rice and beans. I figured since I'm paying $10 that I'd be getting practically meat and shrimp but I was sadly mistaken. I think that if it cost $20 then maybe I would have gotten what I originally had pictured my burrito to be like. For a better deal I could have gone to Una Mas or even Del Taco for something tastier. Even though the staff was friendly, I couldn't tolerate how run-down the place looked. Their chips were horrible--almost stale and the red sauce came out of the plastic container in a coagulated goop--gross.
author: Omar K.

description:
I just demolished almost 2/3 of an expresso chicken burrito (aka wet burrito) - im getting a bad case of food coma right now and am having difficulties putting together a comprehendible review.... so in the mean time, please enjoy this photo of what was once a burrito but now probably gooo in my stomach http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uCeCkdHHeaJnU4hGAe2sJQ?select=skBpmTHSyIJUGGVw1ISRsA and I apologize for this 3 run-on sentenced jibber jabber review. maybe I'll return to this another time.

p.s., it was really really good. for a min, I almost thought I was in the mission, except for the fact that it was foggy and misting outside.
author: Jennie L.

description:
I'm all frowns at the recent amount of 2 and 1 star ratings for EBX1, y'all.

EBX has become our lucky spot:
- We ate there when we were starving and lost on this side of the city when we were looking for an apartment last summer (we moved up from LA), and when we finished eating, we found a post on Craigslist on my Droid right around the corner. We ended up moving in there 3 weeks later.
- Waiting in line for a burrito to lift my spirits, I got the call from my current boss telling me I was hired for my current job. Shwing!
- Walking home from EBX after picking up burritos for dinner, I found $5 at the corner of my street. $5! So it was really like I got a burrito for free that night. 

As a self-proclaimed LA burrito snob, I'm a huge fan. They're more Mission style burritos than what I'm used to from home, but effing tasty. The carne asada and chicken are both great. The home made chips are crunchy and perfect. And the salsas are on POINT. They're my favorite. I always ask for extra, and they're super nice to oblige. Sure, the service can be "slower", but every time I go in the line is out the door, and they have pretty much everyone working in the shop behind the counter putting the food together in a line. I've never had an ill made meal at EBX.

Perfect price, perfect taste, perfectly filling.
author: Savannah P.

description:
El Burrito express overall was a good experience for me. Though the place was pretty tiny, the burritos were okay. I ordered the Carne Asada super burrito, and trust me, it was good, but I definitely have had better. One thing I like about EBX, is that their regular burrito has all the same ingredients as the super, but smaller.. I would say significantly smaller.
Price wise, I would say that these burritos are worth it. They come with free chips, and if you ask for salsa, they give you both red and green! So if you're near and craving burritos, drop by!
author: Audrey G.

description: Definitely my favorite restaurant in the Sunset. It's unfortunate they aren't open on Sunday, they day I'm usually around. The Norcal is a winner.
author: David W.

description:
Okay...so I work down the street from this place.  I eat their burritos all the time.  Today I just tried one of their new menu items the Norcal Burrito.  Its has french fries, Carne Asada, Guacamole, Salsa, and Cheese. Gotta say it was pretty tasty.  Gooey...warm... and greesey.

Def. gonna get it again.
author: Sheenie L.

description:
NORCAL burrito! So bomb

Could you please not make me ask for salsa everytime you know I want it. The ladies that work here are generally not in good moods. Prepare for bad looks if you ask for extra salsa. But on that note, try the green sauce!
author: Mikhail K.

description: Quality decreased and prices have increased. I think people go here because (a) there are no other options for Mexican food in the neighborhood and (b) are just accustomed to it. I won't be going back.
author: M R.

description:
I've been going here for years - and its still good
Burritos, tacos, and more - they got it and now they take credit cards and deliver if you can wait...
 the only downside is the long line - I guess the deliveries make for longer waits
author: Jeremiah A.

description: Carne asada and fries in a burrito? What's not to like! I love their updated menu! Sure, the fries get soggy and I dislike soggy fries... Either way, I love it! It's like replacing your beans with potatoes! I had the Norcal burrito and I know it's not new! I've seen folks order this before, but never knew what it was. Now there's the El Americano Burrito, which is ground beef with fries and the fixings! This is exciting!!
author: Jeremy L.

description: The Chicken Bronco burrito is absolutely amazing. Everything on the menu is scrumptious, but the only problem is the room space. There should be more chairs or places to chill at. It's hard to tell at times whether a person is waiting in line or waiting for their order. I noticed the other day a guy who could actually understand what I was trying to say, but he may just be temporary.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
love it. love love love the burritos here. i go here every time im in the city. i like the fact that they made my burrito then put it on the grill for a few seconds to make it toasty! very cheap and pretty popular in the area. 

big fan!
author: Tara B.

description:
All-in-all a good burrito place in the Sunset.  I don't enjoy their tacos because I ordered it once and it came with beans...I don't eat my tacos with beans and usually at other taqueria's they don't add beans to a taco, right?  Anyways, their burrito's are good.  Been coming here for years and I do see a price increase ever so often.  

I give them a 3-stars because they just can't compete with the taqueria's down in the Mission.  Just way better...
author: Patrick C.

description:
Two of my friends recommended this place, so I'll just give it a shot. 

I got the El Norcal Burrito, and my friend got the El Bronco Burrito. The Norcal burrito was huge O.O that I only ate half of it. It tastes really good as well! This burrito's got everything (guacamole, cheese, juicy and tender beef, sour cream, salsa, and FRENCH FRIES!!) I want in a burrito for a reasonable price (~$7.75). 

I will definitely come back to try other burritos!
author: Pui L.

description:
The food here is good, IF you are NOT looking for authentic Mexican food (which is hard to find in SF. )

Otherwise, it is good, don't expect much, and you'll enjoy it.
author: Jessica S.

description:
This burrito place is definitely the place to go if you are craving for burrito around the sunset area. In my opinion, their burrito is better than Gordos. The hot sauce at this place is not as good. I don't even think it's spicy. They do give you free bag of chips. Overall, the place is affordable, and it's a good burrito place in the sunset area.

Parking is easy to find. They have meters on Taraval St. 

This place only accepts cash.
author: Terence F.

description:
El Burrito Express:
Pretty good burritos and Mexican food. I have had lots of things on the menu and all has been well above average, nothing incredible, but very solid 4 stars.
Good service, call ahead it gets crowded, very reliable.
author: forrest l.

description:
I have been debating whether I should say anything about this.... but I need to.  

El Burrito Express still deserves 5 stars but I need to say it...Their chips STINK!!  Get better chips....is it that hard?  

Everything else they make is out of this world..let's get those chips up to par...is that too much to ask?
author: Jessica J.

description:
Having a wet Burrito Express Burrito and it is awesome! I had called ahead and by the time I got there (15 minutes) they had still not started making it so I had to wait but it was so worth it. 
What could be better, having an awesome Burrito and watching the COLTS BEAT THE JETS?
For the $ I eat here every week.
author: Dan C.

description: They got my order wrong.  I ordered a super burrito and a tamale but theu gave me 3 tacos instead of the tamale. It still tasted very good so no real complaints.  I like the fact that they automatically give you chips and salsa and their hot sauce is good. You also get a free soda if you check in on yelp.  I'll be back there soon. I would have rated them higher if they had a seating area. It's definitely worth coming back but expect a little wait.
author: Jen J.

description: This is ridiculous.  How can a place call itself "El Burrito Express" and take HALF AN HOUR to make a burrito?  I'm writing this review to draw attention to the sad fact that this place is horribly, comically mis-branded.  There is nothing "express" about it.  When I come here in the evenings I just sit quietly and wait for my burrito like everyone else.  I realize that when there's a line one has to wait, and the wait is worth it.  However, this morning I called ahead to order a breakfast burrito.  I told the person on the phone what I wanted, and she said "ok it will be ready in 25-35 minutes." "I'm sorry?  Did you just say its going to take half an hour to make a burrito?" "Yes, we just opened and we haven't done anything yet."  This was at 10:10am, 10 minutes after they opened.  Here's a novel idea: kitchen prep!  In most restaurants the kitchen staff arrives early and gets the kitchen ready to do amazing things like serving food to people when the restaurant opens.  I know you might be thinking "Oh, this was probably a one time occurrence."  Guess what, the only other time I've ordered a breakfast burrito here, it took them about 20-25 minutes to actually produce the thing.    Needless to say I cancelled my order.  I don't have time for "El Burrito Eternity."
author: Benjamin R.

description: Super tasty food here. Was looking for a decent Mex to-go place in the Sunset and I found it. The freshly prepared chips and salsa killed it! And free chips with every meal!! I'm trying different items every day and so far each is well done. The service is slow when compared to the Mission or Chipotle, but the place is always busy. Carnitas..excellent. Carne asada...superb. Pollo asado...delicious. Did I mention the salsa....spicy and savory.
author: Patrick E.

description: I was in a hurry and stopped by and grabbed a steak burrito.  Fast and tasty.  If you are in a hurry and need a quick burrito, this is the place.
author: Jaime L.

description:
These burritos are SOO GOOOD! They are my absolute favorite for getting burritos because they are fresh and tasty! They are cheap and they make it fairly quickly. They also give you their chips which are good too. 

The only downside is that parking is kind of hard to find (street parking), but it is San Francisco and there is really no place for you to sit down and eat.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Are you kidding me. This is the 2nd time in  6 months. I really tried to like you guys but definitely not up to par with any real burrito joint. It just sucks cuz when you have those burrito cravings this place doesn't satisfy. I might as well drive to mission or glen park for the real thing. Anyways unorganized from ordering to pickup. Staff is not efficient and quality is close to taco bell. I had the super bronco steak. Burrito was dry and not much meat but lots of beans. Tortilla was tough like it was old. Jeez anyways no more chance of 3rd try.
author: Larry L.

description:
Forget the Mission. This is THE burrito place in SF. I remember when they first opened back in the early 80's.
