Their burritos were only 45¢ less than they are today and most people don't need to go for the big expresso. The regular or bronco [my recommendation] are more than enough. Free chips and salsa and if you're not there for a burrito they've got a huge list of other choices.

The only downside is that they're closed on Sundays and they're cash only, but you gotta give those girls a day to rest.
author: Eric K.

description:
The burritos are solid. I've tried all the burritos on the menu and they are consistently delicious. They also have those SoCal-inspired California Burritos with fries in them and a nacho version, too. My go-to is the steak Bronco Burrito (I love the whole slices of avocado), which comes out to $4.65 after tax. The Bronco is enough to fill me up, but if you're really hungry, you can upgrade to a Super for about a $1.50 more. This is my burrito place in the SF area.

My only gripe is their stinginess on salsa. This is a problem only if you like pouring lots of salsa in your burrito as I do. They only have "red" and "green" salsa pre-packaged in those little black plastic cups with clear lids all Mexican joints have seemed to agreed to use, and they give you a dirty look when you ask for more than the allotted quota (2 per burrito). On one occasion, one of the ladies working there said I couldn't have 3 green and 2 red and when I offered to pay for them, she sighed, pursed her lips, and scrunched her eyebrows as the put requested amount of salsa in bag. Straight up mean. It must cost pennies per cup for them to make this salsa and there really isn't a reason to go all Oliver Twist on me in the first place.

Aside from their salsa Nazism, the burritos are great and don't let my complaint stop you from eating here. If anything, go and ask for more salsa so they learn to let it go.
author: Gun-Ik P.

description: Great spot for a chicken enchilada plate, tucked away on Taraval. I'm not really a burrito person, so sorry to those looking for a burrito review of "El Burrito" but what I do know, I've been here twice now during the lunch hour rush... And this tiny Mexican joint had a line out the door with people ordering BURITTOs.
author: Teena Marie T.

description: Delicious food! I love their avocado tacos and their cheese burrito.  I am a little bummed that the prices have gone up so much. I've been going to this place since before they had a website, changed their menu, and increased their prices. I miss the days of their more reasonable rates. It is nice to have a decent Mexican place in the Sunset though. I don't always have time to travel to the mission or the excelsior to get good Mexican food.
author: Amber S.

description:
This is my neighborhood burrito joint so I cone here often. Their bronco burritos, bean and cheese burrito, nachos, and tamales are good. To be honest, everything kind of tastes the same but it satisfies my burrito cravings. 

Call beforehand, order take out, and ask for salsa or you'll just get a bag of chips with nothing to dip it in.
author: Jane C.

description:
Best burrito in SF, 6 blocks from my house....

Oh yes you get 5 stars!
author: Chaslin S.

description:
I've been coming here because I've got groupon-esqe deals for this place from scoutmob and buywithme. yay! half off burritos. 
Ive tried the one with shrimp and avocado. that was REALLY good. i think its like $9. 
got the one with carne esada and frenchfries, that was REALLY GOOD. i think that was also $9.
i like the chips and green salsa.---free
got the horchata----$1.50

or just get a normal burrito. its all good. not expensive. the end!
author: just k.

description:
El Burrito Express

This place is still good!  I first went to El Burrito Express 25 years ago when we lived in the Sunset District.  We moved to the other side of the city and had not been back since until about a month or so ago.  We were over in the Sunset (random), saw the place and wondered if it was still the same.  We decided to stop and try and have been back 4 times since then.  

The bottom line is this place has been around for over 30 years.  It's a total neighborhood take out restaurant with 4 or 5 bar stools for dine in.  They serve great food with larger portions and their prices are very reasonable.  The menu is primarily burritos and tacos and with 3 or 4 different styles.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  One bit of advice is to make sure you check your order before you leave to make sure everything you ordered is in the bag!  Somehow some sides of guacamole and salsa missed the bag and went unnoticed until we got home.  Ugh!  Also, we noticed several large cans of Raid in the back on the shelf next to the kitchen areas as well as the SF Dept of Health card for the restaurant's number score posted backwards on the wall in the frame.  We don't want to know!
author: Chris F.

description: I've been here over the course of a few years and I have to say that their good quality remains the same. I love their chicken super bronco burritos, it doesn't have rice in it but that means you get more meat, beans and other delicious vegetables. Size varies with the type of burrito you get. The largest it can get is maybe less than 10 inches in length which is not that big compared to other burrito joints that I've been to. Comes with chips and salsa: red for hot, green for mild. The wait can get long depending on when you go, some people order like eight burritos at a time. Talk about a fiesta.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This place has been here ever since I was really little!

I remember always coming here with my dad, and brother to get burritos! It's really close to my house, and it is the best place to get burritos in sunset hands down. There aren't many, or really aren't any places in sunset that sell burritos! I can really only think of 2 other places. I've had burritos from the mission district, and they have really good tacos there, but they can't beat the burritos here! 

 Anyways, if you're a real big eater you can order a super burrito (I think that's what it's called, I may be wrong). Like any other place that sells burritos, you can basically customize it. I always get steak, because the meat isn't tough, it's actually really tender! I haven't really eaten anything else here, because I'm so use to just getting burritos here! All this talk about burritos is making me really hungry now. 

Sometimes on the weekends this place gets really packed, and it's also not very big! There is a table going along the walls in front of the windows, and about 7-10 stools. The prices here are really good too! You can't go wrong with this place!
author: Heather C.

description:
Skip the stinky combination Taco Bell/KFC down the street and look for this 30 year old local gem on the corner. The long lines will speak volumes on the quality. But ultimately what you can expect is a solid burrito.... way, way, way out in the Sunset!

UPDATE: My new fav is the Expresso carne asada burrito. (Never sure what exactly to call it... it is basically a wet super carne asada burrito with sour cream.) Also, noted that I subtracted one star because the burritos are a tad expensive, they aren't open late or on Sundays, ,and because a super burrito doesn't come with sour cream standard... I know, i know... not traditional blah blah blah... whatever. Go to any other burrito stand in SF and ask for a super burrito and see what you get.)
author: K. C.

description:
I would say the food gets 3-4 stars. I really like the Fresh Mix burrito because it has a nice selection of vegetables inside. Usually, Mexican places are so greasy that even a vegetarian option has no nutritional value. This is a nice compromise and I haven't found another burrito quite like it in the city. However, when I ask for extras they really skimp. They are so cheap.

The service is pretty horrible and gets a 1,  unless one of the young white guys is working. They act like they are doing you a favor by serving you. They don't offer salsa and scoff if you ask for two. They are rude on the phone and once they put me on hold to help customer after customer in their shop. I hung up and ate elsewhere. 

With their attitude, they are only in business because of the lack of burrito shops on Taraval.
author: Rachel M.

description: Refused to honor a valid check in offer, cashier on 4/4 at 4:30 was also very rude!!!
author: Jason R.

description:
Surf & Turf!  Jumbo Shrimp and Carne Asada! 
This place is fast and so yummy!  Its been here ForEver! 

Watch out for the step! 

This place gets crazy packed - especially when Lincoln is out for lunch so AVOID DURING LUNCH!  Go around 11 or 1.  Parking is a pain - but all parking on Taraval is.
author: Erika G.

description:
I come here for the Expresso chicken burrito with sour cream topped with their enchilada sauce.  D-LISH. . . a favorite item of mines since 1996.

A second favorite burrito joint outside of the Mission is the taqueria at SFSU.  I remember those days ordering 'EL CABO' #3 with blk beans and then sitting thru class daydreaming.

*remember to get the red and green salsa for your chips*
author: Max L.

description:
Oh this review is gonna be bomb-diggity cause I'm actually craving the wet-burrito goodness that coats my tummy like chocolate milk on a cold winter day....

So you're checking this place out on yelp, wondering if it's a good joint to hit up. You're either craving mex, wondering why this hole in the wall has 4 stars, or maybe you need a new place to check out. Well this, folks, is a great place to all your wonderment (except if you're looking a place to sit down and eat) but that doesn't matter! Eat at home for once, come here, order the wet one (any type will do) take it home, open it, get a good whiff of the aroma, then dig in while you sit in front of the tv watchin' your favorite show/movie. 

It can be big enough to save for left overs the next day, and it's always just as yummy. Doused with sauced, towered with cheese, stuffed and packed with all the fixings in just under $7! 

Really, really, get up. go. now!
author: Quinallison D.

description:
This place brings back memories..

Back when I was in high school, I would cut the class before lunch to get here early. Since the class I was in then was always band, the teacher was cool with it provided that I brought something back for him. Thanks Mr. Portale, you rocked! 

Now those high school days are over, but I still come here when its not a line out the door of high school brats. Abraham Lincoln is just up the hill by the way. 

I came here today around 11ish and ordered the El Macho Burrito right before the joint was flooded with high school brats. I walked out of there with my lunch and an Horchata (rice drink made of cinnamon, lemon zest, rice and almonds). Just under 10 bucks, this motherload burrito filled me up good with a Mexican beer. *whew*

When schools are in session, try to order your food before 1130am or else you'll be fighting with the kids to get your food. It's a pain in the ass really. The service here is good too. =]
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Someone else said it: they act like they're doing you a favor when you come in to order with them.

Also, the kitchen staff there basically dumps their garbage on the sidewalk... notice the amount of avocado seeds around the sidewalk outside and the discoloration from the slop they leave to rot outside their establishment and how the tree outside their place is dead from root rot from flooding the sidewalk while cleaning kitchen mats.
author: R S.

description:
I'm a sucker for good burrito places.  Being from Davis, I'm a little limited to that great taqueria experience and more importantly great taqueria food.  I went for lunch the other day.  It was the weekend and not all that crowded, a good thing since there are no more than 10 stools in the place.  Just another older guy waiting for his order and me deciding.  I ended up ordering the El Bronco Burrito with carne asada, got some  red salsa, and took it to go.  

I ate it within 10 minutes of ordering and man it was good.  Everything that was in it worked well together, the warm tortilla, the spices with the meat, everything.  The only downside was the lack of salsa inside the burrito.  Aside from the salsa I grabbed on the side, that I generously doused into the burrito, it was a bit dry in there aside from meat juices.

In the end, I'd go back.  Price was less than $7 for a burrito that left me full for most of the day, and in the area there isn't much choice for authentic burrito options.
author: Sam H.

description:
I've lived on 21st and Taraval for about a year and it's pretty unfortunate, being a burrito fiend I hadn't tried this place until last week! 
I ordered a vegetarian burrito (wet, which makes it 10x better) and it was sooo goooooood! 
They're chips are great and their salsa ain't bad either. I'd definitely go check it out one night when you don't feel like cookin'.


Plus, they had the World Cup schedule posted on the wall, it was love after that. I think I may walk down for dinner before they close!
author: Erika S.

description: Moderate burrittos for the price. I expected a tiny bit cheaper. Cash only which isn't so decent when I've used all my money on muni. Haha. The staff is really nice, though.
author: Erika D.

description:
Cheap, filling burritos!
Bronco burritos are the best. 
 -Sliced avocado (not just guac)
 -pot beans
 -no rice (I always have to ask for rice to be removed at other burrito shops)
 -delicious salsa
 -lots of cheese 
Ask for hot sauce...so good.
author: alison r.

description:
If your in the Sunset and you're craving Mexican food...then tough sh*t, you're out of luck. 

There aren't many taquerias in the Sunset, three come to mind. 
1 sucks, 1 is good ,and EBX is the best.
The burritos are filled with all the good stuff that's bad for you. The Expresso burrito is big enough for two people or one really fat person. They flame grill their chicken and steak, I wish they threw their carnitas on the grill as well for a little crispness. It's cheap AND good. The crispy tacos (hidden on the menu) are crispy greasy goodness. 

I'm giving them four stars beacuase, thank God they're in the Sunset or else I'd have to drive to the panhandle for a good burrito.
author: Asa S.

description:
This place can get busy on evenings after work, but it's well worth the wait. I'm ashamed to say that I haven't tried many menu offerings simply because after trying the shredded chicken Expresso burrito, my boyfriend and I always want that particular one.

It's AMAZING, and if more than a week goes by without having it, we start to crave it. We always bring it home, weigh it (consistently it weighs more than 2 lbs... we keep tally!), cut it in half, and sit down to enjoy. 

So, what's so great about the Expresso burrito variation? Well, normally I'm not one to get excited about wet burritos. But the sauce on this is great, not to mention that it's slathered in guacamole, melted cheese, and sour cream, so it's a combination that cannot go wrong. Inside... melted cheddar, rice, beans, and shredded chicken. 

Expresso Burrito makes their own chips daily, and they're extra crispy and crunchy. I can only imagine they're not good for caloric intake, but they're okay once a week or so... I think. ;) And they're green salsa is very tasty! I pour it on the side of the burrito sometimes, as well as dip the chips in it. We always ask for 2 green salsas so that the boyfriend and I both have our own and  don't have to share. 

And, last but not least!  The "Buy 9 Burritos, Get the 10th One FREE" card. I don't recall how we found out about this, but it's already such a great value, and then to have this added bonus is really great. We've already received 3 free burritos or so in the past year, which is pretty awesome...
author: Katy S.

description:
A pretty decent burrito. Not too shabby, but not anything worth really writing home about. I've tried both their regular grilled chicken burrito as well as their mojado burrito. Satisfies the burrito craving, but I've had better. 

My main draw to this place is the fact that they deliver! Simply amazing. I would still love to try their nachos as well as their version of the California burrito. I'm a native southern California, so I have to admit my standards are pretty high.

My only real complaint is unfortunately the woman who usually answers the telephone and takes the orders is awful at her job. The first time we ordered from them we waited an hour and a half, called back twice only to have her tell us she that they canceled our order because they thought we were prank callers. This was also only 3:00 in the afternoon. Give me a break. You also have to repeat your order multiple times before she seems to get it all down. It can be very frustrating.

I must not fail to mention that my boyfriend did in fact try their huge burrito. 2 feet i recall? Anyway, it seemed like a very good deal for the price... If you don't mind eating the burrito for the next few days as well!
author: Katie S.

description:
I live in the Richmond so usually go to Gordo's but my friend said he read this place was good so we gave it a try.  I was pretty impressed!

I got the chicken Bronco burrito and I don't like beans so they offered to give me something extra.  They offered sour cream and I don't like that either so he said he would give me extra guacomole.  And they asked me if I wanted chips and salsa, they don't charge extra for that either.

I liked the burrito, it was very moist and delicious.  They put slices of avocado in too.  I liked it better than Gordo's which seems to be going downhill, and Gordo's charges extra for chips and they never offer anything else when I say no beans and I have to pay for the guacomole.  None of their burritos come with it.

This place also has more options, fish and some interesting sounding vegetarian mixes too.  I will definitely be coming back, especially since it's on the way home from Fort Funston, one of my dog's favorite walking places.
author: Madeline M.

description:
So, I live in the Sunset. What does that mean? I consume more noodles than beans? More wontons than tortillas? More thai iced tea than horchata? Nah. Life finds a way. The mexican food at El Burrito Express is an awesome find in this neck of the woods. They have thick tortilla chips and spicy salsa that comes free with your meal, and the expresso (x included) sauce that they drown the specialty burritos in is awesome. 

Here's what I do: 
-Get a burrito with black beans. 
-Add white cheese.
-Add guac.
-The rest is really up to you. Burritos are a very intimate and personal form of expression. 
-Get the eXpresso sauce on the side. It's very flavorful, and therefore a bit overwhelming when it drenches your burrito. 

Tip to those who want their eXpress delivered: Be prepared to wait a while, deliveries can take up to an hour.
author: Chanti B.

description: Their burritos are no joke! They're HUGE and definitely worth every penny! The only negative thing I would say about this place is the lady taking my order was RUDE! I was trying to ask her about the free soda on yelp for checking in. She just ignored me completely! I asked her about 3-4 times if they honored it, since there was no expiration date given. All I wanted was a yes/no answer. Also it took her about 10 mins just to take my money! While I was ready to pay, she was on the phone,helping somebody else! If only I got her name.. If I see her again, I won't go here.
author: Elle N.

description:
Si, si, si! :D

It's Thursday night in Parkside and you don't feel like cooking...but you don't feel like doing the whole restaurant experience. What do you do? WHAT DO YOU DO?!?!

Why, go to El Burrito Express of course! Their fast, friendly staff will furnish you with a tasty take-out meal that is so generously portioned yet so reasonably priced, you'll do a double-take on your receipt.

There's no need to schelp to the Mission for the SF burrito experience. Come on down to a nice little neighborhood you've probably never ventured to before, grab some yummy Mexican food and hop on the L just in time to watch the sun set over the Pacific.
author: Julia D.

description:
Coming from the Land of Tacos (a.k.a LA) I've been feeling a sense of dread over the lack of good taco options in San Francisco. My Better Half is a SF native and loves burritos ( I'm more of a taco girl myself),  so though he bemoans the loss of tacos just as loudly as I do, he has something to calm his hungry belly since SF is burrito territory. Well,  thank heavens for El Burrito Express 1!!! Not only are they tasty, but in my neighborhood!!!

Ok, now it has to be said UP FRONT: this is not LA quality tacos. There are taco trucks in LA that will make you WEEP with joy. BUT El Burrito Express has some killer steak. I'd almost venture to say better than some taco trucks in LA. Their lack of Al Pastor is disturbing, but I forgive in the face of high quality steak. The Taquitos (2 corn tortillas, meat, cilantro, lime) are the same size and idea as the LA taco truck taco which means I can wolf down about 4 of them, suck down a Mexican Coke and call it a day. Added bonus is they give you chips and salsa (I'm a light weight, green all the way, baby!). The big downer is CASH ONLY. 

Burritos look tasty, but I'm hooked on their taquitos and they will hold me until I get my Al Pastor fix in LA. Did I mention that they deliver? Oh sweet, sweet laziness! I dig it.
author: Meghan R.

description: Mexican restaurant in a highly asian based community.  Need I say more?
author: Brenda L.

description:
I like their Bronco Burritos and the Expresso Burritos (the ones covered in sauce). I think this is the best burrito place in the Avenues.

They lose one star because one of the women who works there is always a little snotty with me (maybe with everyone?) and they seem to have some issues with their phone lately ( don't always answer, hang up on you when you're on hold, etc.)

It is a good place to get your food and then go somewhere else to eat it.
author: Audrey H.

description:
Definitely the best burrito joint you'll find in the Sunset.

With the appearance and taste of a burrito out of the Mission, the only huge difference is the price - you can get a typical burrito (meat, cheese, rice, beans, guacamole, sour cream, salsa) for $5, with fresh chips too. Service is very fast (hence the "express") so it's the perfect there's nothing in the house/I don't feel like cooking last minute decision.

They only take cash, and excluding the burritos their menu is slightly lacking, but considering their size and speed, these are only minor drawbacks.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Holy Macaroni...or in this case Holy Jalepeno!!!  These burritos are phenominal.....  Freshly made with  fresh ingredients...  This is the only burrito joint that I have ever been in that offers tofu burritos on whole wheat tortillas with all fresh veggies and black beans....CALLING ALL VEGETARIANS, YOU CAN FIND A GOOD BURRITO TO EAT!!!!!!!  My g/f had the Cancun (shrimp) and commented on how much shrimp came in hers, I had the Vera Cruz (fish) with black beans, yum!!!!

Caveat: don't come here if your on your way to the Airport, running late or have to catch the next bus....you will wait or your little slice of heaven to be created, but ohhhhh is it worth the wait...

Oh yeah, bring your green.....no plastic here!!!

I will be back over and over again...
author: B M.

description:
With 268 reviews in place, it's not clear what I can add, but I have to say that my first and only experience at El Burrito Express was a winner.  Sure it would have been nice to have more of an opportunity to sit down and eat, but that said, their Grilled Chicken Soft Taco and their Grilled Steak Bronco Burrito were fresh, delicious, large and offer a bang-for-the-buck that you would be hard pressed to beat anywhere.  Absolutely yummy.

We'll definitely be back.
author: Josh M.

description: The menu boasts mouth-watering awesomeness, with many items under $10. Fast service and great value!
author: Caroline L.

description: This place is ok for what it is. I only eat here cuz they are close to where I live now. Still prefer the taquerias in the Mission, but they are really expensive now as the "Mish" is a trendy hipster spot. I won't say the food here is terrible, but it is bland and the sauces here don't really grab you. The Prices are a little on the pricey side, but hey they are the only burrito joint close by, so it's ok to gouge you.
author: Mos J.

description:
this place is somewhat unconventional to me, their burrito classifications leave me staring at the menu longer than i'd like to.

overall burritos are decent, especially for that part of town.
author: Ameer N.

description:
While i will go here if i want a quick burrito for lunch, it is definitely not the best burrito I've ever had. 

The ladies who work here are awesome, they are very flirty with me every time i go in there. Its nice. So the service is there.

However the food is not very good, the meat is bland and not very well seasoned, beans runny, and guacamole taste processed. i would not recommend it unless you want a really big burrito, it is large.
author: Troy S.

description:
Good burritos, close to home. 
Cash only which is often very inconvenient. 

No tables or anything inside. All take out. Eh.
author: Taryn S.

description:
One of the few Mexican places in Sunset.  Fortunately, it's pretty good.  I love the freshly grilled steak and the chunks of avocado.  My usual is the steak Bronco Burrito with sour cream added...  extra hot sauce on the side.  Tamarind Jarritos to top things off = win.

Also recently branched out and tried a Crispy Taco and Chile Relleno.  Not too shabby!

Definitely my go-to place when I'm lazy and want a nice fat burrito (pretty much every day).
author: Thuan N.

description: I have a big Mexican family and we are very picky about Mexican restaurants and the food served.  Its a time consuming process to make tamales so we usually order them from El Burrito Express.  We order the tamales in the husk; salsa and cheese on the side.  The tamales are excellent!  Not greasy at all.  The masa is perfect and not only filling but tasty.  I prefer the chicken tamales, but the meat and pork tamales are also very good.  A big 5 star for this Mexican restaurant.
author: Gloria T.

description:
I've definitely had El Burrito Express over thirty times (probably even more than that) in my life and I have such mixed reviews that a three is probably the most fair rating I can give it. 

Living in the Sunset, your food choices (especially Mexican food) are limited. Sure if you want to eat any type of Asian food every day for the rest of your life you're set, but my family orders from here often enough that I've had some huge hit or miss dinners. I'll try to break it down into the good and the bad:

The Good:
- The burritos here are huge. If you eat one of their burritos and tortilla chips (I'll comment on these later) you'll be absolutely stuffed. And if you're not, then I'm guessing you can't see the scale below your belly...
- The selection of chicken/rice/beans is pretty solid. 
- The food is reasonably priced. When I get dinner for my family of four the total is usually hovering around $25.00-$28.00

The Bad:
- Parking and the waits in line can be the biggest pain in the ass. If it isn't enough that MUNI runs along Taravel and there's never any parking, the neighbors here are assholes. I literally double parked (not blocking a driveway or anything) to pick up something for FIVE MINUTES and a lady was getting ready to write a note on my car. Too bad she's one of those all-talk bitchy old women that cower when confronted.
- When they mess up your order, they really mess it up. There's a huge taste difference between the grilled chicken (tastes HORRIBLE here) and regular shredded chicken. 
- The free tortilla chips are sometimes stale as hell. They literally sit near the counter and I'm sure some are past their expiration date. But when they're fresh they taste fine.

So all and all, this place is pretty good. Just make sure you order ahead and if you're picking up make sure you're quick. I can understand as a neighbor it would be annoying to have cars double parked but obviously they didn't think ahead when they moved there. 

If you're going in by foot there can sometimes be long waits. It's crowded inside too (very little space) so sometimes you might be a little too close for comfort with the people around you. However, the food is good enough to keep coming back. I would give this place a shot if you're in the area.
author: Sean B.

description:
Ew. Ew. Ew. Worst burrito ever! 

Every time I drive by this place, it is hopping! Usually a good sign. But not in this case. Oh my god. I'm still reeling from the horrifying burrito I had last night.

We went in there right before they closed and they were awesome to serve us. Typically, this is a bad call too, to order right before a restaurant is closing, which is why I'm stating it up front. Always a little nervous that employees want to go the hell home and you are getting the scraps leftover they are about to toss or that have been sitting around. But this place is crazy busy in the evening so I doubt that things sit around.

I ordered a Super Carnitas Burrito. Pretty standard. But oh so gross. It was flimsy, not wrapped tight and wet. This was not a wet burrito I ordered, people. The meat was wet. Not moist like oh-so-good moist/ wet. Just wet. It was really gross. And I ate it. Cuz I was hungry. And now I feel gross.

The chips were great! And thank you for serving us when you were about to close. And the Celtics were on which we wanted to watch but couldn't stick around but that's cool. And we got our food VERY fast, which is also good. But man, a woman needs her sustenance and this was not yummy at all.....except for the chips which technically are coming with the burrito so all that adds up to about one star. The food (except the chips) gets zero stars in my opinion.
author: Katie H.

description:
I was a little surprised upon arriving that neither carne asada nor pollo asado were listed on the menu.  I mean, I'm all for carnitas, but pork isn't everything.  I ordered the steak burrito, which was very good and I look forward to trying a few more things from this establishment.  Overall, it was good food and quick service.  

Make sure you have cash because the ATM at the liquor store across the street costs $2.50 for a withdrawal.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I have found the holy grail of burrito shops in the Sunset/Parkside districts. Mind you, there is not much competition in this district but I don't cut slack just because this isn't the Latino part of town. These prices can't be found in the more trendy districts ($5-6 here versus $8-9) and these ladies know how to cook!

I prefer the El Macho burrito. It's $9.50, comes with two meat choices, and is almost 2 feet long. Mind you, I cut it in half because it's essentially the size of two of their $5.50 burritos and it's a better value that way too.

Meats: Great chile verde, the pork was tender and it tasted authentic; the grilled chicken was also a standout favorite for me. I would only caution those who prefer carne asada, as depending when you go there you might end up getting some shoveled on from their hot prep area and I've had it slightly dry.

In terms of authenticity, the flavors shine through. Although they only have a red and green salsa, both are well spiced but make sure to ask for them as they don't have a big enough storefront to have a salsa bar.

I speak from experience when I say, avoid the Judah and 45th(ish) Mexican spot. I know it's bigger, but it is not worth sacrificing flavor for ambiance. Make the trip to Taraval.
author: Name R.

description:
so yeah, i'd eat here again.  

i'm lucky enough to have a coworker who's also a neighbor, and he often offers me a lift home.  sometimes he stops by here on the way home and the last time he did there was no line (wtf?!?) so i'm all in for a burrito.  much better than i expected, even if i didn't plan to have my burrito doused with sauce.
author: Henry M.

description:
Hory mory!

When I lived around that area El Burrito Express was THE place to stuff my face with awesomely delicious burritos! Even when I was poor, I could still count on some good tacos from this place to pick me up.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Damn you breakfast torta. More on that in a second.

After my five star Divisadero Burrito Express experience (http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-burrito-express-2-san-francisco#hrid:U3deMXdqsmSp2PKjdTMXkg), I couldn't wait to check out there second location. Once again very good, and very, very cheap ($4.98 for a basic chicken burrito), but this one felt like it was missing that little something extra. I don't think it was as big (maybe a good thing), and while the chicken, very tasty strips in a mild sauce, was delicious, I could have used a little more. And I forgot to ask for the lettuce instead of guac swap I got at the other location. That's my own fault.

It was a very, very good burrito, and probably five stars if I wasn't so enamored with my first one. The bar was raised.

But so much for officially checking Burrito Express off the list. Noticed they offer breakfast, including the aforementioned breakfast torta. I will have to go back. And I'm kind of OK with that.
author: Jason B.

description:
Three words: VEGAN refried beans. Yeahhhhh awesome, right? Make sure you ask for the hot salsa when you're picking up your order; it's perfect to pour over each bite. I've only had their meatless burritos so refer to another review for a recap on how their flesh tastes. 

Sadly, I would have given 5 stars but my last burrito here was a lukewarm mess. It was pretty traumatic. I wanted to get BX one last time before I moved to Berkeley and they royally screwed up. Guacamole instead of sliced avocado, 75% tortilla and 25% filling, and gross cheese. Heartbreaking, right? Maybe one day I'll return and my love for them will be redeemed.
author: Sarah J.

description: I am from San Diego, lots of great authentic mexican food but I can say that this is one of the best I've had. I can't really pin point what exactly it is but just everything meshes so well together! The way the cheese is melted and the way everything just goes. I ordered the NorCal Burrito.. basically a California Burrito and I was not disappointed. I will definitely be stopping by again soon!
author: T L.

description: I have both ordered from here for delivery and went there to do take out as well.  All I can say is that they have fulfilled any craving for Mexican food that I've had whenever I'm at my bf's house (which is just a few blocks away).  The ladies that work here cook with a lot of care and love and it shows.  The only negative is that it's cash only. Besides that, I love this place!
author: Donna D.

description:
These burritos are great.  Cheap, tasty and fast.

I got the steak bronco burrito for under $5 and it lasted me two meals.

I love how they put slices of avocados inside and nooo sour cream.  Chips come with your burrito & you can always ask for hot sauce on the side.

There's always a line when I go so maybe it's better to call ahead.. not that it matters since it takes less than five minutes from ordering to actually get your food!
author: Kimiko Q.

description: This hole in the wall has been here since I was in middle school for close to twenty years! I had also lived in the neighborhood since I was a toddler.   I have been to El Burrito many times over the years and have never once wrote a review and felt I can without prejudice! The food here has always been affordable compared to most Mexican places. Of course prices have gone up over the years but they are still affordable in comparison.  I like the fact that they fry their own chips and hard taco shells which is a big plus not like other places with the pre-bought ones! They cook their items fresh daily. I have tried some other places where the meat just have an odd taste ( not sure if the oil being reused) but the food taste fresh here and you see them cook it. They include chips with every order and you can ask for red or green hot sauce or both. They do not have a salsa bar but I feel it is not needed.  They are fast, and I have no problems with their customer service and find them very friendly and accommodating.  All my years of coming here , I have not had a single bad experience which cannot be by chance being a frequent customer. I hope this place will still be around for many years to come! I basically grew up with them being in the neighborhood! I hope they keep up the good work and reasonable prices.
author: FG L.

description:
Drunk me approves of the El Norcal burrito. 

Warning: It is 2-3 meals worth of food. Attempt to consume in one sitting at your own peril. 

Sober me may or may not return. It's a hole in the wall with what looked like a number of health code violations.
author: Katherine E.

description:
I recently threw my Mom a 60th birthday party and since one of her fav foods in Mexican, I automatically thought of Burrito Express.  Growing up in Sunset, I often got my Mexican Food Fix by visiting Burrito Express and was never disappointed.  Therefore, I picked up the phone and called about having my Mom's party catered.  And the rest was history!  Being an event planner myself, my expectations are high for both service and food.  I dealt with Phil the entire time and he was awesome!  There was no doubt in my mind that the food that I specifically ordered was going to show up at the time we specifically discussed.  The food and agua frescas were an absolute hit!  

Thanks for helping to make my Mom's 60th birthday memorable and a hit!  I know we'll work together again!
author: kelly m.

description:
The best Mexican food in San Francisco.  Everyone says "go to the Mission" but they don't know what they are talking about.  This place is amazing.  They use traditional recipes from Jalisco.  Try the Expresso Burrito, it is awesome.

During dinner hours phone your order in ahead of time and there will be no waiting.  Also, seating is limited.
author: Eric H.

description: When I worked in the area, I use to have their burritos for lunch all the time, but I don't usually venture out into the Sunset anymore. It was really yummy when I had it again recently, but boy was I surprised that it had gone up in price. Gone are the $4 beef bronco burritos. Kind of sad, how everything is pricier these days.
author: Sharon H.

description:
I was seriously floored when I saw a sub 4-star average here.  

Don't ya hate it... when you take a friend to a great restaurant... and they ignore your recommendation and they order something funky and then tell you the place was "OK I guess..."  Hahaha.  Ok that being said...

Go here... order a "Grilled Steak Super Bronco Burrito" with re fried beans and you will have a new top 10 food item almost guaranteed.  I prefer it with no onions and tomatoes.

I have taken at least a dozen friends to this place over the years... ordered them the exact same item I just described (cept. Cindy needed extra avocado and extra cheese) and all but one person has told me it was the best burrito they had ever had...  seriously.  So good its addicting.

When I lived in SF I would mix in a chicken super bronco but now that I only get to go there every so often I have to go with the grilled steak.

Note: be prepared to eat in your car... or drive down Taraval to the beach... there are like 5 stools in there and that's it.

Final Note:  Props to my ex roomate Pat Freeman for introducing me to this place years ago.
author: ジェーイソン

description: Okay, so burritos aren't really the best thing to be eating when you're working your a$$ off at the gym every day to lower that BMI. However! -- The grilled chicken regular bronco burrito with black beans is fantastico! I'm also digging the whole wheat tortilla. Really brightens my day when I'm roaming around in the Sunset and it doesn't leave me feeling gross and heavy like some burritos do. Eat 'em up, yum!
author: Natasha P.

description: Not a bad place just not great for vegetarians. Good prices, but uninteresting veggie options. Would be better served going somewhere else. Nice staff though.
author: Heather L.

description:
I ended up going here twice in the same week (thursday and saturday), if I had only gone once this would have been a 4-star review.  The first time I went was around 5:30pm and I got a carne asada El Burrito with sour cream and cheese.  It tasted fantastic!  That day I would have given them 5 stars, except for the problems with their location - there's no area to wait and there's only a small (1-person) space to leave an order at.  They have two registers but it's impossible for two people to stand side by side and place/pay for orders.

The burrito was so good I started craving it again a couple of days later when I was nearby.  I ordered the exact same burrito (carne asada + sour cream & cheese).  Same crowding problem inside.  So glad I knew to call in my order beforehand.  This time I grabbed my food around 3:30pm.  I took a bite of my burrito and immediately noticed it did not taste the same as the one I had eaten on Thursday.  Maybe they used a different salsa or something?  I did not like the taste of the new burrito, it didn't seem as fresh, nor as filling, as the previous one.

I hate food inconsistency so I had to mark down a full star for that.  Maybe I'll try them again around dinner time on a weeknight to see if I can get a tasty burrito again...
author: Debbie G.

description:
El burrito you are the bomb.  When in the sunset or Parkside as its categorized by yelp (why do we keep getting more and more hoods in SF - I think we are at capacity peeps, but I digress.  Anywho...El Burrito Express 1 - very yum yum yummies.  

I recommend getting the guacamole if you love it because it is good! I got the Super burrito with Chicken - HUGE is the only word I have.  Go to this spot when you are hungry for sure.  The cost was $5.50 (cheap) and the wait for the Mexican goodness was about oh 5 minutes.  The flavors were nice and if you are like me and like things Hot Hot Hot order spicy and you will get a medium flame.  I actually could have had it a little hotter, but it was still great! 

I will be back El Burrito Express 1 you can count on it and my appetite for sure!
author: Heidi S.

description:
$5 meal - burrito AND fresh brew chips.

DELICIOUS.
author: Pamela R.

description: Food takes anywhere from 5 minutes to 20 min to finish. The burritos are average. They use too think of a tortilla in my opinion. I like their chips but if u get dip u have to order it because the free stuff is no bueno.
author: Alex C.

description: I used to live down the street from the place, but I have to say it's better than most anything I've had in the mission. Prices are cheep, quality is good, taste is consistent, and the women who run it are wonderful as well. I HIGHLY reccomend the Exspresso Burrito which is a lot of food but they put this sauce on it that is amazing. It's basically two meals for $7. Or get the bronco if you like to eat normal sized portions, which will run you under $5.
author: Frank V.

description:
Need a quick taco fix on Friday night, and called them to see if they had any crispy tacos. They did! So we came here and ordered 2 carne asada tacos. This is a small tacqueria place, so there is not really much room to sit down. There are a few stools on the side, but mainly its a take and go place. 

The 2 tacos were so good, we went back and ordered 5 more! Hey at $1.50/each for a crispy taco, its a steal! I called in the order 15 mins before they closed, and the lady recognized me and was glad I had enjoyed my tacos. And even threw in a bag of chips this time around. There was lots of people both times I went. The taco's were very tasty, and I will be back for me!
author: Betty S.

description:
Not much to say about this place.

The only way to ruin a burrito is to not use fresh ingredients. This place does not fail. The steak is good; the ingredients are fresh, and the combination of foods taste delicious. 

They are usually busy so expect a little bit of a wait. Not much room to sit, I would recommend this place as a "take out" joint. 

I usually get a Super Burrito Steak, or and Expresso Burrito(wet) with chicken. I would recommend black beans on either. I feel that refried beans drown out the flavor in foods. 
The Steak quesadilla is also excellent and I would highly recommend it as well.  

Short and simple, I like this place for its good food, large portions, and cheap prices. Its my local Burrito shack.
author: Jeff G.

description:
I used to come here when I went to Brainchild across the street for tutoring.. God i hated that place, i felt like the dumbest kid in the world there, the tutor ALWAYS got mad at me and I was like.."WHAT?!?! I JUST DONT GET IT!!" 
He wasnt freakin explaining anything, expected me to shoot out equations like nothing...anyways, after a grueling 2 hours at that crap joint I would sometimes get a burrito here..they were soo good...

Now lets fast forward about 10 years, so the other day driving down Taraval, my lady and I were wondering what to eat. And what do you know, El Burrito...so what the hell, I know she hasn't had one of these burritos before and I was quite sure she would enjoy them.

Man o man, we were so full~~ sooooooooo good and soooo cheap for what you get!!! man o man~ Not many burrito joints in the sunset, and i'm sure the lot of you have been here but for those who havent come on down and get yourself a nice big fat wet one!~ hahaha
author: phillip w.

description: If you want service go somewhere else.  1st you have to figure out who's in line to order and then you just have to wait as the cashier takes the orders and chats up the rest of the staff as she brings the order to the other side of their production line to put your order in line.  So, I usually call ahead.  But I'm done with this place.  I called the other night on my way home and was immediately put on hold.  Which just meant she put the phone down on the counter.  I waited as I watched the counter on my phone.  Finally, after listening to her take a couple of orders and then laughing and having good time, I started yelling into the phone hoping someone would hear me.  After 10 minutes, the phone was hung up.  Since I was close, I stopped in and asked what had happened.  I showed her my phone which showed I had been on the phone for 10 minutes, and did I get an apology, no.  She looked at me and said they must have been busy and then looked for the phone.  It was gone!  So I asked to speak to the manager and she took my name number and said he would call me the next day.  No call.  Nada.  Service is not a priority here.  If you have 20-30 minutes to waste, then by all means, go ahead and stop in.  Otherwise, find some place that values more than just your $!
author: Dan D.

description: This place may look like a hole in the wall but this may be the best burrito place in the city, no joke. VERY consistently delicious, hot, yummy and quick and easy.  Everything a burrito should be.
author: Michelle K.

description:
a decent burrito, nothing special or unique that stands out, besides location. It is pretty cheap. I had the regular chicken burrito, no complaints. My BF had a torta and he said it was ok as well. 

Not a place i would crave, but if we dont want to drive out into the city, this will suffice. Parking is easy, definitely a plus for the city.
author: Shelley N.

description: Tasty burrito. They have a confusing menu! Now that I've been once, I think future visits will be much easier. FYI all, the "express burrito" is a wet burrito. Also, they don't automatically ask you what kind of beans you want and use refried if you don't specify otherwise.
author: Olivia P.

description: Gets the job done if you're in a dire need for a burrito fix, but not within the geneva/mission area. I've often picked up wrong orders (i don't like beans!), but they're accommodating and will make you a brand new one. I've noticed prices are inconsistent too, but I'm always too hungry to protest.
author: Karen H.

description: I bought a bronco cheese burrito and it was about $5 (includes a $1 tip).  My friend bought an espresso burrito.  It was scary big.  It looked good but I'm pretty sure it would have been 4 meals for me.  She chomped it down like a champ in one sitting!
author: Ashley I.

description:
Carnitas super bronco burrito is amaaazzziinngggg

I eat el burrito at least 3 times a month and its always delicious.

for first timers I will advise to really pay attention to the differences in the burritos, in my opinion there are too many and can get confusing, theres regular burrito, super burrito, bronco burrito and super-bronco burrito all SLIGHTLY different which is kind of strange but its that kind of strange that makes my tummy happy =)
author: Anthony T.

description: Very solid 4 and I'm pretty picky about burrito places. The burrito expresso (wet burrito) is great. The red salsa that comes in the little plastic containers are a must. The perfect amount of spice!
author: Brendan B.

description: I used to come here a lot but after a few bad experiences, I am never going to come back again. The last few times they would forget to give me the extra sour cream and guacamole i was charged for. That's fine maybe they just forgot, but its been happening for a while now. This last experience was the worst. I was in the middle of eating an espresso burrito and i bit on something hard. When I pulled it out, it turned out to be a METAL WIRE. who knows how much of the metal wire I could of already eaten and didn't know. I posted a picture of it next to a penny for comparison. I used to buy burritos from them all the time, I will never go back again.
author: Mazie H.

description: Burrito was bomb. Sauce was okay... and the place was pretty grimey.. No food poisoning tho! :)
author: Rick B.

description:
Oh El Burrito Express.  You always attempt to satisfy my burrito itch, and you always come just this close.

I live only a few short blocks away from the El Burrito.  Sometimes I'll be riding the L home from work and know I have a crisp $20 burning a whole in my pocket and decide to jump off at 26th and get myself a burrito, hey, I deserve it.

Sure it's not the greatest burrito you've ever had.  But I don't mind this so much because El Burrito never claims to do that.  But I do believe you get what you pay for.  i myself enjoy the Super Bronco Burrito with the rollo chicken (trust me, this slightly spiced red pulled chicken is much better than its cha-rbroiled bbq chicken counterpart) .  I'm a rare breed Mexican food lover who hates beans and avocado and sour cream, so those are out.  But load me up with rice and salsa and onions and tomatoes and you have yourself one mighty tasty burrito.

If you have the time and the discipline and are jones-ing for a bomb burrito ... go to The Mission.  But if you want a decent burrito for a fair fare and live out in The Sunset, head over to El Burrito.

It ain't so bad, really.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Great place and they now deliver. We have tried many different burritos here, but my favorite is Veracruz. I was skeptical at first, but it is really tasty. My husband loves the vegetarian special burrito. Call ahead and your order is ready in 15 minutes.
author: Gwenn G.

description: El norcal burrito is my goto, but the the espresso burrito is just good quality and quanity.  Overall, just a good solid place to grab lunch or dinner. Haven't tried their breakfast yet, but they serve it all day, so might give it a try. Free chips with order, and soda with check in makes a great rounded meal for the price.
author: Vicki C.

description: How can I not love this little hole-in-the-wall with the line out the door?  I'm still ordering the super bronco burrito with carne asada.  The best part about this place is that they have deals on their FB page, Twitter, they deliver, and they have Scout Mob coupons.  We were able to get two large burritos for $7 and used their facebook mention that included two free sodas.  Some days they have BOGO offers.  How much cheaper can it get?  Love it!
author: Stacey C.

description:
Regular burritos for under $5
Super burritos for under $6

This little burrito place is actually pretty tiny. There's about 5 bar seats in there for you to dine in there if you like. I prefer to grab a burrito to-go and head over to bf's house and enjoy my big burrito while watching "How I Met Your Mother". 

The ladies that work behind the counter can either work fast or work really slow. Make sure to call in so you won't have to wait in line during lunch hours. I know I've learned my lesson. 

I ordered the regular steak burrito. Boy that thing filled me up good. They don't skimp on the ingredients either. They also offer the tortilla chips I love so much. Not the regular Tostitos Chips but the rectangular thick ones! Yum. Those are the good stuff.
author: Tracy A.

description:
I live only a few blocks from this place and have been going at least three times a month since I've lived here. Best burrito in the Sunset, hands down.
The burritos are great and the salsa is amazing.
author: Shawn B.

description:
I'm a smooth talking debonair lover of burritos, so my taste buds salivated tears of woe to leave the Mission for the Sunset, but have perked up somewhat since discovering El Burrito Express (1).

The first burrito I got from here was delicious, it probably had the fat content of an entire stick of butter, an amazing and absolutely tasty artery workout.  But I'm glad I waited until after burrito 7 to write a review, I've had great experiences here, and bad ones.

I started with the great, it was a chicken burrito and was a Mission-caliber burrito masterpiece.  Now the bad, DO NOT GET carne asada here, it's not good.  Not as in not tasty kind of good, it's literally not good, i.e. spoiled.  Shimmery like the side of a glistening fish in the afternoon light, with beautiful pink and green hues, both times (yes I went back for more, I believe in 2nd chances) the meat was not fresh.

Everything else I've had has been good, the chips are fried on the spot, really bad for you, which means they taste great.  The guacamole is outstanding.  The wet burrito is good.  The carnitas = good.  Grilled chicken here is dry and kind of weird, I will give it another shot but am not excited about when it will be time to put that 2nd effort in.

It's so close to me that I could roll here right out of my front door to theirs without getting too scraped up, so I will be back here very often.
author: Greg J.

description:
Directions:

1.) On a sunlit day-off, put the chilled beverage of your choice in a backpack, along with cloth napkins, cups and a plastic bag and a jar of water and muzzle for the dog.

2.)Get the dog on the leash with a little doggie jacket and walk down to Burrito Express here with a loved one.

2.) one of you go inside while the other waits with the dog.

3.) Order two tamales to go.

4.) Remember to ask for chips and green sauce AND plasticware unless you have some in the backpack, they won't give you ANY of the above unless you ASK.

5.) catch the L Taraval train to the beach with the dog and the perfect tamale picnic!
author: Kimberley M.

description: Fries in a burrito? Are you kidding me? That was hands down the best burrito I had so far in my life. Nor Cal burrito packed with many flavors, it was just delicous. Thats all I'm going to say. If you want a twist to your burrito, go for the NorCal burrito.
author: Reginald W.

description: I've been to many burrito spots in SF...Farolito, Tacqueria Cancun...etc! This is by far the best burrito spot in NOR CAL!!
author: nabil s.

description: This place has been here for years; however, it has gone downhill.  The people working there act as if they are doing you a favor for serving you their "not so good" food. They are never pleasant.....I just hate that.  I ordered two burritos and went to pick them up in 10 minutes.  After searching for a parking spot, I went in and they told me that there is NO CREDIT CARD CHARGES accepted today.....machine was not working.  .So why didn't they tell me over the phone when I placed my order?  They just don't care!  I'm never going there again.  The owner needs to take a good look at her employees and have a good talk  to them about being respectful to customers.  And the food definitely needs to improve!
author: C.R. G.

description: This place is okay to me. The food is alright, I usually order the bronco burritos. But, sometimes the chips they give you are stale. Price is great so I guess the okay food balances out with it's price. The cashier I had today was really nice, however the person who called out numbers today and gave me my food was totally rude. I simply asked if she would like my receipt because it had my number on it and she said, "Bye!". I felt like taking my $1 tip back out of their tip jar.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
Loved the Expresso chicken burrito (a wet burrito with tomato sauce and melted cheese on top, yum!). Lots of flavor and the tomato sauce is nice and thick. The chips are also good!
Prices are cheap, regular burritos are around $4 and up and the Expresso is around $6. Good portions for price and they have huge large selection on their menu. Also they have 3 types of beans (pinto-black-refried) to choose from.
Location is small, there are very few tables to sit at to eat, I'd prefer to go.
Service is also very fast!
author: Miss H K.

description:
El Burrito Express... Probably the best Burrito chain in the city by far. I like alot of the things that are made here (Burritos, Quesadillas, Enchiladas, and  Nachos in particular) The Expresso Burrito they offer is by far the best burrito I've have had in my limited experience eating burritos. 

The location of this place is pretty convenient located sort of in the middle of Sunset. Residential, and businesses. 

The only problem with this El Burrito is that this El Burrito doesn't have alot of room for eat-in only some counter seats. Also, the parking around here is all residential-occupied, sometimes hard to find a space.
author: Ethan T.

description:
Man, love the one on Divisadero and love this one even more! I'm eating the biggest damn steak burrito while writing this and I'm just licking my fingers, chewing, and chomping on it while typing. Super steak burrito, no beans, with cheese and extra sour cream!!!! Who would of thought I can eat a super steak burrito? Well, I can! For less then $7, it's the perfect meal!!!!!


Burritos are the bomb, nachos are amazingly good and FATTY, fruit juices are yummy..... and uhhhh BURRITOS ARE BOMB!!!!
Usually gets packed but only during lunch and dinner hours..
author: Juliane N.

description:
SUPER STEAK BURRITO = DELICIOSO. 

I used to eat these almost every Friday after school before I dance. It's gigantic, juicy & mighty tasty. Ask for extra sourcream cause sometimes they don't put enough or none at all..then it's pretty much perfect.  

Warning: Doesn't accept credit cards. Comes with a food coma, massive burps, and smelly breath...yum.
author: Alexa M.

description: This place is always busy, in the afternoons and after work especially. The burritos are pretty good. This is actually the only burrito place in the whole Parkside area. Around the after the whole place is packed and can find 1 or 2 cars double-parked. In the evenings there are at least 3-4 cars double-parked at this intersection.
author: M C.

description:
Did I say get the wet chicken burrito? 
Get it. 
Its called Chicken Espresso to be exact.
author: Derek C.

description: The food here tastes amazing. I'm not sure I can handle how good the burritos I had here were. Plus, with the Yelp app I was able to get a free soda with my purchase.
author: Jared Y.

description: The only burrito shop in Parkside, but luckily it's great.  I have never been disappointed with anything I've ordered.  Large variety of stuff to order and good prices.
author: Joe F.

description:
I've only been here once but I was served a massive chicken burrito and a pacifico for a very reasonable price.

it was tasty, and i will eat there again. maybe even today.

the only downside is the utter lack of space inside, i got the chance to be very cozy with a few other people while i sloppily downed my burrito.
author: Sara L.

description:
Have been eating here since i was in high school, great neighborhood burrito place, best burrito i've gotten outside of the mission. 

The burritos are huge and awesome, they dont' skimp on the pricier ingredients like avocado and cheese to load the thing up with beans, you always get your money's worth here. 

There are only two drawbacks to this place: there is no seating (ok, there are 5 or 6 stools against the wall. good luck) and they are cash only (last time i checked a couple months ago) 

But if you plan ahead and take-out, this place is where it's at.
author: Geoff G.

description:
Don't know much about Mexican burrito authenticity but I enjoyed mine very much. I ate their regular-sized chicken burrito and, weighing in at a pound, sure got me filled and full fast. If and when I order from this place again, I'm going to ask for less sour cream and more pico de gallo; the texture was just too mushy and needs some crunch. The chips that was included with the order is fresh but needs to be thinner. Their red salsa is HOT--I'd say on par with the dipping sauce served at Indian restaurants. Overall, El Burrito Express' burritos are a greater value than Chipotle Mexican Grill.

One other thing to note: I used their El $5 Burrito coupon (found online) and didn't know I could've gotten their super-sized burritos instead of their regular. Cashier wasn't forthcoming and honest about this and gave the lesser value burrito. Not cool!
author: Cliff W.

description:
there are a lot of much better places with much better burritos. 
prices a little higher than average, food a little worse than average.

customer service -1 out of 5. got charged for a bag which is just paper wrap from liquor stores and burrito which i ordered was unwrapped so my car's leather seats really appreciate that. 

never come back would rather order from grubhub or making myself
author: James M.

description:
OK im gonna compare this to my experience I had with other places.  
1.  super burrito with steak, uneven ingredients.  one bite would be too much cheese while the next is too much meat.  OK if you try the same burrito at La Victoria in San Jose, you will notice the difference.  this place is more expensive than La Victoria.
2. the sauce is so watered down, the red is not even spicy.  La Victoria has their own sauce and OMG, it tastes so good with the sauce.  its not fire hot but the good tasting spiciness.  not trying to advertise La Victoria but I think its 10Xs better than this place. 
3.  I had their shrimp burrito and they only had 4 small shrimps in it, and the rest was sautéed  vegetables and juice.  also uneven 1st few bights was mostly cheese.   Now, Baja Fresh!  they have a shrimp burrito which I believe is called diablo.  every bite you will taste the shrimp and OMG its soo good their.  they have sauce which is good but nothing compared to La Victoria.  Baja Fresh has one of the best shrimp burritos and it puts El Burrito Express to shame.  

All im saying is if I pay $10 for a shrimp burrito, I would like more then 4-5 pieces of small shrimp in it.  I gave this place many chances and it led to disappoint me every time.  there for, this place lost my business.  never coming back here again.
author: Serg L.

description:
BLAND!!!! Everything tastes the same

They need some competition, as they try. I would rather drive to the mission. 

Ordered 5 items and got 2 hot sauces.
author: L T.

description:
If you happen to be in the Parkside/Sunset area and craving for a hearty and tasty burrito, be sure to stop by El Burrito Express!

I've been here many times and have never been disappointed.  They have a wide variety of burritos to choose from, ranging from the typical flour tortilla filled with rice, beans, meat, cheese, guacamole, and fresh pico de gallo, to various vegetarian and seafood combinations.  They also have specialty burritos such as a breakfast burrito, one filled with homemade chile relleno, and another which they call El Macho Burrito which has two giant flour tortillas stuffed with two meats, rice, beans, cheese, guacamole, sour cream, tomato, and onion AND measures over a foot long!

My favorite is the Shredded Chicken El Expresso Burrito, which is served the wet style.  This is just not one of those burritos that is consumed by holding in your hand and slowly peeling away the foil as you chomp away.  No siree!  This huge, delicious work of art needs to be enjoyed on a plate or right out of the food container with a fork and knife!  This burrito is wrapped in a giant flour tortilla and filled with generous amounts of rice, beans, cheese, and your choice of meat.  Topped with guacamole, onions, tomatoes, and cheese, and finally covered with their special expresso sauce that provides just enough kick, this is really a gift from heaven!  I did without the dollop of sour cream to be a little more heart healthy . . . but at this point does it really matter!  This is one plump, tasty burrito that literally measures 10" X 4" and is good for 2-3 meals.  For a little less than $7, what a great bargain!!!

Their chips are also delicious!  Very fresh and crisp, not too salty, and just the right thickness.  You know they're really fresh when you don't have that greasy aftertaste after munching on them.  You can really taste the true corn flavor.

The place is rather small and does not have tables, only a few stools at the counter by the window, so it's best for take out.  It's cash only so be sure to bring enough bills or make a pit stop at the ATM before coming.

When I feel the need to satisfy my burrito craving, I will definitely be back!
author: Karen L.

description: I've been coming here for awhile and their food is ok and reasonably priced, but the service is absolutely terrible! Definitely get what you pay for. The women can be especially rude. I'm still waiting for my food and I'm the only one here! They are not even working on it.... Awful!
author: Tara T.

description:
I've driven by this spot so many times, and each time it is completely packed in there ~ good sign!

Anyhoo.....me and my sisters stopped in yesterday to grab a bite to eat...I got the steak quesadilla which was might delicious AND it was pretty big..I barely finished it!  It was quite tasty and the guacamole inside was yummy.

My sisters each got a burrito and they pretty much finished theirs off...the chile verde sauce they give for free is spicy and on point! The other red sauce is pretty good, too.

I'd hit this place up again!
author: Jade B.

description: El Burrito Express is el go-to Mexican food place in SF. These NorCal burritos give SoCal a run for their money. It's a really tiny place but usually is not too crowded. There is metered parking but I recommend parking in the nearby areas. The pricing is actually really good for the amount of food you get. All in all, this place is the shiznet.
author: Joey I.

description:
Five stars for loyalty and location.  Sure they aren't THE BEST burritos I've had but  as far as convenience, speed, and quality this place is tops.  I love the melted cheese on their super burritos and when I'm feeling saucy I get the expresso burrito which can feed an average person for two days.  Portions are huge, everything is fresh, and being hispanic myself I appreciate the fact that this is NOT ANOTHER EFFIN YUPPIE BURRITO PLACE. No whole wheat tortillas with bastardized undercooked cilantro rice topped with vegan cheese and rubbery free range chicken.  

El Burrito Express keeps they shizzz REAL.  Traditional stewed meats and grilled carnitas, cooked pinto beans, and homemade salsa (which you totally have to ask for cuz they don't hand out to just anyone).  There's nothing more comforting than a giant burrito and some beer... there's no fusion, organic, sustainable, vegan bs that can make up for authenticity. 

And if you absolutely have to stick to the new year's res after reading the omnivore's dilemma or some crap: they have a KILLER tofu burrito.
author: dr S.

description:
Ohhhhhhhhhhh... 

Went here the other day and got the Bronco Super Burrito w/carne asada accompanied w/a side of rice and chips & salsa. It was good going in, but horrible coming out! Needless to say, I was on the porcelain throne for quite some time praying that my intestines wouldn't come out. EBE how could you do this to me?! Ugh!
author: Gary T.

description: Passable burrito if you don't want to travel NW El Playa or NE to Gordo's. The nachos are okay. With the parking hassles, and the long line of folks who firmly believe this is the only place to get a burrito in the Sunset, it just isn't with it.
author: Mosey S.

description:
Bronco steak burrito, no beans.  Definitely wolfed the whole thing down in half a sitting.

Their chips are super crunchy.  Just don't forget to ask for extra salsa (preferably green).

Remember to call ahead and order if you can.  They get really busy during dinner time.

Oh, and cash only!
author: Jenny L.

description: I moved to SF from San Diego a few months ago and have been searching for a good burrito. Yes, I've been to the Mission and tried those places, doesn't compare. El Burrito Express in Parkside/Sunset has the El NorCal Burrito which is basically called a Cali Burrito in San Diego. Carne Asada, Guacamole, Salsa, Cheese and Papas. Yes, a burrito with french fries, get it and never look back. I like this place better than El Farolito or anywhere else in town so far.
author: Michael V.

description:
I'm born and raised in the Sunset, and I know how bad our choice of Mexican can be - example: El Burrito.  

I have to admit, my first burrito was from El Burrito and I used to come here often, until I had a really good burrito!  When I look back on it, I used to feel sick after every time I ate at this place and the line was always long and annoying.  The meats were cheap and the burritos were soggy and gross.  

If you're in the Sunset go to La Playa on Noriega!
author: Justin O.

description:
My friend Whitney used to live right across the street from this place. You could literally see it from her window. 

Best nachos I've ever had. I still dream about them.
author: Joanne D.

description: Love this place nachos and the shrimp torta is my favorite. The ladies that work here are really nice. They remind me of my tia's. Love you guys. I wish they were open now cause this review made me hungry.
author: Mex B.

description:
One of the first taqueria's I've ever been to, this place reminds me of the good old days when I used to go to Kumon back in the 4th grade. 

It gets crowded and sometimes the wait is long, but its always worth it. They even give you a small bag of homemade tortilla chips which is a nice plus. A lot of other places don't. 

The Super Bronco is what I usually get, with steak of course, and I usually substitute the beans for rice. They don't charge you for that which is nice. Yes I know, more carbs? But at least people around me don't have to deal with me tootin' the butthorn.
author: Derrick L.

description:
This place is definitely worth a trip.  It really isn't a place to go and eat a burrito, it's more like a permanently stationed taco truck, get your food and go.

The burritos there are HUGE and filling.  I almost always have left overs that are good for that midnight snack or lunch at work the next day. The Expresso Burrito is my burrito of choice.  Perfectly cooked chicken, the beans perfect, nice warm tortillas, and the guacamole is amazing.

Been eating at this spot since high school and the ownership has to be some of the nicest folks I've come across.  They do it all right here at El Burrito Express 1, just wish it was a little bigger is all. Hence the 4-star rating
author: David M.

description: I'm new to the San Francisco catering world, however my company recently decided to start catering in lunch weekly to the staff and El Burrito Express was first up, we are all SO amazingly pleased with the excellent food! The delivery was prompt, professional and very smooth. And again the food was amazing, we had the taco bar which featured carne asada, grilled chicken, prawns, & carnitas all assortments of tortillas, salsas and the fixings! They worked within our budget and we will be ordering from them again in the future! ;-)
author: Tasha D.

description: Seems just like your standard hole-in-the-wall burrito place but this place is awesome- all fresh ingredients. Closed on Sunday though.
author: Geoff P.

description: After my very first time eating a Super Grilled Steak Meat Burrito last week at EL BURRITO EXPRESS 1 at 1601 Taraval Street @ 26th Ave... After liking EL BURRITO EXPRESS 1 so much, I have decided to come back again on a thursday cloudy afternoon and to try another super sized burrito this time, I went and ate a Super Bronco Grilled Steak Meat Burrito which I requsted black beans instead of the pot beans and also comes with cheese, sliced avocado,onions, and tomatoes...After when, I gobble up the entire Super Bronco Grilled Steak Meat Burrito and it did not disapppoint me at all when the second time I went and ate a super burrito which tasted really really gooooooood... Now that, I have been to El Burrito Express 1 twice, other than eating a super burrito at my other favorite burrito places like Andales, Don Pico's, La Parilia Grill, Los Metates... El Burrito Express 1 is now another of my favorite place to eat a super burrito!!!
author: William B.

description:
I like places like this where you can get a meal for under $5 (you can get a regular burrito with your choice of meat for under $4 and choose a soda, and it will be under $5).  The burritos come with complimentary chips too.  The chips are horrible.

I ordered the regular chicken burrito.  Like Susan Y., I thought the chicken would be grilled.  Instead, it's shredded and stewed in a red sauce.  I prefer grilled chicken because it has that charred taste.  Stewed chicken tends to be too dry (like this one) and makes your burrito too soupy inside.  

Still, it tasted good though it was soupier than I like.  They put some guacamole (not much, but guac is usually an extra at most taquerias) in the regular burrito, which is a nice touch.  It also comes with rice and beans.  

There isn't much seating (no tables, there are some chairs though) and there isn't much room to stand in line (explaining why there is usually a line out the door).  You order at the register.

The other major downside is that they do not have a fresh salsa bar.  You have to ask for containers of salsa.  Their salsas were okay...not much choice there.

They don't have that many choices when it comes to the meat for your regular burrito (stewed chicken, carnitas, steak and maybe something else).  I don't mind that but if you don't offer many choices, you'd better make the ones you have count - it better be the best chicken I've ever had. I'm curious about the grilled meats...they looked good.

They also have some seafood items, tortas, breakfast, and tofu burritos.
author: Lolia S.

description: Excellent burritos (especially Breakfast burritos) at very good prices! Love this place!!
author: Alex G.

description: I would always get a take out burrito from this place right after my tutoring class right across the street.  This place is good enough for me to eat there every Friday after class.
author: Bevan J.

description:
Huge, tasty burritos with everything in and on them for cheap! I recommend the pork verde super burrito. Most burritos come with real guacamole, sour cream, cheese (all the good stuff). And they're big enough for two meals (if you try it in one, you'll be in food coma for at least 4 hours...) .I'm not a fan of the chopped pork, chicken or steak, it can get dry. The chips are good, salty and crunchy. The salsas they offer are kind of weak too, but they'll give you whatever you ask for. Salsas are a thin red one or a thin salsa verde. They'll switch out the types of beans (black, pot, etc.) for no extra charge. From what I can tell they only use white flour tortillas for burritos.

It's awkward ordering and picking up your order because there's a two foot counter space right by the door where it all goes down. And the floor is significantly slanted (down towards the counter). The only seating is some torn, patched with tape, leopard-print barstools along a cracked counter facing outside. The trash receptacle inside is just an open bin. The place does amazing burritos, and does them very well, but lacks ambience or any sense of security while eating. I recommend calling ahead and picking up your food. They have really high ratings from food/restaurant quality checks so no worries about kitchen cleanliness.
author: Diana G.

description: Probably one of the better burrito places in Parkside/Sunset. Their burritos are huge and score a 8/10 on the Hendricks Burrito Flavor Scale ( look it up). That being said, I wasnt impressed with their Bronco Burrito. It seemed to be too much filler, not enough thriller. At any rate, just go with the Grilled Chicken Super Burrito. You wont regret it. And dont forget, CASH ONLY.
author: Ian M.

description:
If you live in the area, the huge PLUS is that you don't have to make the lengthy trek down to the Mission to get a decent and authentic burrito.  Also, their bronco burritos are always reliable.  (Bronco burritos come with full and intact pot beans, and not a squashed, smeared mess of refried beans.)

However, I have three gripes about this place: (1) they only give you one puny plastic container of salsa with your burrito and desert-dry chips, (2) they accept cash only, and (3) you won't get a smile with your service, guaranteed.  But with the amount of business they get, they can get away with it.
author: Passionate E.

description: we have been coming here since it's open ... the should be changed to El Boring Express or El Blah Express ... the menus is is hard to read and they have so much it gets a bit confusing ... the chile relano was overcooked/burnt .... easy enough to check and it before you serve it and no one was in no excuse .. the burrito used was with white chewy cheese not that orange stuff ... beans were on the dry side .... my suggested pair down the menu (you can't be everything for everyone) .. turn the music and chatter down  so that you don't have to raise voices to put in an order .. get back to basic... for what it is it's expensive .. adios my friends
author: Joan F.

description:
eh... marginal.

I was initially very excited to have good food in the Sunset, an area not know for good restaurants.  Sorry.  It's true. I live here.

The burrito is OK definitely not great.  They give you good portions but they charge for every little thing (e.g., 30 cents for this, 40 cents for that).  My key issues are:
1) The food flavors are not unique or high quality.  
2) My food is always lukewarm needing to be microwaved.
3) The flavor is inconsistent. The chicken in my burrito was SUPER salty.
