IF you want cheap eats and don't have a high standard, this is your place.  For me, I'm continuing to seek good food in the Sunset.
author: HapaPower S.

description:
One phrase is actually enough in this review: Best burrito in the Sunset district. 
But, of course, I will write more than that. The best thing in El Burrito Express is gotta be their house wet super burritos. Let it be grilled steak or broiled chicken with sour cream, they are absolutely delicious.
They also come in a very reasonable price, too, around 7 dollars, you get a very satisfying burrito that can't be eaten in one meal!

They can be quite busy during certain rush hours around noon or dinner time around 7pm, so call in advance to avoid waiting in line would be wise. The staff is relatively friendly.
author: Mike S.

description: This place is sooo GOOD! I love the expresso burritos with the cheese and sauce on top~  It's soo filling and tasty.  Pretty decent priced.  Steak is the best! I've tried the taco salads, but can't say I really like them.  The surf n turf burrito is also decent... The expresso burrito clearly deserves 5 ***** if only i can rate solely that! Service is okay, but sometimes they have a hard time understanding your order...  must try if you live near by! orders mostly come with chips n salsa :D
author: Tramy V.

description: I'm a San Mateo native, lived in San Jose for a year SO I have a pretty good idea of what a good burrito joint should be.  I've lived in San Francisco for almost a year and am desperately attempting to find a good burrito place in the sunset.  So far, I've only managed to find La Fonda.  Not only did this place screw up my order, they have mediocre, bland flavors of rice, beans and no regular veggie burrito on their menu....just fancied up crap!  Most ridiculous thing ever.  Overpriced as well and the portion was a rip off.  Never will return.  Two other people with me made "so so" comments to me with regards to their meat orders.  BLAH.  All of you giving it four stars....Clearly they haven't traveled outside of San Francisco??!
author: Maddy B.

description:
These are the best burritos I've ever had.  I love the chile colorado burritos.  Their sauce is right on and the meat is so tender it falls apart.  I live in San Jose, and wish we had one of these close by. 

The best part:  They never ever mess up my special requests!
author: Maria F.

description:
While legend has it that the line-burrito was created in the Mission District, when you can't get yourself across town to sample the city's best, El Burrito is as good an alternative as you will find in the Sunset.

El burrito, situated on the corner of Taravel and 26th Avenue right where the L-Taravel stops, has a small counter that seats around eight people, though most people seem to take the Burritos to go. El Burrito is a Sunset establishment that has been around for at least two decades. A recent visit showed little had changed since my days as a regular back in the early 90s. Its hard to go wrong with its menu of time-tested items--regular Burritos, super Burritos, Bronco Burritos and Expresso Burritos.

Almost all of the burritos are less than six dollars. My personal favorite is the chicken Expresso Burrito. A well proportioned burrito made out of a giant tortilla topped with sauce and cheese and stuffed with chicken, rice, beens, guacamole, tomatoes, onions and possibly a few other things that I'm forgetting. The Expresso Burrito must be eaten with a knife and fork off a plate and cannot be held in the hand. But whether you have the expresso or just a regular burrito you won't be disappointed. Good, cheap, and more than fullfilling, this is one of the best options for food to go on Taravel. 

The restaurant is closed on Sunday.
author: William and Mary C.

description: There's a tacqueria across the street from where I work but I still drove 2 miles just to eat at El Burrito Express.  One of the best in the city.
author: Joe N.

description:
best burritos! their Carnitas are like meat butter! so tender!! & they have tamales!! (only wish they had pork tamales but the chicken ones are good too) 
& now they DELIVER! finally found a good mexican place that delivers to Park Merced! yay :)
author: Lauren S.

description: I'm been coming here since I was in High School. They haven't changed one bit. Friends I've brought there don't seem to enjoy it as much, but there's something about those mushy Carne Asada burritos that makes me keep coming back for more. I always get the same thing, Regular Carne Asada burrito. Keep it simple.
author: Lotus L.

description:
San Francisco is a not a burrito town compared to its Southern California rivals, like San Diego.  The most noticeable deficiency in the local burrito climate is the lack of a proper 'Bertos of any sort.  Yeah, the foodies will tell you about the same old places "hidden" in the Mission, like Tacqueria Cancun for instance, but I think I'm being generous when I describe the average SF greasy burrito as "satisfactory".  

I have yet to find anything in SF that even approaches the twin terrors of Humberto's (fish burrito) and La Campana (shrimp) on opposite corners of 25th and Broadway in San Diego.  El Burrito Express on Taraval is probably the closest I've come.  Like any true burrito dive, unneccessary amenities, like tables, "silver"ware and restrooms have been dispensed with.  So much the better for efficient delivery of the maximum tortilla-to-grease ratio possible.  The cash register sits tightly sandwiched between the entrance and the burrito construction station.  They will usually give you a small bag of chips with your order.  You can buy some sodas by the can or perhaps an aguas fresca to wash it all down.  I like to stick with the basics like carnitas, carne asada or pollo asada.  I usually get the bronco burrito and take it home to eat while I'm watching tv.
author: Gopal R.

description:
Six words: A very good local burrito place.

 I always get the grilled chicken burrito; it is filled with tasty goodness. The chicken has good flavor, the beans aren't boring, the salsa is fresh and the guacamole is chunky (I wish they'd add more). Just the way I like my burrito. However, I did order a quesadilla one time and it was a little greasy; I would suggest only coming here for their burritos. The price is good and the burritos are very filling. The service is pretty fast too; it's probably a good idea to come here before 5:30pm because after that, many people are just getting off work so the line forms out the door. It's up to you if you feel like waiting.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
For an authentic burrito ... in the Sunset ... this is your place.  It's close to home, the portions are huge, flavors are just perfect and the price is cheap!  

I highly recommend the Expresso Burrito (aka: *wet* burrito) .... sour cream chicken - YUM!
author: elaine i.

description:
Yum, mexican food. 

El Burrito is pretty convenient for me. I've only had one thing here, the bronco burrito with steak. I'm not sure if I would get anything else too.  It was huge, yummy and cheap. I like the chips they come with too.

I want one right now.
author: Winnie L.

description: El Burrito is always a good place to get a tasty dinner or lunch fairly quickly. The burritos are mouth watering and everything else is decent. The service is fairly good, the women that work in their work so hard so I will respect them for that. The way I look at it, it's really the best place to get mexican food on this side of town. This place wouldn't stand long in the mission, but that place is a totally different level. I enjoy El Burrito nonetheless and will continue going there for years to come.
author: Aidan F.

description: Really good burritos! Very surprised to find this place in Parkside!
author: p v.

description:
Tiny place, with counter style seating for 6 at best. Usually has a line and a bit of a wait (5 mins or something). The staff isnt really friendly, but not off-putting either. I think they just see so many people each day that they're numb.

The burrito was fine. I've had an inordinate amount of experience with VERY good mexican friend back in Fresno, so it's hard for me to get excited about anything but the best, which this place certainly is not. That said, there is nothing wrong with it, and if I'm nearby I wouldnt hesitate to go here.

All in all, stop by if your close, otherwise you're not missing out.
author: Josh S.

description: No good.....This place is conveniently located near where I work, but I prefer to refrain from eating here. There is so much salt in the food, the burritos, the nachos, basically everything I have ever ordered here, that I feel gross and disgusting after I eat it. The flavor or quality of the food is nothing to rave about so I would rather go elsewhere.
author: Megan S.

description: I've come to believe that everyone thinks their neighborhood burrito joint is the best place in SF.  It's like discovering some no name band and seeing them blow up.  There's a sense of satisfaction knowing that you've been there first. El burrito express is such a place.  Growing up in the Sunset, I loved this place.  Now that I am older, I can say that the Burrito Express is still a darn good burrito jt.  Has more of a home cooking taste compared with Papalote or Pancho Villa.
author: Ellie C.

description: Super carne asada buritto with shrimp is an all time winner in my book. Pricey yes but worth it.
author: Alex S.

description:
El Burrito Express.  Slow down, quicksilver.  Take your time.  What's the hurry?

I'm not saying your express nature forces you to sacrifice quality.  I'm just saying I want to look into your eyes a little bit longer before I hand over my measly amount of money in exchange for your Mexican cornucopias, overflowing with quality.  

Those avocado lips of yours, that carne asada hairdo.  You make me melt like the cheese inside of your own shapeless body.  Let's make out forever.
author: Nathan M.

description:
I've lived in the Parkside neighborhood my entire life and I've eaten many burritos in my time from the Mission to San Jose to Marin (by the way there is NO good burrito place in Marin that I've found, especially around Terra Linda where I work). But the burritos at El Burrito Express are the best and I haven't found any that I like that measures up. 

I always get a regular size steak and the meat is scrumptious. The Expresso, Bronco, and Super Bronco sizes scare me -- they're ginormous but very popular to those that can handle it. They make it perfectly the way I like it with fluffy Spanish rice, refried beans (I find that pinto or black beans makes a burrito soggy because there's always some bean juice that makes it's way into everything), fresh salsa, and guac is included. All for about $4 with chips. Ok, the chips are a little tough and yes, you do have to ask for hot sauce... but you come here for the burritos. Oh, and the regular size keeps well overnight in the fridge and reheats nicely in the microwave the next day (not soggy). Sometimes I'll buy an extra burrito so I can take for lunch the next day since there's nothing good in Marin (if someone suggests High-Tech Burrito to me one more time I will scream...)

Updated 1/11/08:
It appears they've improved their chips, so they're not as "ninja-weaponey" like they used to be. You can actually eat them now and not cut your mouth. Yeah! But still have to ask for hot sauce.
author: Betty L.

description: One of two top spots for burritos in the city. Doesn't look like much on the outside, but the quality ingredients make for a very tasty burrito.
author: Mr M.

description: One of my very favorite burrito places in SF!  It is so inexpensive, too!  They also have the best tortilla chips that are part of each order!  El Burrito Express 2 is the absolute same--expect the same awesome burritos here as well.  Now I have made myself hungry!
author: L H.

description: El Burrito Express needs some competition in this part of the city.  The place has a monopoly on Mexican take-out food and the folks working there know it.  Hence, not a lot of customer service. I went in for a beef burrito and chicken taco dinner the other night.  It took over 20 minutes to get my take-out meal. WTF?  There were only a few of usi in line when I arrived.  I get home and start eating my taco dinner.  There's some beef mixed in with the chicken.  Plus, I was supposed to get two tacos with the dinner.  Instead, I got one which fell apart as soon as I removed the tinfoil wrapping.  I've been going here occasionally for the past nine years but no more.  I'll head t the Mission next time I want Mexican food.
author: Robert B.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of burritos; I have to be in the mood, but if I have a craving El Burrito is the place to go! Usually, someone in my family gets the super burrito or whatever it's called (a little more expensive)...it has tons of sauce and is wrapped with a huge flour tortilla. Yum! Super filling...you probably won't be able to finish it yourself. 

Stick with either the carnitas or steak...both are good...the others I'm afraid to try...tell me if it's good. Oh, and it's usually crowded...so you might have to wait maybe 10 minutes or so...

There isn't "easy" parking...Taraval, as most people know is a street where it's hard to find parking...be prepared to have someone jump out of the car or to circle around the block a few times.
author: Alison N.

description:
A friend of mine and I looked online for a burrito place that was in the neighborhood (we were going to SFSU at the time).  So we trekked on over and figured the long line was a good indication that they had something good to offer locals.

As usual, I ordered the burrito with carnitas (i loves my pork!) and my god, it was soooooo good.  I ate the whole thing.  And believe me, the burrito was big.

Ever since then, for the last 2 1/2 years living out in the Sunset, I'll stop on here for a quick fix of Mexican food ... I'm Mexican after all and you know it's hard to find good suff when you get the best from your Momma!  

Personal favorites are the carnitas (burritos or tacos).  I've also ordered the tamales which aren't too bad since I compare any one I try to my mom's tamales.  I've had them 2-3 times.  I prefer the beef.  They have chicken also, but during prime time hours, especially around dinner time, they'll probably be out, so make note if you really want one, go early.

Everyone I've brought here liked it and my friends are used to having a wide selection of good Mexican food.  

It's worth the trip!  I think they take cash only too.  Parking might be a little tricky, but I ususally don't have to worry since the L-Taraval is my  to and from transportation.

I "heart" El Burrito"!  Makes me feel like I'm at home.
author: imelda j.

description:
Ain't much in the way of burritos clear out here in the Sunset.
Taco Bell doesn't count...

That's why I'm thankful that El Burrito Express exists.
You can get a fat burrito (regular-style or smothered), a bag of homemade tortilla chips, and a great case of heartburn all at one place.

I've had better burritos, but this place gets 4-stars because they're the only game around...
author: Gracie-C Y.

description:
Been comming here for over 4+ years. Not really a great burrito joint. If you want a burrito joint, get them at Mission Dist, NOT SUNSET. It's a good place if you want a quick burrito fix, close to my house, 5 minutes away. 

What I don't like is "NO FREE SALSA," no "Salsa VERDE," Thats minus 2 stars. You gotta have free UNLIMITED salsa for us. How else can an asian freeloader get his veggie fix? 

If you are reading this, instead of hooking me up with a small cup of salsa verde, give me the whole bucket! I need sauce with my food!
author: David L.

description:
Food is good, and practically the only tacqueria anywhere in the Sunset area, except Taco Hell. I've had better, but also a lot worse. 

The (3) stars results in their prices. For the price, you should get a lot more - specifically their Specialty burritos. 

Mare sure you know what you want to order, or they have a tendency to up-sell you.  They end up giving you the same thing you could have gotten for a buck or so cheaper.
author: Carrie S.

description:
One of my favorite Taqueria's.  Growing up in this neighborhood, I know I took it for granted but this is actually one place I'll drive to just to get a burrito.  That doesn't happen too often.  But they actually have another one on Divisadero which is now more in my neck of the woods so if I choose to go there, it's all the same.  

When I was younger and more like a broke ass high school student, I would elect for the Bronco Burrito but nowadays, I just can't avoid the Expresso Burritos.  I go here, I wait in line and I order Expresso Burritos.  Same old routine everytime I come here.  When I have kids, I will certainly pass on this tradition to them and make sure they do not take it for granted like I did as a child.  Too Much Deep Thinking you say.  Maybe, but I do take my burritos seriously...
author: Mark W.

description: Yowza!!  For the month of Feb, to celebrate EBX's 20th anniversary, BOGO specials!!!!!  "Like" EBX on FB like I did for updates!!
author: Mel T.

description:
Alright place. Food was okay, but not the greatest. I did like their variety on their menu though. It is a good burrito fix if you need it.

Btw it is a small place so I recommend to take it to go.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
The Mexican gem of the Parkside district. I do the steak Super Bronco and it's that much better with the sauce on top. Yes, it's a little ridiculous, and yes, I can never finish it. I almost always pick it up and take it home. Don't forget to ask for hot sauce!

Surely, the best Mexican in the area.
author: Dave C.

description:
Hot like a Sahara desert.  That is how I like my burritos.  However, you have to ask for salsa here.  When you do ask you get one mini container, AND if you ask for 3 (yep, i like hot stuff!) they give you a dirty look.  I think Mexican joints should always have salsa bars.  Hot stuff!

Upsides: This place has great veggie burritos for a really good price ($5.50).  TRY THE FRESH MIX BURRITOS...yummy!
author: Lisa L.

description: I really wanted to give them a four but had to opt for 3  because something was missing and I think I'll find it when I go back cause you know I will.  I had their regular steak burrito which turns out to be the size of a brick and is served wet.  I am a sauceaholic but even I thought they added too much sauce-drowned the burrito.  The rice tasted a bit old but the steak warm and tasty.  I want to go back and order without sauce.  Great salsa and free chips!  yipeee!  Can't stand when Mexican places CHARGE for chips... no bueno!
author: Mary Y.

description: Line is out the door, and now I know why!  Super good buritos at a super low price!  They even come with chips!  I had the bronco burrito, and it has avocado included!  sooo yummy, and the tortilla was so soft and chewy, i loved it!  I would totally go back!
author: adrienne l.

description:
OMG you have to try the Expresso burritos "wet burrito"!  (~$6)  I like both the chicken or steak.  Its a huge burrito smothered in enchilada sauce and topped with sour cream.  Oh SOOO gOOOd!!  

Although I could never finish it in one sitting, it makes great leftovers!!

I think the regular burritos (bronco, etc) are not as good as gordos. Stick with the expresso!!
author: Serena H.

description:
This place is really a diamond in the rough.  Super duper good (what ever duper means).  The key here is that their burritos have great FLAVOR.  Burritos are a dime a dozen...every lunch truck and taco shack in creation can make a burrito, but actual GOOD burritos can be quite evasive.  

So many burritos are dry and bland, like just a bunch of mush stuffed in a tortilla, or extremely grisly fatty meats, or proportions way off, etc.

But burrito express solves all of those common shortcomings.  I get everything from a chicken/rice/cheese, to the expresso wet burrito with red snapper, to a normal bean/rice/cheese....and they are always fantastic.

True, they are all business and the huge women slopping your burrito together can probably beat you at arm wrestling and have likely devoured many small children in their day, not to mention the wind gusting through the front door feels like you are standing in the eye of a tornado....but I don't go there for the atmosphere, I go for the food.  And for that, they are top notch.
author: Brian N.

description:
I almost gave this place a 4 star rating because I was influenced by the other insipid negative ratings here (a few were legit but I chalk those off to "you can't win 'em all")...
I'm from South of the Border and this place rocks... They have a Macho Burrito with all the works which is basically 2.5 to 3 burritos... I found the meats (carne asada and carnitas) uber-tasty... 
As to the other reviews complaining of decor and what not I can only quote my Landlord "This isn't the Four Seasons, you know..."
Seriously, 10 bucks for 2.5-3 burritos and, hey, if you speak Spanish they actually open up to ya!
author: Raul L.

description: Quick, cheap, & really good!
author: Ian P.

description: Taqueria in the Sunset/Parkside? Could it really be that good? YES and YES! Bronco Burritto with shredded chicken is the bomb.com! Taco salad is huge and needs to be shared. Cheap, high quality, tasty mexican food in the nieghbrohood, can't get better than that.  I'd still go to the Mission for my fix on most other Mexican dishes but when it comes to the a simple burritto that I'm craving and I don't want to have to make the trek to the Mission, EBX is the spot!
author: Marie B.

description: I've only been here once and had a burrito since people were talking it up both on here and according to some friends of mine who live in the area. The burritos were o.k. but nothing special. There are much better establishments in the Mission and throughout the Bay Area.
author: Rod M.

description: Truly delicious!  Do the bronco burrito, chicken or steak and you will be pleased.  Guacamole is just okay.
author: Dimitri S.

description: This place is close to my house and is about the only mexican restaurant around, so we go there from time to time.  We were never impressed with the burritos. Their salsa is mainly red hot pepper without any fresh tomato like most other places. The burritos do not taste very good. But Today we got the worst burritos ever from here.  We ordered carne asada. We could only fine 3 little piece of meat in the entire burrito.  It was not wrapped tightly either. They did not even taste good.  We will never go back....
author: Dorothy L.

description: So I've been doing some exploring in our new neighborhood, and EBX has come up to be a popular hit! At first I thought... Ok, it's another burrito place. I was so wrong, and I see why it's so popular. Bf also said that each time he's went in, it was packed with people. So I'll be honest...I haven't actually been inside EBX. Bf has always gotten food to go since we're just a short walking distance away. Omg, in less than a month, we've probably gotten take out from them at least four times! Crazy right? Their food is so addictingly (I know it's not a real word) good! I absolutely Love their guacamole. It's rich, chunky with flavor, and it has a great combination of tomatoes and seasonings. I've never loved guacamole since Maya closed down on 2nd Street, but EBX has come very close to match them with their guacamole. I've tried tostadas (once with shrimp and another with carne asada) and unlike other taquerias, EBX provides two plate fulls of food. The tostada itself comes in one plate, and the beans, rice and slaw in another. I feast on such a small order. On one occasion, bf ordered the chile relleno on top of his enchilada order. We were so shocked to see how huge the chile relleno was. It was a meal in itself. I've also gotten their super burrito, which is a yummy, wet goodness wrapped in a large tortilla, covered in red sauce and topped with melted cheese. Talk about instant food coma! Another thing to note is how large their portions are for the price. It's such a steal. I haven't had this good of taqueria food in a long time, but I'm happy that we found it!
author: Marie T.

description:
The marinated tofu burrito was more delicious than expected: the tofu cubes were nice and firm, and absorbed the surrounding flavors well.   

It would be better if they took credit cards.
author: angela n.

description:
From what I've had to eat so far in San Francisco EBX has topped my list of the best burrito in town! I won't sit here and say I am a connoisseur of the burrito by any means, but I am very picky when it comes to ratios of meat, cheese, beans, rice, and any other ingredients wrapped in the soft tortilla. There seems to be a perfect mix of everything within the EBX burrito and that is what I love most about it.

There is no real service to speak of so it's hard to review that aspect, but the workers at the counter are helpful and friendly. I try to order in spanish and always get snickered at, but they appreciate my effort and I have learned a lot of spanish just joking around with them. 

There one bad point, which in many opinions should cost them a star, is the size of the place. It is tiny with almost no seating which makes it all take-out, but I honestly don't mind. If I wanted to have a sit-down mexican dinner I wouldn't be going to EBX. The ingredients are fresh, crisp, clean, and cooked to near perfection for a fast service cali/mexican place.

Anytime I'm in the mood for a burrito I will be going to EBX, best burrito in town no doubt about it.
author: Chip W.

description: I really wanted to like this place.  The prices are cheap and now that I live in the Sunset I was hoping not to have to travel to the Mission for a good carne asada burrito.  The carne asada was way too salty. Reminded me of how I feel after eating food laced with MSG. Taqueria Cancun has a better carne asada burrio.
author: C t.

description:
Service is good, Prices are fine. Food is bad.
The only reason I occasionally eat here is that its the only burrito place around.
Not fresh at all.
author: Judith F.

description:
Went back here on a hot, sunny day & seriously, I can't believe I had almost forgotten how good these burritos were. 

Great price. Great size. Steak burritos.

Could do with a little more sour cream though. & ask for hot sauce if you want it! 

Oh yeah, don't forget to get a mango jarrito. Perfect drink to chug down your burrito with.
author: Steph W.

description:
At El Burrito Express, $3 gets you a BIG BOY TAMALE!!!! I'd say my chicken tamale weighed around 1 lb all by itself! Generous size aside, it was also tasty! They smothered it with reddish-brown tamale sauce (sorry, don't know the technical name) and melted cheese on top of it. I  had bought two thinking, "No way will a $3 tamale fill me up." Now I know better! I saved my second tamale for dinner and even then, I could barely finish it! ($6 very well-spent)  All orders come with a sandwich bag filled to the brim with tortilla chips that are fried up on the premises, served with your choice of homemade red or green salsa. Yum!

I can't wait to go back and try the 4 dozen other things on the menu. You can get just about anything you want here!

Not that I could eat here every day....I'd weigh 200 lbs like just about everyone else who was lined up out the door at noon today.  We got there at 11:40am, and there was already a line out the door! So be prepared for a wait. This is a popular spot, and for good reason.  And oh yeah, there is NO SEATING. It's purely a take-out place, although they do provide a handful of stools for seating while you wait. 

Cheap, yummy, filling. Can't get better than that.
author: SfMom O.

description:
Don't tell anyone, but I'm not as in love with this place as everyone else.  
It doesn't even come close to my burritos in San Diego.

Whew, now that that is off my chest, I do like this place alot, if I'm not mentally comparing it to any taco shop in SoCal.  

It's close to my house, so that is great, it's cheap, even when there is a line it's pretty fast in and out and the food is good for SF burritos.  I admit I always order the wrong thing, the 4 times I've been here, and the people I'm with, always get the better item, so I end up eating half their meal.  

But the burritos are gi-normous, they are generous with the chips and salsa, and it fills you up and tastes yummy!  

One of my favorites in SF.
author: Denise B.

description: I don't understand the reason for the long lines here. I've lived in the sunset/parkside my whole life and I still venture out to Gordo's on Irving or to the Mission for a good burrito. I've been to El Burrito Express twice (the first time I believe in 2003 and the second time was in 2008) because I normally like to give a place a second chance before deciding whether I like it or not. I have only tried their burritos, so maybe there are other items on the menu that are decent, but the burritos do not meet my expectations. The meat was too salty and the rice was too dry. The beans were the only good thing about the burrito. The only reason this place may have the "best burritos on the block" is because this is the only burrito place on all of Taraval, aside from Taco Bell, of course. You are better off going to Gordo's (one location on 9th and Irving, another on Clement and 25th, and the other somewhere on Geary); or there is the Mission with plenty of places that have way better burritos. Don't let the line fool you.
author: Lauren D.

description: My burrito here was freaking delicious. I ordered the Express Burrito with carnitas. Absolutely awesome! The carnitas was moist and incredibly flavorful. The burrito was massive and came with rice, beans, salsa, guacamole, mixed cheese, and toped with a tomato sauce and more melted cheese. I don't know if this is the best burrito I have ever had, but its definitely up there!
author: David D.

description:
The burrito is ok. I don't think its anything unique. I've had really tasty burritos by the mission, and would like to conclude that el burrito is just bland compared to a real burrito.

However, being that its in the middle of Taraval St., I'll cut it some slack and rate it a three star out of five.
author: Andrew W.

description:
The lone burrito joint of the West.

They don't take credit cards :(

They are FAST, but -tiny-.

I had a chicken burrito once, and the chicken was pretty gross.  I was impressed with the size of the burrito, though!  I think I'll go back to get a veggie burrito.
author: Alex F.

description:
Well, if you're looking for a quick bite and in the mood for burritos this might be a good choice if you're in the area.  
Located on Taraval makes it convienent for students and residents nearby.  There is always a line so it must be popular.
I just wish they were a little bigger like the ones I get in the Mission.
author: Eric Y.

description: When in the mood for great burritos, this is the place. Be ready to wait in line either during lunch or dinner time. Come in, order Super bronco burrito (with sliced avocado), and take it home or to the beach. This is not a sit-down place, but you'll love the food.
author: Rupert W.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid.  One of the better burrito joints in SF.  I would've gave this a 5 star, but I couldn't because the free chips are nasty.... It's thick, too crunchy, and sometimes it taste stale/old.  I always tell them no chips for me!

But the burrito is fabulous!!!!
author: Steven T.

description: Love it. Completely random Burrito joint on Taraval. Got sick of Safeway's sandwhiches and Senior's pizza so decided to give this a try. Totally recommend it.
author: Tania C.

description: The Norcal Burrito (version of the california burrito in SD) -- It's a good burrito, but comes nothing close to the SD burrito. They do put french fries in it, but they don't stuff the burrito with them and they get so soggy by the time you eat it. Overall it doesn't taste like french fries are in it, but nonetheless it's a really good burrito still. Total came out to be  $7.14 which is pricey, but it's an unusual burrito for up here so I understand the price.
author: Arnold N.

description: Yum. Love the chicken espresso burrito. Love the homemade chips which are always included with your meal. Surf and turf burrito is delicious. Nachos are bomb. I miss going here!
author: Kelly s.

description:
No, these are not Mission-caliber burritos.  But sometimes I just don't feel like driving all the way out to the Mission for Mexican food.  Bottom line: if you live in the area and order the right thing, El Burrito Express will satisfy and keep you coming back for more.  

The restaurant is aptly named, for despite the almost constant out-the-door line, food is made very quickly; I'm usually back to my car with burrito in hand before even five minutes have gone by.

My problem with this place is that their specialty offerings, which I was initially very excited about due to my affinity for seafood burritos, just aren't very good.  The ones I've tried--Cancun, Veracruz, and Surf 'n' Turf--either seriously lack flavor or combine flavors that don't complement each other well.

I am, however, a huge fan of their simpler (and cheaper) burritos.  The Super and Bronco varieties blend all the basics--whole pinto beans, rice, gucamole, onions, tomatoes, cheese and your choice of meat--into something that's delicious, filling, and very affordable.

So, forget about ordering the fancy stuff, leave the big bills at home, and enjoy what is something of a rarity in Parkside: decent Mexican food.
author: Karin H.

description: The burritos are great. They have a ton of meat and taste good. They dont have that old cheap lard flavor you sometimes get at other places. The fact they now deliver is even better, it makes the parking issues a non issue.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
I don't know what happen to this place. The very first time I came here it was all GOOD! Big Burrito, juicy, lots of filling, great quality of meat. Well, I stop coming to this place for sometime now and El Faro in South San Francisco took it's place. I will tell you why.

First of all, I use to come here often cause it's cheap, great burrito, GIGANTIC FILLING, and close to where I work ( convenience ). I always pick-up the same stuff after work 4 Steak Burrito Express w/black-eyed beans with everything:  extra cheese, guacamole, and sour cream,That's the routine. I use to come here like at least once a week or once every two weeks  (everytime the cravings starts "kicking in" ). That's Our Dinner.  My family used to LOVE their Burrrito - ( the first time ) but after a while of coming here, Things have changed in a bad way.

- First, there's more Tortilla your eating rather than the meat,rice, beans, guacamole, cheese, or sour cream. If You LOVE eating PLAIN TORTILLA  then, this Burrito is for you. 
- Second, The Steak in the Burrito are very tough and chewy and it seems like I wasn't given the best Quality meat - given that it's called "Grilled Steak Meat."
- Third, I always Gladly "PAY EXTRA" for guacomole, beans, cheese, and sour cream. BUT the thing is it  doesn't even show and taste like I PAID EXTRA for this. I might as well not pay extra cause it doesn't show and doesn't taste like I did.
- Fourth, is I noticed ( this happened like 4 X or even more around 4:45 pm)  that everytime I ordered my 4 Burritos,and when they finished making the Burritos. The  Two Ladies that would be making it would sit down right away - scoop some of the food that they are selling like rice, beans or meat etc. etc. in their own plate then sit down in the corner and eat away???? Now, these makes me think, Is these the reason they are giving me less FILLING in my Burrito??? Saving The Best Part of Meat and my Extra Cheese, Gucamole, Rice, Beans, and Best Kind of Meat in their "OWN PLATE" 

Every-one has the right to take a Break and Eat. And I am sure  those Ladies deserve them. But it just makes me think about these all the time. After I get home and we started eating and my Family is so Disappointed in the Quality of food like the Meat - dry, chewy and tough, Less: Rice, Beans, Guacamole, Cheese and Sour Cream   (while I even "PAID EXTRA FOR THIS" ). It got so bad that my family "MADE ME PROMISED" not to come there anymore cause it's not worth it. Which I never did anymore. I gave this place so many chances cause I thought of the very first time I tasted their Burrito would come back and not just be a memory of THAT WAS THEN AND THIS IS "NOW" Kind of Thing.

I don't know what happen, maybe I was ordering too much like 4 Burritos with everything,  at once??? The employees  are trying to save some FILLINGS for the other Customers - so it will last the whole day???? I don't know what happen?? But all I can say is that I can still remember the first time I tasted their Burrito, that was SWeeeetttt!!! But compare to NOW it just leaves a SOUR TASTE IN MY MOUTH FILLED only with PLAIN Tortilla of course!
author: myra a.

description: Best burrito I've had in the city so far, and so close to my house! I love this place, its super cheap, you get chips and salsa with your burritos and its just plain GOOD. I usually get a cheese burrito with sour cream, no guacamole. It comes fairly quickly and nice and hot. Do beware tough, they put random, overcooked vegetables in their rice. I don't like random, mushy veggies in my burrito. But, they do deliver, always a plus! I've never had my food delivered, so I can't comment on how that is. The lady that runs the register can be a little un-friendly too. Never rude, but I've never gotten a smile or a "thank-you" from her. But, its just burritos, whatev.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I really like the food here.  There isn't really much in terms of a place to sit inside, so you'd want to take your order to go.  The burritos are super tasty, especially when you get them express style (sauce over the top).  The entree also comes with chips, which is nice.  The hot sauce options aren't to my taste though.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I've yet to try any of the meat items and have only tried the fish and veggie ones.  They're okay. The fish fajita tacos were a bit bland in flavor and the veggie burritoes needed more filling and more cheese.  The burritos came with two packs of tortilla chips, but there was no salsa!  Do you actually have to pay for the salsa? or did they forget?

I read on sfgate that this place is on par with the mission taquerias, but since i'm not partial to any taquerias in the mission, i can't really say if this place is on par or or not.  My favorite is still Nick's Crispy Tacos, or to be exact, their crispy pescado tacos.  

Burrito Express is really popular among the students at lincoln high school.  It also gets a smattering of office workers coming by to pick up lunch. This place gets a line out the door at times.  Parking is easy.

2.5 stars
author: Animal K.

description:
I've been going here for a while now.  I like this place -- we spent about $14 yesterday on two burritos -- one steak and one carnitas.  Their super burrito price was lik e$5.75, plus some cents for cheese and some more for sour cream.  A super burrito is big enough to get you two meals.

The burritos were good!  Creamy and juicy.  Not dry like some other places.  I wish it was a bit spicier.  I like my food to be hot enough to make me sweat.  We usually ask for more sauces.  I was drooling a bit yesterday as I was waiting for my fiance to bring back the food.  SOOO GOOD!  And we usually take our food to go because the shop doesn't have a lot of sitting space.
author: Joyce L.

description: Great burritos. Chips are homemade.. sorta. They just fry storebought tortillas. I recommend the steak super bronco burrito. It's very filling and guacamole does not cost extra, like Chipotle. Chips come with your burrito and salsa is also free. Unlike Chipotle, once again. Can get crowded during lunchtime. Especially during the school year when you get runover by all the kiddos from Lincoln High School.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Can you handle lard? If you can, this is THE place for you.

The burritos are delicious and really cheap. I've never felt as full for $6.

My favorite is the Carnitas Super Bronco Burrito. The pork is incredibly juicy and flavorful. The Expresso Burrito is also godly if you can handle the wet enchilada sauce ladled over everything. Def. not the thing to order if you've had a large lunch. 

The chicken is hit-or-miss. The Creole chicken is usually a safer bet, but sometimes the grilled chicken is great. I have, however, had the rare experience of biting into that disgusting part of the chicken fat that ruins the whole burrito because for the rest of the meal you unconsciously wince with each bite.

The restaurant itself is cramped and small, especially around lunchtime. This is one of the few reasons I can't give this place 5 stars: its never a really good idea to eat in. The wind hits the windows so hard they sometimes bubble in. 

All in all, this is a wonderful, authentic taqueria that can cater to a wide range of culinary desires.
author: Sam K.

description:
I hate to be a snob about this one, but anything more than two stars for El Burrito express is an exaggeration bordering on the ridiculous.  Although burrito joints are a rare occurrence out in Parkside, there are plenty of great options for eating on Taraval.  
The core elements of the ideal burrito all come up short at EBE.  Oddly enough, this place always has a long line at lunch.  I can confidently suggest that this makes it an excellent candidate for the "gets rave reviews only for having a big line out front" category.  It's just because it's the only burrito place around!
author: Mr. G.

description:
Mmmm...el bu, how I love your tender burrito, bursting with just the right balance of meat, beans, avocado and salsa. 

For those who think you can only get a good burrito in the Mission, try El Burrito and you'll change your tune, and fast.

1 Star off for the war I have to wage each and every time I go in there for extra hot sauce. You would think it was made from gold the way they reluctantly hand you just ONE extra container. And don't think I was fooled by the the extra 2 you gave me last time, ladies - I know those new conatiners are WAY smaller than the old ones...
author: Michelle C.

description: Cancun burrito for lunch....yummy, and I'm already thinking about it. A busy day at work can do that to a person, but going to visit the Divisadero Street location for my lunch fix today. Can't wait. Is is lunch time yet????
author: Maria M.

description: Tried the Giants inspired mega burrito with sweet potato fries...and it was awesome!
author: Desmo K.

description: I used to like burritos. But over the past ten years, I have just not been a fan. Therefore, I have become quite the quesadilla connoisseur. EBX has a great shredded chicken quesadilla that is huge and with all the fixins, cheaper than a burrito. I love this place and would always consider it for a quick meal if I'm in the Mexican mood
author: David G.

description: Pretty good burritos and tacos for the price. Tried their steak bronco burrito (liked the slices of avocado) and the carnitas pork tacos (the onions and tomatoes gave it a nice fresh taste). You get pretty full for under $10. My friend got their signature burrito (wet with sauce and cheese on top). So delicious that I'm going back to order it for myself.
author: Michael N.

description: I love this place. Even my dad who is supremely picky about food loves this place. I always get a shredded chicken burrito with hot sauce and extra pico de gallo. It's big enough to last me two meals p: The chips are so good I could (and do) eat them plain, but they are nice and sturdy if I eat them with salsa. I've been getting my burrito fix here for at least 10 years ^_^
author: Skye L.

description:
i dunno whats with all the good reviews on this place.

its only suitable if you just jumped off the train...forgot to eat at all, all day...have 7 plus dollars to spend on anything thats worth 5 -6 dollars down at the mission.... and want to be disappointed 4 out of 5 times.

sure they will make you think they have good food once in a while....but on the whole.... this place is just not worth it
author: Jimmy A.

description: I've been here on a few occasions. I like the food but two out of the dozen times I came here I ended up with food poisoning. I know its from here too because its the only food I had those days. Otherwise the food is alright.
author: W W.

description:
First timer here.  Tried their Expresso Burrito (carnitas) aka Wet Burrito.

Pretty tasty!   Can't say much for now, but it hit the spot. 

If or when I go back and try a different burrito, I'll write again... 

but, til next time, I might be sticking to El Farolito.  They accept credit card and give free chips and unlimited salsa.  

The CON for Burrito Express is THEY DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARD, despite what it may say from other reviews.

peace
author: Samurai J.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy, I've got El Burrito in my tummy!

I've been coming here for about 15 years now and it always hits the spot.  The think the carnitas are the best but I still get the carne asada in my burritos to mix it up.  If they grilled up the beef on the spot on some places I might get that more often.  The ran into a rough patch about 1 year ago, I'm sure you regulars will know where it looked like their regular staff disappeared.  The burritos were poorly wrapped and the food quality dropped a bit.  The  regular staff is back and all is 
well again.

There is a macho burrito that I have yet to try, but one day...
author: Alex W.

description:
This is a solid taqueria. When all I want is a burrito, this place will suffice. However, with all the great taquerias in SF, this place is hard to get excited about.
Had I eaten this food in Spokane, it would be different.
author: Travis H.

description: Convenient place in the sunset district for a sub par burrito. Burritos are mediocre for the expensive price. service is poor, if your food is ready sometimes you will be waiting 20 minutes for the ready food because the workers wont tell you when your food is ready. If you get anything other than a basic burrito you will be disappointed. On the plus side, your food is ready quite fast
author: Dan S.

description: This place stands out if for no other reason than the lack of burrito places in the immediate vicinity. It isn't great, but if you really want Mexican food and don't have the motivation to leave the outer sunset then have at it.
author: Nate S.

description: Their pork tacos are soooo good. The meat is tender and they don't skimp on the portions either! Although I ordered 2 tacos, I had to split transfer some of the meat to unto the second tortilla.
author: Erin M.

description: I think the service this place offers is great. They always have a huge smile on there face when they greet you. They make you feel like family. The food is some of San Francisco's best burritos and tacos. Try their north cal! Tell them to crisp the tortilla for you. It makes it ten times better. If your a fan of pinto beans try a bronco burrito. (Super bronco if your feeling like a fat a$*) my personal favorite isn't on the menu. (Flour quesidia with guacamole tomatoes avacado grill chicken sour cream pinto beans and a little hot sauce) yum!! They make the own tortilla chips. So good. Try there guacamole and chips. They take food orders by phone too!!!! Plus they deliver in the sunset! Totally awesome. Give them a try if your ever in the mood for Mexican food. They never disapoint.
author: Richie O.

description: The burritos are really good and the price is cheap. Not a very pretty restaurant though.
author: Eric P.

description: California burrito (carne asada, french fries and other bueno stuff) not on the menu but they make it and it's killer. Get it. Pants busting delicious, fatty mexican, goodness. Damn I wish they delivered to my neighborhood; my skinny jeans are happy they don't.
author: lisa g.

description:
First-timer and got to say I really got a lot of food for under $6 ($5.75 to be exact).

Had the Chili Relleno burritto just becuase it sounded so odd. Next time, will upgrade to one of the Bronco Burritto since the only thing that I thought was missing was some sauce...maybe green?
author: Oscar V.

description:
This place is FAST. The burritos are huge, filling, and oh so delicious. 
A++++
author: Eric C.

description: Burritos are good. They're pretty huge, and they come with free tortilla chips. The cashier was hard to understand, so I caught myself asking her to repeat a lot of things. Really small place, only has about six seats along the windows.
author: Tee C.

description: The super bronco steak burrito with red salsa makes my taste buds orgasm.  I went to U of Arizona in Tucson, Arizona (Tucson is basically a Mexican border town) and know Mexican food pretty well.  The steak is made on a grill and not too oily. Tortilla, seasonings, avocado, beans mesh perfectly with the spicy red salsa.  Tortilla chips are made there and are much harder than store brands and taste more authentic.  Only takes cash.. super bronco only costs 6.30 and is worth every penny.  I don't find the staff to be super friendly or helpful but the burritos make up for it.. Highly recommend this place.
author: Mike L.

description:
had to subtract 2 stars.. dont get me wrong this is still a cool place but service means alot.. the delivery guy is also the english speaking guy has been consistantly late the last 3 times..sometimes they claim to start delivering at 5pm sumtime 6 sumtime 630.. if u advertise delevey it should be consistant, otherwise take t off the website -1 star.. tonight when i  called and placed my order,  i asked for a few items and added a sprite to complete my $10 min.. the woman kept sayig i didnt have enough which was odd bcuz i was looking at the menue and added it up before i called... i asked her to repeat my order, she repeated everything but the sprite.. i reminded her the sprite, she insisted it wasnt enough... i added a taco and asked her again to repeat the order, again she did not say sprite... again  asked her to add a sprite.. her response was to repeat my order minus the sprite.. i cut her off and asked if she added the sprite yes or no, she began to repeat the order.. i cut her off and asked if she added the soda.. she stopped n said oh u want a drink?  GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR! yes please a sprite.. she says rudly we no have only coke orange n 7up. 7 up being sprite in a different can.. so i asked for the total.. she tried to tell me it was to busy to add it up! and 45 minutes wait bcuz the delivery boy wasnt in yet.. at 6:45pm.. WTF!!! F.uck f.uck muther muther f.uck f.uck f.uck f.uck muther muther f.uck.. who smoke the dope? she smokes the dope!!!!! temped to say screw u buddy, but my stomach took over. so i wait. - 1 very big star..

3 stars for good food and delievery.. they can have a star back when they do sum revamping in the service department..

also delivery dude! ur cool beans man but are u always late or do they just blaime u wen i call?
author: Marcella P.

description: Service is fast depending on what time you go. During lunch it gets pretty crowded. I've had a steak burrito and a grilled chicken burrito. Both are good but their burritos seem a little smaller than they use to be.  The super nachos are bomb.  If you go here a lot, ask for a stamp card. They don't advertise them but if you ask for one they'll give it to you. If you get 9 stamps you can get any size burrito with anything you want in it.
author: Danielle F.

description:
The best burritos in the area.  I live a few blocks from La Playa Taqueria, but that place is horrible.  Beach Burrito isn't much better.  Both cost more than El Burrito Express.  Gordo's is good, but further away.  Chipotle in West Lake...too far away and not very good.  

El Burrito Express is not the best burrito I've had, but it's up there and glad they're in the area.  Guacamole doesn't cost extra either like almost every other place I've been.  Oh and free chips!  They don't charge $1-2 for them like many other places.  Love that tomatillo salsa.

The Norcal burrito is pretty good, but really filling.  That's like 2 meals for me.  It has carne asada and fries inside and I haven't had anything similar since I moved from Socal.

The lines can get quite long so it's may be wise to call ahead for pickup.  I haven't tried delivery service yet.  During peak times, the wait could be 15 minutes.

Pro-tip: they have frequent buyer cards.  Buy 9 burritos get one free.  I wish I found out about this sooner.  I would have probably 3 free burritos by now.  I only found out about the free burrito card when I asked for their business card.

The chips are fried on site -- I've seen them make them in the fryer so I don't know why one commenter said they were expired. 

Bad thing is that they're closed at 9 pm and only take cash.  I suppose cash only helps them keep costs down.
author: James Y.

description: Hot diggity-dog. This may very well be one of the best burritos I've ever had.  Which is saying a lot, given where I'm from and how many burritos I've eaten in my lifetime.  I hardly ever come out to the sunset to grab a bite but this place may just change that!  I ordered the bronco burrito with shredded chicken, black beans & sour cream.  I will be back. Tomorrow.
author: Traci E.

description: This place was small, crowded, busy, loud and slow. I'd had a very long day and most likely was being a little sensitive, I was annoyed that 3-4 people who ordered after us were being served before us. The food was ok, certainly not worth the trek into the city. Guacamole was pretty decent, I had the Expresso Burrito and it was HUGE. My BF had a seafood burrito and he didn't eat more than a 1/3 of it. He's pretty picky though. We prob won't be making a second trip back here.
author: Heidi S.

description: Best burrito in the sunset. Get the wet burrito or hard tacos.
author: Megan F.

description: I can sum up El Burrito Express in four words: Their cheese is orange.
author: Val P.

description: The price is good and the food is OK.  The service is avearge for a fast food place.  Come here if you want something fast and affordable.
author: jason c.

description: Well above average burrito shop, with friendly staff, delicious food & drinks (horchada and those neon Mexican sodas), and they deliver.  Carnitas are dripping with flavor, everything is prepared fresh (duh), and a nice atmosphere.
author: Chad M.

description: A damn good burrito for a decent price. The service was a bit slow though.
author: Thomas C.

description: Hands down my favorite burrito place in SF.  I usually order the Chili Colorado burrito with sour cream and guacamole.  The only complaints I have is that they kind of skimp on the chips and they only take cash.  Other than that they are cheap, fast and the food tastes awesome.  I haven't used the service yet, but I know they started delivering awhile ago--I think it starts after 4 or 5 p.m.
author: julia c.

description: This place is the only taqueia on Taraval so they have the market locked down.  The food is decent, I like the taco salad and burritos.  The tortas are kind of whatever.  -1 star for the service -1 star for the price (steak prices are whatever they feel like on that given day?!?)
author: E M.

description:
If you have a huge appetite, order the burritos smoothered in cheese & red enchilada sauce. Take it home & zap it for 10 seconds on a dinner plate. A feast! My one complaint: they need to ease-up on the beans.

There is better tacos and burritos at El Toro, Pancho Villa, La Taqueria, and El Castilito but those places are in another part of town.
author: Xavier A.

description: bomb wet burrito, almost too much to eat. Good prices and they even give you free chips which a lot of places don't do anymore. would recommend!
author: Brendon N.

description: Burrito Express is one of my favorite mexican restaurants in San Francisco besides the numerous ones in the Mission District.  Since I live in the sunset, this location is easily accessible.  I always order the Bronco Burrito with carne asada steak and black beans.  Their burrito prices are cheap and are definitely worth your money.  I have no complaints with the quality of their ingredients because the avocado, beans, and meat in their burritos are definitely fresh.  Their chips are very good and I recommend getting the verde salsa with it too.
author: Ryan C.

description: This is the best burrito joint I've ever been to. Try the sliced avocado instead of traditional guacamole--it tastes amazing! The service is always great as well. Call ahead and avoid the line!
author: Rose G.

description: Really good, inexpensive Mexican food.  Burritos are great, but the surprise hits were the tamales (chicken, $3/ea!) and amazing guacamole that must have had 2 whole avocados in a single serving--nicely spiced with fresh jalapeno and cilantro.
author: Steve K.

description:
Delicious.

My girlfriend and I love the Carnitas Super Bronco Burritos. Service can get a bit swamped, but you can't really blame the staff for it. Try to go early or late for lunch to avoid the rush.

A good, solid burrito place. Just be sure to burn off the calories afterwards!
author: Tyler B.

description: My only complaint is their brazen disregard of my salsa requests. I once called in an order for 5 items and when I got there, asked for 10 (tiny) containers of salsa. Two per item sounds fair, doesn't it? When I got back to work, there were only four!!! Maybe they're so protective of their salsa because it's SO GOOD. Anyway, now I count my salsa before I leave. If I have to ask for more, they give me rolly eyes or sighs, but it's worth it. They're usually pretty busy too, so calling in your order at lunch time is a good idea.
author: Rathena K.

description:
This place is awesome.  I had been going to the one on Divisadero for about 5 years now, but only now that I am living in the Sunset did I get a chance to check out the original.  
While the place lacks ambience, it definitely has character.  The food seems the same as the Divis. location, which is a good thing.  I had the Expresso Burritio with Chili Verde Pork last night and it was absolutely delicious...and well worth the 6 bucks....
Basically, if you're in the neighborhood, definitely check this place out.
author: Leo S.

description: carnitas are freakin amazing here. cash only, and great size portions for cheap $! who doesn't love that? one bite and it's oozing of love, and although i should stop one day, extra sour cream is always by my side. probably the top spot to get great mexican close to the ocean side. 4 or 5 ladies working behind the line, always smiling.
author: Abigail W.

description:
cheese expresso, hold the beans please ! lotsa good stuff on the menu but the CE is the bestest thing I ever tasted. don't use the plastic knife & fork they give you, they will for surely break -- use real silverware on this baby, it's bigger than a pregnant sea elephant !! when no one is looking, sop up the tomatoey sauce with the chips and munch like there's no tomorrow.

also try the bronco (or super bronco if you're a glutton, ha !) with fresh strips of avocado -- lovely goodness
author: Prima D.

description:
While living in the city, I drove by this place several times.  However, given its location (in Parkside---not in the Mission), I was very skeptical about the quality of Mexican food in a predominately Chinese neighborhood.  I was dead wrong. 

Their HUGE burritos are excellent.  The meat is seasoned well and the beans are cooked just right.  Unlike some burrito places that fill a burrito with 80% bean and rice and 20% meat (or worse), the Burrito Express's meat-beans-rice ration is good---close to 50-50.   I love their red source over the burrito---not so spicy, yet very flavorful.  Burrito Express is a hidden gem in Parkside.
author: Deb R.

description: I am just not a fan of this place.  I can't put my finger on it, but the burritos just sort of miss the fresh taste I expect.  Maybe I am too much of a taco fan and have been spoiled by the likes of La Taqueria at 24th and Mission.  The place is usually busy, but I think the monopoly on the area is the reason.
author: Glenn L.

description: Hot Damn! That's a good burrito! I had the Veracruz burrito, my boyfriend had some Colorado beef something or other burrito. His burrito was the size of my arm. Mine was smaller, but still too big to finish. I tried though, trust me.  Both of us were very satisfied with our meals. I talked about that damn burrito for the rest of the day. We tried to go back the next day but they are closed on Sundays. :(
author: michelle h.

description: It seems that this out-of-the-way burrito joint in the Sunset is severely underappreciated.  It's not just good because it's the only burrito place in the area.  My girlfriend doesn't live too far from here, and she's a major burrito-lover.  I've had my differences with her on some eateries, but this is a place we agree on.  El Burrito Express is really good.  The ingredients always seem to be fresh, and the burittos are almost always piping hot.  I will agree with Holly D on the chips though, they aren't even worth eating.  But as far as burritos go, you can't beat the Bronco Burrito with carne asada or chicken, it comes with homemade pinto beans, fresh avocado, cheese, tomato and onions.  It's so good you'll almost be able to forget how foggy it is outside!
author: Michael F.

description:
I've been living in the city for about six months now and today was the first time I actually ate Mexican food in the Bay.  Why is that?  Because all of my friends from back home, or people I've met from San Diego, insist that the Mexican food up here is terrible in comparison.  But today, after a couple of hours of playing basketball, I was starving, and my roommate said he wanted to get a burrito and said it was pretty good.

While I still think So Cal taco shops the best, second only to home cooked Mexican food, this place actually wasn't too bad.  Burritos were actually a bit small though and the taste reminded me of a taco shop my sister used to always go to called Los Panchos.  Not bad, but not the greatest.  Seeing as how I don't know when's the next time I'll be able to visit home again and get an amazing carne asada burrito, this place might just be a good fix for now.
author: Joel J.

description: All you need to know if you go to this spot is "Expresso Burrito."  period.  I would love to try the other things on the menu, but I just can't get myself to deviate from it, it's so good!  I would suggest calling your order in ahead, because the line can get pretty long.
author: Eileen H.

description: A block from my house, the burrito's are good but not amazing. Staff is good but not great, and sometimes grumpy. They're stingy with their salsa, but will give you more they just don't offer it. Thus said i'd say it's a 3.5 because their food is good, just not amazing. It's convenient and I'll def go their many more times. Guadalajara in the Mission is my go to spot though.
author: Corvus C.

description: I've been going here for 20 years. I love this place. The burritos aren't THE BEST but they are damn good, amazingly priced, and the people are wonderful. They're constantly adding to their menu (but not taking away the oldies!) and now they even deliver!
author: K E.

description: If you're looking to get your burrito fix.  It's all about the carne asada espresso burrito, trust me.
author: Craig I.

description: Good hearty burritos, best in the sunset. Service is hit or miss, sometimes friendly but sometimes rude. I guess it depends how busy they are, and considering how cramped and hot it gets back behind the counter/food area, I would be prissy too. The only big minus is that there are several types of burrito choices that are basically identical except the prices are skewed. They charge a different price for the type of beans, the type of avocado, adding onions and cheese, etc. Speaking of which, they  charge more for adding cheese and sour cream on their regular burrito than if you ordered the different type of burrito with cheese and sour cream in the first place! That's kinda uncool and deceiving. To me, they should just have a regular burrito with choice of beans and a supreme burrito with any/all the extras. Still those of us in the sunset without time or inclination to drive to the mission will still frequent the joint.
author: Dom L.

description: My friend and I had some time to kill before we registered for a dance class. So I thought why not grab a burrito because I don't feel like cooking after a long day of doing nothing. Damn , I'm a lazy ass. The burrito was a big motherf*****  and cheap too. My friend suggested I cut it in half and eat the rest later. Nice thought ....but you know once you get going it's hard to stop especially when it's good stuff.
author: Sophia C.

description: Pretty good burritos. Pretty quick too. And Cheap. Do you need to know more? Then read the other reviews...
author: Clinton L.

description:
not as good as so cal burritos of course.  but id say its the best ive had in the city.  i have their number stored in my phone.....and im thinking about changing it to my speed dial.  i tend to go every week.  $4.74 will satisfy your burrito cravings

** id give it a 5 star rating....if it werent for the fact that so. cal mexican is so much better
author: Dan T.

description: I LOVE their burritos.  I always order the super cheese with extra guacamole, and though it's a guaranteed food coma causer, it'll leave your stomach so satisfied.  My family lives in San Jose so I have to drive 45 minutes to get to this place, but I do the drive and it is well worth it.  The refried beans are some of the best I've ever had, and their cheese is SO generous.  None of those pretend sprinkles you get from other places. And the best part, the whole thing is hot, melty, and the beans, rice and cheese mesh so well together.  You won't find sections of burrito that are all cold and another section with only beans.  Anyways, i'ts so good I chose it as the last meal I'd want to eat if I had a last meal.  Only problem with the super cheese is that it doesn't come with guacamole. But with less than a dollar more, the burrito's perfect!
author: Gening L.

description:
Pros: Best take out burrito joint in the sunset.  Super burritos are monstrous concatenations of salsa, guacamole, meat, cheese, and more.  Order the burrito "wet" and they drench the outside in sauce too.  Cheap.

Cons:  Place could use a remodel--it looks worse from the inside than it does from the outside.  Lacks a place to sit comfortably, even by SF hole in the wall standards.
author: Nick L.

description: Yummy with tender meat in all their burritos! With the occasional veggie burrito, it still tastes great!
author: Amy C.

description:
samson: lets go eat
me:  where you wanna go?
samson: you pick
me: something cheap
samson: your ass doesnt eat mcdonalds
me: then you pick
samson: just check your bookmarks on yelp then

20 min later (around 830pm)...

got the chile verde pork expresso burrito. i dont know how else to say it, but my burrito was mushy.  im not a burrito specialist, but its not supposed to resemble a pile of goo, right? maybe its because i came in near closing? or maybe soggy burritos arent my thing. i couldnt tell where the pot beans started and where the pork ended cuz it was all mixed together with some avocado on top. and wheres the sour cream?

i feel bad giving it only 3 stars whereas other are giving up 5s, but i prefer solid burritos where you can distinguish the meat rice and avocado from each other over this liquefied version
author: David D.

description: I was actually quite surprised that good burritos could be found this far up the coast of California!  A truly authentic burrito w/o filler continues to elude me, but El Burrito is still one of the best in town.  As long as I ask them to leave out the rice, beans, etc., the burritos come pretty close to what I'm used to.
author: Kieu L.

description: Wow! This is one of the best burrito places i've ever been to! Way better than the ones in Santa cruz, and theres where a majority of where the Mexicans are.. =\ Under 7 bucks you can get a hugee super bronco! It fills you up good and be sure to ask them for their buy 9 get 1 free card!
author: Mike H.

description: this place is the worst place I've when to for Mexican food. The nachos are expensive but, that's not the problem.. they don't melt the cheese, they microwave it. if i knew that i wouldn't have bought it, could have saved a few bucks and do that at home. Their burritos are very dry too
author: Jack L.

description: You cannot find a better burrito on this side of the city. Located right in the middle of The Sunset, this small shop stands out as a true shining star. Next closest thing would be the Taco-Bell/KFC down the street. Disgraceful... If you choose that over El Burrito Express, you have no dignity.
author: Chris L.

description: I can vouch for this place as a good place for good old-school Mexican food. Great burritos! Just went there again for the first time in over a year-They still have some great food which warrants another star.
author: Aaron B.

description: I used to be ecstatic that there was a legit-looking Mexican spot in the Sunset...and then I tried their food 5-6 times.  Mexican't!  It just isn't as good as its peers in the Mission.  You can probably come to that conclusion by noticing that Mexican people don't even eat here?  Perilous sign.  The burritos are very average at best..if you go that route, make it a wet burrito b/c that's probably their best menu item.  The meats aren't marinated that well, there's minimal (if any) oomph in the taste.  Portions are on the less generous side if you compare them to spots in the Mission.  Price wise - they're also more expensive...usually $8+ for a super burrito w/ all the fix-ins.  It's nice how they use avocado and have fresh pinto/black beans, but it's nothing to slap yo mama for.  Despite being a Sunset resident, I'd still drive to the Mission to get taqueria grub.  The extra time and gas is worth every minute and cent.
author: Jeff S.

description:
First of all, I am from San Diego where there is a taco shop on every corner and I always order Carne Asada Fries (yummy). That being said I have been having a hard time finding places with Carne Asada Fries (none!) so I have resorted to eating Carne Asada Nachos...this place has awesome Carne Asada Nachos. So damn good and a bit pricier than a burrito but seriously it is enough for two people. The only other thing I order is Beef Tamales, which are also awesome and it cost $2.75 for a big fat one. The one item I wish they had was Menudo or Posole...and I also wish they were open on Sundays...

So all in all this place is great especially since it is in the Sunset, where it is hard to find good Mexican food.
author: Maria R.

description:
to be precise, hovering around the 3.75 mark but that's just because i'm too damn finicky when it's rainy bay day.

the first time i was brought here in one of the earlier months of 2010, i was threatened into ordering the expresso burrito because my companion, who has had multiple visits here, thought it sublime Saturday evening entertainment to watch me attempt a food item that in diameter was equal to both my forearms put together, and almost equaling in length the distance from wrist to inner elbow. 

yes i just measured. 

i was starving and had no idea how massive this burrito was gonna be, so i ordered up the chicken and sour cream expresso style and...oh my. no doubt it was delicious, stuffed with the works - guacamole, sour cream, extra this that anything and everything i was offered by the lady at the counter - and topped with a lot of 'special expresso sauce'. but after the novelty first reaction upon popping open the takeaway container - "HOOOOLY...." and about seven bites in, it starts getting very, very tedious. every subsequent bite started to taste the same, but i just  couldn't stop eating. delicious burrito is delicious, just don't commit the rookie mistake of wearing your sexy pants, like i did. my man friend and i had no room for any self-conscious nonsense (@ decency) and we chubbies just sat in front of the tv, netflixing with jeans unbuttoned while digging into huge, ridiculously messy burritos. mmmmmm. the chicken was tasty, though in itself nothing to shout about. with all the other ingredients rolled up together in that bad boy, i really can't complain. 

had some bites of my companion's steak expresso burrito too; super bold and meaty, tasted like MAN. if you're a beef lover, then order this for a red meat wipeout. this thing is robust, it'll make your cholesterol level hit the roof and hasten puberty. that sort of yummy.

i've also had the chicken bronco burrito for days when i've got makeup on and don't want sour cream on my lashes. YOU KNOW YOU'VE HAD THAT HAPPEN TO YOU WITH THE EXPRESSO BURRITO. bro, it happens. true life. anyway, the bronco burrito is pretty okay, nothing exceptional, but yummy is yummy. though they can be quite inconsistent with the amount of filling depending on the number of people waiting for their food. i've gotten a comparatively scantily-filled burrito during the lunch hour jam, and on other occasions, generously plump burritos.

the breakfast burrito was a surprise favorite of mine. i ordered one to try seeing as to how i skipped breakfast that day, and i enjoyed every mouthful of it. eggs, potato, cheese, guacamole, rice, beans, tomatoes. so good. 

every burrito order comes with a free serving of chips, and they give you extra containers of salsa and salsa verde upon request. the chips i've had are always crispy and moreish, a good flavor/texture contrast with the burrito. i always ask for extra salsas and on the disappointing couple of occasions when i discover one container of salsa to be diluted, the others usually are not. the ladies sometimes give me an annoyed look when i ask for more of both salsas, but that ain't stopping me! like hey, i say please and thaaaaaank yah. come on now.

i find the horchata okay, i have it with the food for when i feel festive.

order your burritos for an easy weekend night in, choose a movie that will make you guffaw, and indulge in straight up comfort food with good company with whom demonstrative pretense need not be exercised. just remember to wear the elastic pants. in all seriousness.
author: Eliza D.

description: One taco had four beans and a small piece of beef in it, the other had half a fish and a cow inside.  No me gusta.
author: Emery H.

description: Burritos aren't bad for this part of the Sunset as there's no where else to go for a wrapped beauty.  I like their Surf n' Turf (red meat and shrimp) burrito.  Essentially a take-out joint because there's only 3-4 bar stools by the counter/window.  Parking's kind of challenging.  Their enchilada plate's not bad but there's so much sauce that it might be better to consume it right there.  They put  the enchilada on a paper plate and cover it w/foil.  You're holding your breath that the foil doesn't separate from the plate and or you've a red mess on yourself or your car before you get home.  The chips are thick and crunchy.  Good place to grab a bite if you're in a hurry elsewhere.
author: Ry T.

description: My only complaint is that there is very little seating available to eat-in.  The food is outstanding and very fast.  It is a bargain for the amount of food you get.  I have been eating here for at least 10 years and I continue to come back whenever I get a chance.  It is a staple of my diet
author: Michael R.

description: Whoa.. the burritos are AMAZING. Chicken, guacamole, cheese, rice, beans... always so big and fresh. I usually am hungry all day long and well past bedtime too, but after eating one of these for dinner I am STUFFED. Cheap, fast, and yummy.. Sadly closed on Sundays.
author: O K.

description: This place is good but eh price is quite borderline expensive just like gordos and any other burito place. I go to this place because it's closer than gordos. Haven't been there for 1 year. I just decided to walk a bit further to taco bell to save some cash.
author: Keit K.

description: average burritos.  DON"T get their nacho!!!!  The cheese was hard and disgusting in less than 5 minute.  Taco Bell has better nacho.
author: L C.

description: It's closed on sundays. boooooo! i came here to ry to solve my hangover needs, but I guessed they are closed on Sunday. I tried this place a few weeks before and loved it. Just had a carne asada burrito and it definitely tasted way fresher then some other places. I guess this place will be my Saturday hangover cure instead.
author: jung j.

description: Great burritos here.  Wrapped up or served on a plate covered in sauce.  Main item I get here is the surf n turf burrito.  Menu can be a bit confusing if you havent been here, theres about 4-5 different burrito options with different fillings. Closed on sundays, come at lunch time or dinner time and theres sure to be a healthy line.  A lot of people call orders in too so an in-person order can take a while sometimes during a rush.
author: david w.

description: An excellent wet burrito. I usually get the bean & cheese one. This is one of the foods I crave every once in awhile.
author: Scott M.

description: I LOVE Burrito Express! No joke I have been eating here as long as I can remember. Mission can dream big, this sunset kid will defend her taco spot till the death.
author: Allison A.

description:
This place is happening.  Burritos are my staple--veggie burritos !

El Burrito Express has variety, flavor and the price is right.   Hours are a little sketchy, but if they are open, don't think twice.
author: Johnny C.

description: When my ramen stock is depleted, I go here for cheap quick grub.  I order the same thing every dang time because it's just too perfect, I don't care for anything else.  Regular Chicken Burrito with a side of sour cream.  Perfect size to suppress my munchies.  The burritos tend to be on the saucy side and I like that their Spanish rice isn't dry... it's still moist and fluffy.  Don't forget to ask for extra hot sauce!  They also include a baggy of tortilla chips in each order.  They are like glass!  Super hard and thick... toss them or use them as ninja stars.
author: Chris T.

description: get in line and atlest 2 minutes later walk out with a steaming fresh burrito wating to be wripped apart and devoured. Its delicious and if you have time you can drive down to the beach and have a blast with it.
author: Janelle H.

description: The lines can be long at certain times, but it goes fast. It is pretty dirty inside, so take your food to go so you don't lose your appetite. otherwise, you'll find yourself eating next to the huge recycling bins situated near the bar stools. I've been here a couple of times and always enjoy my grilled steak grande nachos. One order is enough for myself and my husband so he always ends up taking his order home for dinner.
