According to him the Chicken Expresso is something he craves often. To me, it's just a burrito.
author: Yelp O.

description: Holy Moly Guacamole! Get the guac, your stummy will thank me. Food is cheap, good and filling.
author: Teresa Y.

description: The best burrito in the Sunset. Very cheap, and the red sauce chicken is also very good. Most of the burritos come with fresh avocado (no extra charge!), and melted cheese. Bronco burrito is $5.09. Those bad boys are effin' huuge too!  This place is the booooomb diggity. You can't the fake the funk on a nasty dunk.
author: Hart B.

description: ok, so i went back to el burrito express seeking redemption. i got burnt before when i ordered the "nor cal" burrito and ended up waiting 40 min. i didn't shy away for the "nor cal" this time either... hoping it wouldn't take them 30 min to realize they need to drop a basket of fries into the fryer. luckily for me, this time they didn't. it felt good not to be forgotten while having to watch a dozen or so customers who ordered after me get their food and eat it in front of me as i stand there waiting and wondering about my  burrito. thanks, el burrito... and the "nor cal" was delicious.
author: Brian L.

description: Good burrito and its really cheap!  Not much English in the place but that makes it even better : )
author: Joel S.

description: Maybe not the tastiest chili colorado I've ever eaten, but this is still my favorite fork-and-knife burrito in the city.  I'll drive across town for it.  Gotta get the expresso burrito with the enchilada sauce.  Gotta.
author: Jimmy C.

description: I crave El Burrito express all the time. So yummy, I can't seem to stop ordering the same thing, Super carnesada burrito with cheese and sour cream.  The burritos are big so if you don't want to explode with burritoie goodness split it it with a friend or save it for latter.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: A huge, tasty burrito smoothered in a red enchilada sauce. mmmm. Maybe some other joints can do it better but damn, why aren't ya'll doin' it? For now, I'll stick with El Burrito Express.
author: James C.

description: The Super Cheese w/ sour cream is the type of burrito that should be reserved for the king.
author: Yelp Is A Giant Turd M.

description:
their hot sauce is bomb.

my parents live a couple blocks away from this place. i brought my mom a wet expresso carne asada burrito from this place like 7 years ago, and she's been going to it ever since. even my auntie, and grandma like it. if you see a few chinese ladies congregating on 26th and taraval, stuffing down some burritos it's quite possible, it's my fam.
author: greg c.

description:
this is my favorite burrito place in the whole bay area.

and i have been to a lot of mexican restaurants. i have been going to this place for over 10 years. i used to live in the area and even after i moved away to ssf and san mateo, i still continue to go here. if i still live in the area, i would go there a lot more.

I order the expresso chicken (i think this is the one, first kind of burrito on the menu) everytime and it is the best! it is a wet burrito with sauce over it. the size is also perfect because it is a pretty big burrito that stuffs me everytime. the price is great too!
author: Alex H.

description:
Just the name was enough for me to roll on over to Glen Park or the Mission. I'm not a fan of the burrito. Huge fan of  tostadas,  corn tortillas, chilaquiles, fish tacos, mango salsa, and vegatarian tamales. (If I ever went back to eating meat, a homemade, chicken tamale would be at the top of my list. ) 
It took me several years to try this place with the American name! Hey, if I want express, I am heading to a real Taco Bell, not  the  KFC & Taco Bell combo. The real Taco Bell tends to be clean, clean, clean, with the employees washing (in clear view) their hands frequently. Where if one is working with money, they are not touching the food. Yep, I am proud to be a cleanaphobe. OOOPs, I am in the midst of writing about El Burrito and not  Taco Bell...After several years, one of my kids told me that they had tostadas. Who knew?! That said, I had to see if they came close to being real.  They are real and they are damned good. For under $2.00 I get the avocado tostada with extra sauce. Yummy :) 

This place lacks a few things, aside from the fact that there is absolutely no parking. First, it could use a real good cleaning. I try not to look around. Fear is that I might see something. In fact, I haven't even checked their health dept. score card.  Think that in this case, it may be better if I didn't know. Next, if this were my business,  I would hire someone who actually likes people. Someone who may even remember you after seeing you for more than a handful of times. I can usually get a smile out of anyone, with the goal being a bit of laugher, but a smile if all else fails. Not here. Being pleasant doesn't count. Big tips cause no emotion. I don't require a chirpy, upbeat soul, but a smile or a greeting just feels right. Maybe the two women who work the register just need to leave. One in particular can be extremely rude and difficult. 

Come for the tostadas. Head over to La Playa Tacqueria if you want a better dish. There you can enjoy a mango or chipotle salsa. They have no problem customizing your order. Do not try to customize here. Not unless you want an even longer scowl than the one she is already wearing. Plus, La Playa is just 2 blocks from the beach.

The owner is very nice, but I think that she has just let it go. Regardless of whether or not the place is spic -'n-span, or that the employees are unpleasant, she is still making money.
author: francez M.

description: Faithful to El burrito express. The ladies that work there are so cute & friendly, reminds me of someone's mother or aunt! Small place so when its packed...its PACKED! I'd say they are better than the burritos I get in the mission. Most places in the mission have roaches 3 out of 5 spots I've been to! This place isn't like that & just as authentic! I think I want a burrito now! mmmmmmm!
author: Karen H.

description: pretty decent mexican restaurant. they deliver,which is rad. and the food is cheap. that name though, man.
author: Joseph N.

description: Overall i don't really like this place I have been to the one on divisadero and the food is more tasting and even huge more decent. I'm really desapointed with such a poor service I experienced at this place. I mean the register seam to be some kind of urgency and not even listen what a was ordering, and no one was not even smiling or making eye contact it seems that every was having a bad day. Once I recived my food it was all wrong and cold, so I have to come back and ask them to remaided 4 me but lady that was cooking she wasn't really happy about it and I see here rolling her eyes and making funy faces. I mean all of this for just aburrrito I thought this place was more put toguether!!!!!!! I think the one on divisadero still the best food and great service in town...
author: Lindsey B.

description: i looooooooooooooove this place... the carne asada is awesome... carnitas is meh... but still yum... =)
author: Mary O.

description:
Being from San Diego, we like our burritos a certain way and I'm sure 100% of the SD native up here would agree that NorCal burritos don't  compare. With that said, let's begin. I docked one star for the names. The name sounds like it belongs in a food court at a Westfield Mall. I had the "Norcal" Burrito which is a California burrito. Why in the fuck would they name a SD creation a NorCal burrito?! GTFOHWTBS. On a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being an absolutely crap burrito and 10 being something that can pass in SD, I give it a 5. 5 because out of the three places I've had a CA burrito, this place ranks #2. I MAAAAAY come back here only bc it's closer to where I live and the parking isn't so bad. My actual critique on the food is that it could use more fries, less cheese, and no salsa. I should give this 1 star, but I know burritos aren't San Francisco's specialty, at least from a San Diegan's standpoint (yes I'm a burrito snob). 

PS: bring cash and expect to pay over 6.00 for your burrito
author: Chris P.

description:
Good. Fast. Cheap.

The staff is friendly and busting their butts back there. This place has been here forever and not much has changed but it really doesn't need to. There are lots of different burritos to choose from and that includes many vegetarian options.

The only take cash though so bring it....
author: Yelper S F.

description: I have a couple of friends that really love this place.  Personally, I think it's just so so.  While the portions are large, the rice and the meats are dry.  Maybe if I'm walking up Taraval and I've got a mean craving for some rice and beans, I might stop into El Burrito Express.  But most of the time I'll take a pass on mediocrity.
author: Tony L.

description: I've heard good things about El Burrito Express, so I finally decided to try it.  It was great!  I had theGIGANTIC expresso carnitas burrito.  It was wet (with their red sauce), sloppy, and delicious!  Also, parking in the area is easy.  The employees weren't the friendliest, but I would still definitely go back.
author: Patti L.

description: Terrible. Rude and short tempered workers, AWFUL food, and they do not carry vegetables. Like, in a super burrito...you'll get beans, rice, guacamole and cheese...no lettuce, no tomato, no sour cream. I actually asked for sour cream, and they charged me extra. I payed $7 for a cheese burrito which made me gag.  Expensive for really awful quality and service.  Take the drive to the mission, or go for L'Avenida on Irving in the inner sunset.
author: Sepideh M.

description: VERY meh.  It's location is really close to me, but I'll still usually drive further to get a better burrito.  This is a good place if you're passing by, are super hungry and don't want Taco Bell.
author: Tara B.

description: Is it me, or did they change their tortilla chips? I'm not sure, but I swear they used to be harder..Anyway, if I ever have a burrito craving, I come here! It's quick and close to home! And it beats the "burritos" from Taco Bell when it comes to authenticity (not that I don't crave those sometimes too!). From experience, I've always liked the beef burritos better, but for those who prefer chicken, that's not bad as well. Good, but I've had the most heavenly burritos from a place on Grand Avenue in South City (I don't know the name of the place since I've never been there, but that's where my mom says she gets them from).
author: Audrey T.

description: There aren't a lot of options in the ave's for burrito's so I often end up going here. The burrito's are huge and filling and usually knock me out if I try to eat a whole one. I like the burrito's with snapper and shrimp. Good option if your in the avenues looking for a big lunch.
author: Phil M.

description: Great Nicaraguan burrito.  I order it socal style: carne asada burrito, no rice, no beans, no cheese, and I ask them to grill the tortilla so it's a tad crispy. I have the burrito in my right hand, and the cup of salsa in my left hand and slowly alternate = YUMMMMM
author: Dong T.

description: There just isn't anything redeeming about this place.  Do your self a favor and hitch a ride to Ocean Taqueria, everything at 'express' is flavorless and never seems too clean.
author: Thadd L.

description: I had the taco salad there, I wanted to order a burrito. I didn't make a bad choice, it was pretty good. Place is kinda of a hole in the wall.
author: Navi T.

description:
Been going here for years.  Love the bronco steak burritos, and the "hard" chips.  

Don't like how they are stingy with the red and green hot sauce.
author: Jeff H.

description: This place is right down the street from my house and is always busy. I've eaten there a couple of times and it had always been mediocre. The last time I went there, the chicken in my chicken burrito was so dry it tasted like chicken jerky. I threw most of it away. Two stars because my friend's carnita's burrito looked tasty and they give you chips, but no salsa. Otherwise, it would've been a one star.
author: Linda L.

description: El burrito is one of the best burrito places you can go in the sunset district, the portions are big, the quality of the food is high and most importantly in this economy it is CHEAP!  You can get a huge burrito and some chips for about  6-7 dollars, thats the super burrito and thats one of the bigger ones, you can always go smaller and what not and it'll cost you round 4-5 dollars...The meats at this place is really good, the vegies as fresh as it gets and as they prepare it in front of you nothing can go wrong!  Everything is freshly prepared right there so you cant complain about the overall freshness of the burrito, the salsa is also awesome!  I continue to go here again and again for lunch or dinner!
author: Genesis K.

description: I regularly come here when I crave a burrito.  It's by far the best burrito in the sunset.  The Espresso burritos are delicious, and man do they fill you up.  That's if you can actually finish the entire thing though.  It comes with a side of chips and don't forget to ask for the hot sauces (red and green).
author: Randall L.

description: might be that i go later in the evening, but their burritos have been luke warm lately. not sure whats up with that. i put it in my microwave when i get home. Meh. I've experienced better.
author: Wats C.

description: 2 words: TACO SALAD.  This place is so small and out of the way, yet everytime I go there (dinnertime that is), there's always a wait!  Someday I'll try something other than a Taco Salad, but for now, I'm hooked!
author: Christopher C.

description: I used to come here every now and then for lunch and get a bronco steak burrito. Their burritos are pretty good, same goes with their chips. They make your food in a timely manner, so you don't have to expect too much of a wait time for your food.
author: Edgar G.

description: This was the first place I ate at when I first moved to SF in '04. Really good veggie burritos. I cant even tell you how many times I ate here in the year I lived a half a block away from this joint.
author: Lauren T.

description: Tasty burritos and decently priced. I prefer this place to a lot of other burrito shops around the city.
author: Julie L.

description: I lived in the Inner Sunset for over 10 years and El Burrito Express was a constant stop for me. As I wasn't eating meat at the time, the "super cheese with hot sauce" was basically what I would order every time. For a place to deliver a veggie burrito with so much flavor that you don't miss the meat is pretty amazing. They also didn't throw anything excessive in there...beans, rice, (tons of) cheese, hot sauce and maybe some cilantro if I was in the mood, all on a grilled tortilla. I really miss having easy access to this place now that I live in the East Bay. Don't get me wrong, I've eaten at tons of burrito places in both SF and the East Bay, but El Burrito Expess is hands down the best burrito I've had flavor wise. Now that I'm eating meat again I'll have to go back and try some of their meats, but knowing me I'll probably just order my old favorite. I love this place!
author: Jeff G.

description: I want to go 5 stars and I would but I have to keep it real...  Growing up in the Mission, it took me a while to warm up to this place... I knew it was very popular but I summed it up to location (not much competition in this neck of the woods) and clientele (mostly gringo and asian) Honestly, after my first few tries, I just wasn't reeled in. But, as I worked my way through the menu, I began to love the place!  Some offers are wonderful and others just okay to me ( palate is kinda relative). Well, once I found what I liked, I was in taqueria heaven!  Sadly, I have found that since introducing the option of delivery, the wait time has increased by quite a bit but more importantly the end product can be very inconsistent.  Sometimes orders are missing key ingredients or have the wrong ingredients...  I do want to finish on a high note because I still find that this taqueria exceeds most others in S.F...  I really admire their efforts in trying new ideas and offering a very unique menu while showing consideration to the Vegan & Vegetarian community!  At other taquerias, if you want a veggie burrito, you simply get a meat burrito sans meet with maybe some extra lettuce (weak!).  Where as "El Burrito Express" has many options including sauteed veggies, cabbage, avocado soft tacos and more!  "Viva El Burrito Express!..."  keeping it real in the Sunset for Mucho anos and I hope for Mucho Mas...  excuse the Spanglish...
author: Joseph A.

description: I remember having been here once or twice years ago back in high school and then never again. I don't remember exactly how I felt about the burritos but I know they must have been pretty mediocre because I never went back again until recently. My bf had the same feelings about this place for years until he recently heard they were way better now so he went one day to end his skepticism. He came back telling me that his burrito was indeed very good. I was kinda upset that he did not save me a bite but soon I was able to try it for myself. We both went there at about dinner time so there was a line already. It was about a 5 min wait which is nothing to complain about. For under $5 each we each got a pork burrito and they were decently sized. They even give free chips! I saw they have a frequent stamp card so I asked for one knowing we'd probably be back. They were also advertising their horchata which I'm curious to try perhaps next time. We waited until we got home to eat our burritos. I was disappointed at first  thinking maybe I should have gotten steak or chicken instead because upon first bite my pork was too hard like it had been cooked for too long. The pork of the top portion of my burrito was like that (the bf's too) but when I got deeper into the burrito the pork was so tender and juicy and amazingly good. It's one of the best burritos I've ever had gooood. I'm willing to go back again with hope that the pork will be perfect next time! They've certainly either changed owners or just improved their food. Either way I'm glad we now have a good burrito place we can go to nearby.
author: Helen L.

description:
The major issues: lack of proper food handling and overcharging.
While awaiting my order, I watched a burrito being prepared.  Apparently, the wrong ingredients were put on the tortilla so the preparer, who was not wearing gloves, used his fingers to scrape off the ingredients back into the receptacles.  Not very sanitary.
Despite a sign hanging over the cashier that wheat tortillas were included in the price, I was charged an additional amount for the wheat.  When I brought this to the cashier's attention, after paying, she stated she was told to charge extra despite the sign and would not give a refund.  She stated I should contact management  to complain via a link on the website but, of course, there is no link.  While the amount was only 30 cents per burrito, there is the principle of being honest with your customers.  Additionally, the receipt shows the 30 cents listed as "trigo".
Not speaking Spanish, I had no idea what this meant and had to ask.  What is the purpose, other than trying to fool people, of a S.F. business printing a purchase in Spanish?
One more thing....they are not fast in getting out food so expect a wait.
author: Steve K.

description:
bleh. when i went to high school up the street, everyone would rave about this place but i haaaated it. they used crappy corn tortillas, their meat is gross, and their burritos and tacos were all so dry. 

so i would go to king of thai instead.

if you want a good burrito in the sunset, go to l'avenida on irving near 7th ave. way better.
author: Kristina C.

description: Cheap as all get out and YUMMY!  I have been eating there for years ( at least 15!) and it is pretty much the only place I crave a burrito from.  Really simple food but extremely tasty.  Gets super busy at lunch time with construction workers and HS kids.
author: Alexis J.

description:
Local favorite. 
Wallet happy.
Tummy happy.

Your basic, local, small, delicious, authentic Mexican place.
A Sunset staple. Not worth 5 stars, but if you're in the area, you need to try.
author: Jackie C.

description: A great take-out place for burritos.  Carnitas Bronco Burrito was da bomb with a good amount of cheese and avocado.  Chili burritos were also tasty. I had never had anything like it.  Some people may find the burritos here dry, but okay for me cus i like to pour salsa over my burritos.  The place is dingy but i could care less cus i never sat there and ate.  It gets crowded during lunch hours.
author: Jessica N.

description:
What more can be said about this yummy burrito joint in the Sunset? After 10 years I remain a big fan. What always amazes me is that in all this time I've never had my order made incorrectly, even when I was buying dinner for 6-8 people with "special" requests.

I did take off one star--sorry--but only taking cash can be a pain when buying dinner for more than myself and the closest atm is down the block at a liquor store.
author: Mark A.

description:
The place is tiny and the service sucks ballz.  i walked in in a rush, thinking it would be a quick and easy to-go order.  i was obviously mislead by the "express" in the restaurant name as I walked out 30 min later with the single taco i had ordered.

the cashier along with the take-out guy, and the ladies making up the burrito assembly line, if you will, had no or organization whatsoever; there was definitely no method to this madness.  I waited patiently for my single taco, as the minutes slowly passed.  after about 10, i was frustrated but not pissed as of yet because they had not yet come to my number in the order sequence. 

 a few more minutes go by as large 5 to 10 item orders are being prepared, packed and distributed (again i ordered a single taco) and by this time my number had been skipped.  i wiggle my way up to the take away man through the crowd of people that have now accumulated in the tiny brick cube, hold out my receipt to which he responds "it's coming."  Ok so i wait and try to disregard the unfriendly nature of the workers. 10 more minutes pass, and a good 6 or 7 orders put in after mine have been given out.  I make my way back up to the counter to once again ask about my order.  I am given the same response.  the minutes keep passing. at this point i just wanted my money back before i punched someone in the face. but alas, i was unable to get to the cashier due to the mass amount of taco hungry people sardine packed in the store front. 14 orders put in after mine had been distributed before they finally called my number.  

No compensation of a refund, coupon, or something xtra packaged along with my taco in retribution for their obvious lack of service had been offered.  not possessing the patience to argue, i walked out of el burrito express, late for my appointment, and steaming from the ears with my lonely taco.

dont get me wrong, Ive heard from friends this place is awesome and granted my taco was good, but i can safely say that was the first and last time ill ever eat at el burrito express.

there. venting done.
author: Dana C.

description: This place is awesome. I've been here a few times during school because I went to Lincoln High School and lately, I went there again. The avocado taco was tasty, the Bronco Steak Burrito was orgasmic. I love mexican food and El Burrito Express
author: Jonathan L.

description: If it were possible, I'd own stock in B to the E. For $3 you get a full meal w/ the freshest ingredients. That's the "Burrito" part. And it all takes like a minute, hence the "Express" part. B to the E has been feeding the hungry surfers and stoners in my community for years. They've always been there for me.
author: Jess P.

description: There's always a line, so I shouldn't yelp about it.  God knows we wouldn't want more people in there, but they make a darn good burrito.  I love the cheese expresso.
author: Kool B.

description: I crave el burrito.  There are so many options its fantastic.  You get sick of your staple jump ova to a wet burrito, sick of that, nachos.  The list goes on and on, the ladies who work there are really nice too.  everything is around 4 bucks and will fill you up.  They do substitutions easy and don't charge you, so don't hesitate.  The place can get pretty hoppin' around 5-7pm and the line goes out the door, but no worries you can always call in your order ahead of time :)
author: Emily F.

description: Very tasty wet burritos.. very inconvenient parking. There are plenty of other taqueria's in the city to go to, but if you're in the area, this is a pretty good choice. If you get a wet burrito to go, it will come in a box smothered in sauce and cheese. It's really just a boat of tasty Mexican staple ingredients at that point, but what's wrong with that?
author: Jon W.

description: Better get in line during rush hour, I love the express Carnitas!
author: Daniel W.

description: So if you're in this neighborhood because you just have to break up with your girlfriend in person because of 2008 New Year's resolution, then stop by this place for a burrito.   Solid.   Burritos are good.   Lots of choices.  Chicken is tender.
author: Asit P.

description: I've been eating at El Burrito Express for years and it's always been my good old faithful.  The burritos are big, yummy and inexpensive.  The nacho's are old school, cheesy gooey and the ultimate comfort food.  This place is tiny and is pretty much take out only.  The only down side is that it's pretty hard to park at that particular corner so you have to search a bit for a spot.  But well worth it for a delicious take home meal.
author: Nicole T.

description: I don't i will ever order from them after today i order two burritos and they gave chips and it didn't come with sauces like they usually do. When i called to order they didn't pick the first time so i hung up called again and when i did the lady at the counter sounded rude and when i asked how much it was she said 14 something with a attitude i'm like you should be able to give me an exact price when you work there. She was a very rude lady and i don't think i ever order a burrito from there and this happened at around 6:20-6:30p.m. Don't go here if you don't want to rude customer service and she didn't even give me the right burrito either
author: kyung l.

description: GOD. every time i eat one of their "wet burritos" i feel like that fat guy from man vs. food. its a feat trying to finish that thing but its so good. only thing that sucks about the wet burrito is that its kind of horrible saving it for left overs, not quite the same so either finish it or get someone to help. but their burritos are great.
author: austin c.

description: I used to go to El Burrito Express very frequently when I was in high school ( some 20 years ago).  They used to have very tasty food with great value.  I have to say in the last 5 years,  the quality of their food has gone down significantly.  I usually order the super bronco burrito with either steak or carnita.  The burrito I've got was so skinny.  They put so little filling inside and the wrap overlaps a few times.  The rice seems to overcook all the time.  They put so little salsa you can hardly taste it and it is very dry.  Very disappointed.  They also put the recycle and garbage bins inside the little dinning area,  sometimes they smell.
author: Frank W.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get burritos.  I've eaten here numerous times and only gotten the runs once.  In my book that makes this a good burrito joint.  I particularly enjoy the chicken and sour cream super burrito with jalepenoes.  I think the super burrito is the one with all the yummy red sauce over it.  Minus one star for the one time it gave me the runs.
author: Stephen C.

description: Another place Ive been going to since high school, I always get the Expresso burrito steak, if you order this, make sure its not on your lunch break because youll be worthless after, Im always full for hours after I eat this monster! Great part is its fairly priced. Parking can sometimes be a b#tch and the seating are is pretty small.
author: Bobby S.

description: Hands down the best burrito joint in the Sunset, if not the only burrito joint in the Sunset. hehe  I probably stop by once a month, and I always order the same thing.  A steak and pork super burrito with sour cream, guacamole and jalapenos....woooohoooo that thing is good.  I can't say that I like the free chips they give you.  They are hard and they don't give you salsa for it.  But that's ok, I'm there for the burritos anyway.
author: Billy T.

description: I personally think they have the best burritos. I like El Burrito Express more than Gordo's. Also, since I live around the area, it's so convenient for me. Their burritos are huge for the price you pay. You also get tortilla chips, which I dislike because they're so hard and with no salsa. The place is also very small and a little dirty. So, I usually take my burrito to go.
author: Bridge H.

description: They really don't care about you or your food.  Why then open a restaurant?  I guess it's just a job for them...they put raw cheese on one of my burritos because it was busy and they didn't want to waste time letting it melt.  So I get screwed?
author: Sir Paul L.

description: This place is o.k. for a quick bite, not like we have a choice in the outlands. The other burrito places in the sunset are better. (La Playa on Noriega and Beach Burrito on Judah) They are just average as far as quality and taste. I will give them credit for being cheap, offering huge portions and being relatively quick about service. The one thing you will definitely not get at this place is a smile or a thank you. I've been going there for years and every time I go in they look at me like I just kicked their dog or something. Some friends and I have nicknamed this place "El Bitchy Burrito"...In short...Not bad, but not great either..oh and the sodas they sell are never cold, if you care about that sort of thing.
author: chris y.

description: This is a great place to get your Burrito fix. I usually order the Expresso Burrito Colorado Beef. It's a huge burrito for a reasonable price. i barely can finish it. The Burrito is dripping with sauce. It is very tasty. This place has been around for a long time so you won't be disappointed. Give it a try.
author: Larry V.

description: On the corner of Taraval and 26th. Good food you can count on. The Bronco Burritos are the best.
author: Mike G.

description:
This is the only place in the sunset where you can get a great burrito. I would say that these burritos are as good if not better than the ones you find the mission. 
Back when i was still in high school my friends and I would walk down here for lunch. Now that i am away at college i often crave for a burrito or a taco from here. Every time i am back i make sure that i take a trip here. 
Every order comes with home made chips. I love them but my sister is not a fan. The burritos here are huge and the steak is the bomb. I have also tried the tacos which are great also. The tostada was good but it took forever to make so i have only ordered it once. If you are really hungry you can order the macho burrito which is a huge burrito for only 9 bucks. It is at least the size of 2 super bronco burritos. 
I think they recently incorporated or something because they now have uniforms but as long as they keep the quality of the food up i am fine with that.
author: KC F.

description: So good. Love the vegetarian options. Bring back tofu burrito! The salsas are so dank.
author: John B.

description: Love this place. The food is always good although sometimes when I order steak burritos there's not enough meat so I always ask for extra. Friendly people, great food and the best in the sunset for sure. Never any parking , freezing inside and basically no seating are some drawbacks but the food makes up for it.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Just had one tonight. THere good... so dont avoid them if you  look at reviews to make ur decision.  But I will be more specific and technical.

There defintiely a good burrito better then gordo's. But they wernt as good as people made them out to be. I mean yea i would get them again, but I thoguht t his place was going t o knock my socks off.


Anyways it was a little expensive. About 7 bucks. Thats a lot for a burrito where I come from. Espeically since I got a burrito, 1/2 pint of rice... 1/2 pint of beans from gordo's for that same price.

But overall its a place I would go to again, but not make a habit o f going to.
author: will d.

description: I just lived around the corner of El Burrito Express -- and I've been stopping off there almost every week just to get their steak bronco burrito.  There's always a line out the door.  It is well worth the wait.
author: Mimi T.

description: my favorite close-by place to get a delicious burrito. of course, going down to Mission would be nicer, but even the mission doesnt have Express Burritos, which are my favorite hands down. its a burrito drenched in their sauce with cheese on top. definitely recommend it. for $7 this burrito can cover lunch and dinner. the only reason it isnt 5 stars is because there really is no place to eat inside, and the service at the cashier isnt the best...
author: Brian T.

description: We moved to 26th and Santiago and were only a block away from heaven. We'd call ahead, pick up our order, and eat around our round table for a special treat with our family when we could afford it. When we moved to Concord in 2000, I made it my mission to find a replacement. No such luck. We've tried many, many burritos but none stack up to "the burrito store." We've settled on Los Montanyas Supermarket but still have to get in the car to get there. Whenever we're nearby El Burrito we enjoy their burritos. I love the wet burrito. Nachos are wonderful too. If we eat after a Kaiser appointment we go to the Divisadero location, but it doesn't have the memories.
author: Olie C.

description: Cash only, which I don't always have on me. Drab service, no smiles when you come in the door. Smaller sizes for the prices. Just not my favorite way to eat a burrito. I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.
author: Elizabeth Z.

description: Discovered this GREAT burrito place in the Sunset which has few, if any, Mission-type taquerias.  Lines form, but its worth the wait.  I haven't been to the other store on Divisadero, but this is one of the best in the city!
author: tom i.

description:
El Burrito express is open till at least 8pm most days, and serves up the cheapest, largest, and tastiest burrito in the outer Sunset. I like to get the Chile Relleno or Chicken Burrito with sour cream and guacamole, which runs me about $5.50 and makes for a whopping dinner, or a perfect dinner and lunch. 

Free crunchy thick flour tortilla chips and salsa make the place extra special. Has seats, but is essentially takeout only, to take back to your tiny sunset house/apartment.
author: julia s.

description: yes, this place makes a good burrito. i like it ranchero style with the sauce and cheese on top. It's delicious! and it's gigantic!
author: Erica V.

description: Love their bronco burrito... always a toss up between the sauce chicken and the steak.  Not only do they have a burrito without rice on the menu (bronco burrito) but they are the ONLY ones I know that can make a burrito without rice that doesn't fall apart on you into a soggy mess.  Also, love the fresh avocado slices instead of the watered down guacamole that most shops try to slap on.
author: nicole s.

description: Best burrito in San Francisco, hands down. The proportions are perfect, the ingredients are fresh, and the help is friendly.  What more can you ask for?  Maybe some more seats!
author: Jeremy L.

description: Disclaimer: It's been a while (like 6 years) since I bothered to try this place. My take was, If you're a vegetarian, don't bother. Flavorless, floppy, soggy burritos. For a veggie burrito, better to hoof it over to La Playa (45th/Noriega) or the new El Sol up on 19th. Maybe the people who line up here are all carnivores or just clueless.
author: L J.

description: i've been coming to this place for a few years now and the only thing i ever order from this place is their chicken tostada salad. i figure i can get a burrito anywhere, but other restaurant's chicken tostada just doesn't seem to measure up for some reason. though the word salad should be used loosely here since there is only a small handful, the tostada bowl and chicken are pretty solid.  service can seem slow sometimes cuz it can get busy with limited standing room, but i'll continue to come back as long as the tostada bowl doesn't shrink anymore in size.
author: thb t.

description: Ive been going to el burrito throughout high school and absolutely love the location and transportation (L line stop in front). The burritos are pretty good, but not the greatest things youve ever tasted. The quesadillas are also good but I wouldnt veer too far off of those items as the quality in tacos and taquitos drops off significantly. All in all, El Burrito is quick, easy, and filling and in the end, relatively satisfying. 3.5 stars
author: Kerry C.

description: Unfortunately I haven't been able to eat here for a while, since I moved out of the neighborhood. HOWEVER, luckily i moved closer to the mission and i can easily say that these are the best burritos and mexican food outside of the mission, and is def up there with the best mexican food in the city. It's really a toss up between el burrito and taqueria cancun. So if you're in the mood for mexican, but don't want to go all the way to the mission i highly recommend el burrito on taravel!
author: Austen K.

description: Love this place. We have been going here for more than ten years. Food is fresh, staff is nice. They have nice options for vegetarians as well as meat eaters. It's just for take out, would not want to eat in. You won't be disappointed.
author: Liz W.

description: I recently ate Mexican food. It is one of the best Mexican food I tasted and very cheap. Plan to go there again.
author: Noor s.

description: Great food! Cant beat the price either... I drive 20 mins just to get food from here!
author: Matt S.

description: less than $5 for a burrito and a dam good burrito at that! i just get the regular burrito rather than the big bronco or super burrito because it's big enough. make sure to ask for the red salsa cuz it's spicy and tangy and you can just drink it cuz it's so good. i know there are a ton of good mexican places in the city, but this one is a must have.
author: Chris O.

description:
i'm always looking for a great local taqueria.  i never thought i'd find one in the avenues.  definitely my favorite taqueria on the west side of the city!

i love their vegetarian special and their chicken burrito.  i've never been disappointed.  great quality for the price.  

word of caution, if you went to this place a long time ago, i heard it was under different management and poor quality.  please do not write it off.  i never went there when it was supposedly under that management, but it is delicious now!  and that's what matter.
author: elizabeth m.

description: The (carne asada) Expresso Burrito is MONEY! For a couple xtra dollars, the Surf n Turf Burrito is also good. The location on Divisadero is better than the one on Taraval.
author: Mack D.

description: when i asked my roommate what he thought, he said the veggie burrito sucked, but he never had the meat.  i was willing to give the meat a chance.  i made a mistake.  i should have listened because the food was just... sub-par.  the meat didn't taste fresh and the burrito was covered in sauce.  that's not always a bad thing, but if you're gonna do it, do it well.  this place did not.
author: Rafael L.

description: if you're out in the suset burrito express will be your primary destination for mexican food. the place is solid and its not too expensive. you're in and out pretty quick and they rarely mess up your order.
author: Andrew D.

description: Great tasted mexican food and affordable. Bronco burritos are the best, just the right size. chips are yummy, also good guacamole! This is definitely our family's burrito place.
author: Jie K.

description: i called to order and they just left me hanging and they didn't even tell me to hold on waited for about 5 mins there so careless about what goes on you're order. they didn't ask me what i wanted on my burrito and then they called back saying that the min order is 10 to deliver so they add chips and guac which was a bad idea because i had to throw away the guac the next morning waste of my 3-5 bucks. this my 2nd time ordering and they don't care about the customers to much why have a delivery option when you guys can't handle phone calls when there trying to order. i was giving them a second chance but there careless. i always have the same issue with this place don't know why but they don't know how to treat customers well. i'm going to chiptole next time.
author: Mybraceletsify L.

description: damn this place is bomb, i love the super bronco with avocado, i really liek that they grill the tortilla with cheese so it gets all melty and warm, yummmmm
author: Jennifer C.

description: i really like el burrito express there chicken burrito's are awesome and its really close walking distance to my house, but today my roomate found a staple in his burrito...that sucks because i like the food, but i wont be going there anymore..:(
author: Cristina I.

description: I've had two friends now rave to me about the burritos at this random taqueria way out in the Sunset. So between running errands in the Inner Richmond and West Portal last night, I trekked way out here just to grab a the shrimp and veggie burrito my roommate told me about. As I stopped at every darn four-way intersection on the 20-block detour to my next errand I cursed to myself that it better be worth it. It was. These are burritos I'd drive across a bridge for, forget just across town. They have some unusual options on the specials board, which is where I found the shrimp one full of fresh avocado, mixed veggies (zucchini, onions, peppers, potatoes, etc.), rice, beans, spicy salsa and cheese. The shrimp were high-quality and in a very flavorful sauce. Can't wait to try the other options too... they had a snapper and black bean burrito that sounded really good and on the healthy side (nice to have options other than greasy meat with cheese and sour cream).
author: Shoshana D.

description: super steak or super chicken...better than anything in NY and everything else I've tried all up and down the pacific coast. go to burrito spot! gotta love it
author: Alexander B.

description: Ok, went there subsequently 2-3 times. The people are pretty friendly now and they have gotten every order (even the special orders) correct so I have added 2 more stars. Nice to see positive improvements. Hope they keep it up.
author: Panda W.

description: their chicken tamales are amazing! for $2 something you get a huge tamal smothered in this cheesey red enchilada-type sauce. oooooh so good. their carne asada nachos also rock my socks off.
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: not so express when they are too busy but inexpensive and closer fix to a burrito craving w/o making a trip to the Mission.
author: Tessa M.

description: mmm... i love the steak expresso burrito with extra sauce.. it makes my day super happy :-)
author: Jenn Y.

description: this has been a neighborhood favorite forever.  its cheap and pretty damn big for $5.  i went to this place like forever.  been getting a burrito at this place since i was in middle school.  still love the steak burrito.   i dont eat mexican much, but i grew up on the burrito from this place.
author: Peter L.

description: not the bes but can sometime hit the spot depending on your mood like i was pissed off and had a burrito and it was good and i shocked me prices are ok even tho they jooke you on the cheese&beef quesadilla that says $2.50 on the menu and they charge you upwards of $5 depending on the mood of the person taking your order
author: T L.

description: Burritos here are big and filling. I always order the grilled steak bronco burrito. Always a line during lunch or dinner time. Not much parking around.
author: Happy G.

description:
yummy mexican food on the go!!! been coming here for years and i'm so glad it's in my 'hood. i usually stick to the burritos...i love the house special expresso burrito: yummy red sauce & extra cheese, another dollop of guacamole on top of this huge burrito good enough to share btwn 2 ppl (or one super hungry mofo). other than that, their other sized burritos are delicious. 

nachos are eh...really good if eaten right then and there b/c they use the real grated cheese but not so good if u take it to go (unless u like looking at cold, plasticy cheese)

burritos run between $5-10 (depends on size) but they they pack it on!!
author: Yolanda L.

description: I have been going to El Burrito Express 15 years.  Don't let the name fool you, these guys make the best burritos in the city.  Usually I just get plain old rice, beans, and cheese burritos but I have yet to find any other place that does it better an believe me I have tried.  I'd guess its all the cheese they use, but man, you'd think anyone could do that.
author: Dan A.

description: Beware...This burrito shop is a insult to the art of mexican food. If you want a soggy, nasty, boring burrito...go. Otherwise you are much better off ANYWERE else. Try La Playa or go to the mission. I hate to say, but I have tried this place numerous times and have been dissapointed every time.
author: Paul H.

description: sour cream chicken expresso burrito is good and inexpensive--$6 and change, I believe. cums with chips and green saus (if you ask for it). delicious! i'll be back to try some of their other offerings.
author: Kan L.

description: I have been eating at this place & the sister location on Divisadero for 15 plus years.  The Super Bronco & Expresso burritos are superb.  The Super Bronco is good for those who do not like rice in their burritos.  The prices are reasonable (about $5.25), and I have never gotten sick here.
author: JERRY D.

description:
this is my place of choice on a friday night when i'm too lazy to put on anything other than sweats to grab a bite to eat. 

that said the food is quite tasty if not fancy. it's hard to go wrong with any of the choices, but my fave is the chicken expresso burrito. i always tell myself i'll save some of it for lunch the next day, but alas, i always finish it.

that's why i wear sweats.

check it out.
author: Phil T.

description: this is a very quick and authentic burrito place. if you need something that is actually good that u dont need to go all the way down town for u should go hear.
author: avery N.

description: I've been going to El Burrito for the past ten or so years, and I'll probably continue to do so until I either leave the city or die (whichever comes first). El Burrito is conveniently located and is easy to get to by car or public transit, they heat tortillas up on their grill rather than pop them in steamers, which always leave the tortilla sticky and soggy, and they make their own chips. Food is consistently delicious, staff is efficient and friendly if you're a regular, and the prices are very reasonable. My favorite burrito is the regular cheese with pinto beans, lettuce, hot sauce, and sour cream - yum!
author: Lena B.

description: Nothing beats a good burrito spot.  After 3 hours of basketball and the expenditure of glycogen levels with your body starving for carbohydrates, your body yearns for a fattie burrito.  This place screams value.  You get your nutrients replenished with a median price of 5 bucks.  This place, however, does warrant a drive thru.  Master double parkers are good at blocking cars out front to run inside to grab a burrito, but beware of sneaky meter maids.  The meter maids in the Taraval area are perhaps the most clever swindlers in the city (with exception to the sneaky ones down in the financial district).   The key is to bring a burrito accomplice to monitor the car while one is inside ordering the "Bronco" Burrito.  I don't know how they derived this term, but even a "Raider" fan like myself can like a "Bronco" every now and then.  It's the only "Bronco" I've ever liked.
author: Rex J.

description: I bought my first ever burrito here over 10 years ago. They still have the great same taste and low prices. The hot sauce they use in their burritos is their secret weapon. I always say "yes" when they ask if I want hot sauce. They give you free chips which they make fresh all day. Those chips go great with your food. I love it when the cashier lady yells out "bronco y steak" after my order. She has the cutest accent, although I don't think she works there anymore. Their melon "fresca" was recently added to the menu. It's one of the best fresca's in the city. I haven't been there in a while since I work and live so far away, but I'll definitely stop by the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Mack F.

description: Mannnn...where can I get a good burrito around here? That's what practically every guy/girl says out in the sunset. So without having to drive all the way to the mission, this lil hole in the wall kicks ass! Definitely filling. & those of you counting calories??  FORGET it!! The bad side? sometimes hard to find parking. And if you're coming in the afternoon on the weekday... get in line behind all the kids from Lincoln & SI!  Still...worth the wait. Don't forget to ask for extra salsa
author: perry c.

description:
the best steak burritos, the best steak nachos with lots of toppings
and the price it right.
author: dine dine t.

description: i use to come here for lunch when i went to h.s. a few blocks away. for 5-6 bucks their burritoes are totally worth it. you can order it w/ spinach, tomato, or wheat tortilla if you like. cheese quesidillas are only 85 cents if you just want a little snack. their nachos are pretty good here too. the ladies who work here don't speak the best english and usually mess up on something you order. so i'm always glancing over the glass ready to make a move if they mess up. the place is really tiny w/ a little counter to sit down, so i suggest taking it to go. your burritos always come w/ a baggie of chips, but if you order several they'll only give you 2 baggies - so stand up for your rights and tell them to give you a chip bag for each burrito you order! There's really no other place to go for decent burritos in the sunset besides Gordo's, and there's not parking there, so this prob the best go-to place for burritos in the sunset.
author: Douglas F.
